entries: If the nerra succeeds on a saving throw against a spell or magical effect or is missed by a spell attack that only targets the nerra, the nerra takes no damage and the effect or attack is reflected back to the caster, which must make a save against the spell or roll to hit against itself.
optionalfeature.effect: If the nerra succeeds on a saving throw against a spell or magical effect or is missed by a spell attack that only targets the nerra, the nerra takes no damage and the effect or attack is reflected back to the caster, which must make a save against the spell or roll to hit against itself.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Maw
entries: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a scimitar attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the nkosi can immediately make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a scimitar attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is knocked {@condition prone}, the nkosi can immediately make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Maw
entries: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a scimitar attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the nkosi can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the nkosi moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a scimitar attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the nkosi can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Rage
entries: If the ogre berserker has 84 hit points or fewer, it can choose to attack with disadvantage but add 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to each hit. If the ogre berserker has 42 or fewer hit points, it can choose to attack with disadvantage to add 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage on a hit.
optionalfeature.effect: If the ogre berserker has 84 hit points or fewer, it can choose to attack with disadvantage but add 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to each hit. If the ogre berserker has 42 or fewer hit points, it can choose to attack with disadvantage to add 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage on a hit.

optionalfeature.name: Trunk Slam
entries: If the oliphaunt starts its turn with a target {@condition grappled}, it can slam the target into the ground as a bonus action. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This doesn't end the {@condition grappled} condition on the target.
optionalfeature.effect: If the oliphaunt starts its turn with a target {@condition grappled}, it can slam the target into the ground as a bonus action. The creature must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This doesn't end the {@condition grappled} condition on the target.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Panic
entries: If the paolumu is {@condition blinded} while flying, it immediately falls to the ground and is knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: If the paolumu is {@condition blinded} while flying, it immediately falls to the ground and is knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Blind Panick
entries: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panicks, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: If the paolumu is flying and becomes {@condition blinded}. It panicks, ending its enlarge and falls {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Injection (1/day)
entries: If the pest hits a creature with its stinger, it can inject a larger dose of poison. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.
optionalfeature.effect: If the pest hits a creature with its stinger, it can inject a larger dose of poison. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Precise Aim
entries: If the plains gnoll archer does not move during its turn, it adds {@dice 1d8} to its attack roll with its shortbow.
optionalfeature.effect: If the plains gnoll archer does not move during its turn, it adds {@dice 1d8} to its attack roll with its shortbow.

optionalfeature.name: Moon Dragon Thrall
entries: If the quicksilver fails its saving throw against a moon dragon's Hypnotic Presence ability, it is permanently {@condition charmed} by the dragon instead of suffering the normal effects. While {@condition charmed}, the quicksilver views the dragon as its master and obeys its commands without question.
optionalfeature.effect: If the quicksilver fails its saving throw against a moon dragon's Hypnotic Presence ability, it is permanently {@condition charmed} by the dragon instead of suffering the normal effects. While {@condition charmed}, the quicksilver views the dragon as its master and obeys its commands without question.

optionalfeature.name: Sensitive Ears
entries: If the qurupeco takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: If the qurupeco takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Marking (Barbclaw only)
entries: If the rageborn hits a creature with its claws, it can mark that creature. The rageborn has advantage on attack rolls against a creature it marked. If it marks another creature, the previous creature is no longer marked.
optionalfeature.effect: If the rageborn hits a creature with its claws, it can mark that creature. The rageborn has advantage on attack rolls against a creature it marked. If it marks another creature, the previous creature is no longer marked.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Charge (Horror only)
entries: If the rageborn moves at least 15 feet in a straight line and hits with a claw, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.
optionalfeature.effect: If the rageborn moves at least 15 feet in a straight line and hits with a claw, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Surprise Bite
entries: If the rageipede surprises a creature and hits it with a bite attack during the first round of combat, the target has disadvantage on its saving throw against the rage caused by the rageipede's bite.
optionalfeature.effect: If the rageipede surprises a creature and hits it with a bite attack during the first round of combat, the target has disadvantage on its saving throw against the rage caused by the rageipede's bite.

optionalfeature.name: Packing Heat
entries: If the ratfolk mercenary moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a shortsword attack on the same turn, the mercenary can make one dart attack against another target within 20 feet as a bonus action without disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: If the ratfolk mercenary moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a shortsword attack on the same turn, the mercenary can make one dart attack against another target within 20 feet as a bonus action without disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Reckless Charge
entries: If the reaver moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, it has advantage on its next melee weapon attack roll against that target.
optionalfeature.effect: If the reaver moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target, it has advantage on its next melee weapon attack roll against that target.

optionalfeature.name: Come Together (3/Day)
entries: If the shard swarm has at least 1 hit point and all of its pieces are within 30 feet of each other, the pieces can re-form as a bonus action in any space containing at least one of its pieces.
optionalfeature.effect: If the shard swarm has at least 1 hit point and all of its pieces are within 30 feet of each other, the pieces can re-form as a bonus action in any space containing at least one of its pieces.

optionalfeature.name: World-Class Bowmanship
entries: If the sharpshooter has disadvantage on attack rolls made with its longbow, it can choose to ignore the disadvantage. If it does so, it cannot benefit from effects that would grant it advantage on the attack.
optionalfeature.effect: If the sharpshooter has disadvantage on attack rolls made with its longbow, it can choose to ignore the disadvantage. If it does so, it cannot benefit from effects that would grant it advantage on the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Rolling Charge
entries: If the shoggoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the creature is knocked {@condition prone}, the shoggoth immediately moves into the creature's space as a bonus action and crushes the creature beneath its bulk. The crushed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the shoggoth's turns. A crushed creature remains in its space and does not move with the shoggoth. A crushed creature can escape by using an action and making a successful {@dc 19} Strength check. On a success, the creature crawls into an empty space within 5 feet of the shoggoth.
optionalfeature.effect: If the shoggoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the creature is knocked {@condition prone}, the shoggoth immediately moves into the creature's space as a bonus action and crushes the creature beneath its bulk. The crushed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the shoggoth's turns. A crushed creature remains in its space and does not move with the shoggoth. A crushed creature can escape by using an action and making a successful {@dc 19} Strength check. On a success, the creature crawls into an empty space within 5 feet of the shoggoth.

optionalfeature.name: Bend Fate (3/Day)
entries: If the skein witch fails a saving throw, she may choose to succeed instead and reflect the effect of the failed saving throw onto one enemy within 30 feet. The skein witch still suffers the effect of a successful saving throw, if any. The new target is entitled to a saving throw as if it were the original target of the attack, but with disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: If the skein witch fails a saving throw, she may choose to succeed instead and reflect the effect of the failed saving throw onto one enemy within 30 feet. The skein witch still suffers the effect of a successful saving throw, if any. The new target is entitled to a saving throw as if it were the original target of the attack, but with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Infest Vermin
entries: If the skitterhaunt damages a Medium or smaller beast, it can try to infest it as a bonus action. The damaged creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure. If the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0, the skitterhaunt has devoured the creature's insides and the affected becomes a skitterhaunt, retaining its outward shell but replacing its flesh with skitterhaunt ooze.
optionalfeature.effect: If the skitterhaunt damages a Medium or smaller beast, it can try to infest it as a bonus action. The damaged creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or become {@condition poisoned} until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 ({@dice 1d10}) on a failure. If the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0, the skitterhaunt has devoured the creature's insides and the affected becomes a skitterhaunt, retaining its outward shell but replacing its flesh with skitterhaunt ooze.

optionalfeature.name: Stalker
entries: If the snow cat surprises a creature and hits it with a bite attack, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.
optionalfeature.effect: If the snow cat surprises a creature and hits it with a bite attack, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.

optionalfeature.name: Worms
entries: If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Infested Form feature and its Burrowing Worm and Wormburst actions.
optionalfeature.effect: If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Infested Form feature and its Burrowing Worm and Wormburst actions.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Charge (1/Day)
entries: If the spectral steed moves at least 20 feet in a straight line through at least one other creature, one creature of the spectral steed's choice that it moved through must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. The target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage and has its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until it finishes a long rest on a failed saving throw, or takes half as much damage on a successful one. If the creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, it dies.
optionalfeature.effect: If the spectral steed moves at least 20 feet in a straight line through at least one other creature, one creature of the spectral steed's choice that it moved through must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. The target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) cold damage and has its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken until it finishes a long rest on a failed saving throw, or takes half as much damage on a successful one. If the creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, it dies.

optionalfeature.name: Spore Flight
entries: If the spore lord is not {@condition incapacitated}, it can transform into a spore cloud at the start of its move. While in this form, the spore lord gains a 40-foot fly speed, immunity to the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} , {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained} and {@condition stunned} conditions (if it was subject to any of these conditions, the condition immediately ends), can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the spore lord can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny spore. The spore lord can't regain hit points, gain temporary hit points or use any action other than dash or dodge while in this form. It may assume its normal form at the start or end of its move on the same or any following turn. If the spore lord shares its space with another creature while in this form, that creature must immediately make a Save against the spore lord's spore cloud ability.
optionalfeature.effect: If the spore lord is not {@condition incapacitated}, it can transform into a spore cloud at the start of its move. While in this form, the spore lord gains a 40-foot fly speed, immunity to the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} , {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained} and {@condition stunned} conditions (if it was subject to any of these conditions, the condition immediately ends), can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the spore lord can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny spore. The spore lord can't regain hit points, gain temporary hit points or use any action other than dash or dodge while in this form. It may assume its normal form at the start or end of its move on the same or any following turn. If the spore lord shares its space with another creature while in this form, that creature must immediately make a Save against the spore lord's spore cloud ability.

optionalfeature.name: Leaping Attack
entries: If the swolbold uses the Dash action on its turn and stops within 5 feet of a creature, it can make one slam attack with disadvantage as a bonus action against that creature.
optionalfeature.effect: If the swolbold uses the Dash action on its turn and stops within 5 feet of a creature, it can make one slam attack with disadvantage as a bonus action against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Seeping Poison
entries: If the target of the vorins spit attack is wearing armor, then the poison needs one round to seep through gaps in the armor and contact the targets skin. The target or an adjacent ally can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity check; success indicates the poison was scraped off completely before it penetrated the armor. An edged weapon or tool must be used. Any slashing weapon and most piercing weapons will do the job. Note that only the vorins spit needs to seep through armor; poison from its sting does not.
optionalfeature.effect: If the target of the vorins spit attack is wearing armor, then the poison needs one round to seep through gaps in the armor and contact the targets skin. The target or an adjacent ally can use an action to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity check; success indicates the poison was scraped off completely before it penetrated the armor. An edged weapon or tool must be used. Any slashing weapon and most piercing weapons will do the job. Note that only the vorins spit needs to seep through armor; poison from its sting does not.

optionalfeature.name: Protector's Initiative
entries: If the temple dog is entering combat against a clear threat to its temple, it has advantage on its initiative roll.
optionalfeature.effect: If the temple dog is entering combat against a clear threat to its temple, it has advantage on its initiative roll.

optionalfeature.name: Rushing Slam
entries: If the temple dog moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then makes a slam attack against that target, it can make an additional slam attack against a second creature within 5 feet of the first target as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the temple dog moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then makes a slam attack against that target, it can make an additional slam attack against a second creature within 5 feet of the first target as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Blood-bound
entries: If the thrall has not consumed 1 ounce of blood from a vampire within the past week, it is {@condition poisoned} for 1 week and it loses darkvision and its Keen Senses, Limited Regeneration, Spider Climb, and Sunlight Sensitivity traits until it consumes 1 ounce of vampire blood.
optionalfeature.effect: If the thrall has not consumed 1 ounce of blood from a vampire within the past week, it is {@condition poisoned} for 1 week and it loses darkvision and its Keen Senses, Limited Regeneration, Spider Climb, and Sunlight Sensitivity traits until it consumes 1 ounce of vampire blood.

optionalfeature.name: Slither
entries: If the titanoboa hasn't eaten a Huge creature in the last 24 hours, it can move through a space as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing, or 5 feet while squeezing.
optionalfeature.effect: If the titanoboa hasn't eaten a Huge creature in the last 24 hours, it can move through a space as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing, or 5 feet while squeezing.

optionalfeature.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Leap Attack
entries: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the vampire jumps at least 10 feet as part of its movement next to a creature, then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the target is {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned}, the vampire can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Raven's Gifts
entries: If the warlock's raven isn't perched on its shoulder, it loses its Darkvision and its proficiency in Perception.
optionalfeature.effect: If the warlock's raven isn't perched on its shoulder, it loses its Darkvision and its proficiency in Perception.

optionalfeature.name: Lunge
entries: If the wulg moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a Medium or larger creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or the wulg attaches itself to the target (escape {@dc 12}). While the wulg remains attached to a target, the target is {@condition grappled}, and the wulg can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: If the wulg moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a Medium or larger creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or the wulg attaches itself to the target (escape {@dc 12}). While the wulg remains attached to a target, the target is {@condition grappled}, and the wulg can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Fear of Fire
entries: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sensitive Ears
entries: If the yian garuga takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: If the yian garuga takes thunder damage or a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of it, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Tunneler
entries: If two elite kobolds wielding any combination of picks and shovels combine their efforts, they gain a burrow speed of 15 feet through non-rocky soil.
optionalfeature.effect: If two elite kobolds wielding any combination of picks and shovels combine their efforts, they gain a burrow speed of 15 feet through non-rocky soil.

optionalfeature.name: Formkiller
entries: If Vastikan hits a target with three arrows in one round, the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose its native form. Roll on the Reincarnation table to determine the target's new form. The target reverts to its original form after {@footnote 1 hour.|Or does it?} A target that succeeds on its saving throw becomes immune to Formkiller for 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: If Vastikan hits a target with three arrows in one round, the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or lose its native form. Roll on the Reincarnation table to determine the target's new form. The target reverts to its original form after {@footnote 1 hour.|Or does it?} A target that succeeds on its saving throw becomes immune to Formkiller for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: City's Blessing
entries: If within a settlement. While not at 0hp, this creature gains temporary hp each turn equal to the settlement level's.
optionalfeature.effect: If within a settlement. While not at 0hp, this creature gains temporary hp each turn equal to the settlement level's.

optionalfeature.name: Threshold
entries: If you have the specified number of copies of this card in your graveyard, the associated ability is triggered.
optionalfeature.effect: If you have the specified number of copies of this card in your graveyard, the associated ability is triggered.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Drain
entries: Immediately after making a constriction attack against a {@condition grappled} creature, the cave leech can try to drag that creature to its mouth, where it bites the creature automatically and drains its blood, inflicting 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. The target can resist being dragged with a Strength contest against the cave leech; the cave leech must win the contest to drag the character to its mouth. A character who wins this contest does not break the cave leech's grapple. The cave leech can try a Strength contest against every creature it makes a constriction attack against until it wins a Strength contest and drains one creature's blood. It can drain blood from the same creature or a different creature each round, but it must win a Strength contest each time.
optionalfeature.effect: Immediately after making a constriction attack against a {@condition grappled} creature, the cave leech can try to drag that creature to its mouth, where it bites the creature automatically and drains its blood, inflicting 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage. The target can resist being dragged with a Strength contest against the cave leech; the cave leech must win the contest to drag the character to its mouth. A character who wins this contest does not break the cave leech's grapple. The cave leech can try a Strength contest against every creature it makes a constriction attack against until it wins a Strength contest and drains one creature's blood. It can drain blood from the same creature or a different creature each round, but it must win a Strength contest each time.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Words
entries: In addition to Common, a dvarapala can speak one language associated with its patron deity. Abyssal (chaotic or neutral evil deities), Celestial (good deities), or Infernal (lawful evil deities). A dvarapala who serves a neutral deity knows a language that is most appropriate for service to its deity (such as Primordial for a neutral god of elementals or Sylvan for a neutral god of nature).
optionalfeature.effect: In addition to Common, a dvarapala can speak one language associated with its patron deity. Abyssal (chaotic or neutral evil deities), Celestial (good deities), or Infernal (lawful evil deities). A dvarapala who serves a neutral deity knows a language that is most appropriate for service to its deity (such as Primordial for a neutral god of elementals or Sylvan for a neutral god of nature).

optionalfeature.name: Special Equipment
entries: In addition to its weapons, a hunter carries two deep lead bomb, a set of deep lead shackles, and a witch-catcher.
optionalfeature.effect: In addition to its weapons, a hunter carries two deep lead bomb, a set of deep lead shackles, and a witch-catcher.

optionalfeature.name: Hide By Firelight
entries: In an area lit only by nonmagical flame, a firegeist gains a +2 bonus on Stealth checks. This becomes +4 when hiding within the fire.
optionalfeature.effect: In an area lit only by nonmagical flame, a firegeist gains a +2 bonus on Stealth checks. This becomes +4 when hiding within the fire.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Blend
entries: In areas of dim light or darkness, an elder shadow drake is treated as {@condition invisible}. Artificial illumination, such as a lantern or a light or continual flame spell, does not negate this ability; nothing less than true sunlight or a daylight spell does. The drake cannot use its Speed Surge or its Stygian Breath while {@condition invisible}. An elder shadow drake can suspend or resume this ability at will, so long as the drake is in dim light or darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: In areas of dim light or darkness, an elder shadow drake is treated as {@condition invisible}. Artificial illumination, such as a lantern or a light or continual flame spell, does not negate this ability; nothing less than true sunlight or a daylight spell does. The drake cannot use its Speed Surge or its Stygian Breath while {@condition invisible}. An elder shadow drake can suspend or resume this ability at will, so long as the drake is in dim light or darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: In battle, the inheritor is surrounded and protected by ancestral spirits, the souls of its ancestors. The first time the inheritor hits a creature with a melee weapon attack on its turn, the creature becomes the target of the ancestral spirits, hindering its attacks. The target has disadvantage on attacks rolls until the start of the inheritor's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: In battle, the inheritor is surrounded and protected by ancestral spirits, the souls of its ancestors. The first time the inheritor hits a creature with a melee weapon attack on its turn, the creature becomes the target of the ancestral spirits, hindering its attacks. The target has disadvantage on attacks rolls until the start of the inheritor's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Friend to Darkness
entries: In darkness or dim light, the mamura has advantage on Stealth checks. It can attempt to hide as a bonus action at the end of its turn if it's in dim light or darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: In darkness or dim light, the mamura has advantage on Stealth checks. It can attempt to hide as a bonus action at the end of its turn if it's in dim light or darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Watery Camouflage
entries: In dim light or darkness, a rusalka that's underwater is {@condition invisible}.
optionalfeature.effect: In dim light or darkness, a rusalka that's underwater is {@condition invisible}.

optionalfeature.name: Leafy Camouflage
entries: In leafy surroundings (trees, brush), a kech has tactical advantage on Stealth checks.
optionalfeature.effect: In leafy surroundings (trees, brush), a kech has tactical advantage on Stealth checks.

optionalfeature.name: Winter Hunter
entries: In natural, wintry surroundings, a hoar fox has tactical advantage on both Perception and Stealth checks.
optionalfeature.effect: In natural, wintry surroundings, a hoar fox has tactical advantage on both Perception and Stealth checks.

optionalfeature.name: Snow Invisibility
entries: In snowy environments, the ice maiden can turn {@condition invisible} as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: In snowy environments, the ice maiden can turn {@condition invisible} as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Too Big to Notice
entries: In spite of its immensity, the sheer size of the Jotun giant often causes those near it to confuse one at rest for part of the landscape. The jotun has advantage on Stealth checks when not moving.
optionalfeature.effect: In spite of its immensity, the sheer size of the Jotun giant often causes those near it to confuse one at rest for part of the landscape. The jotun has advantage on Stealth checks when not moving.

optionalfeature.name: Poisonous Weapons
entries: In the blight's hand, its weapon deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and applies the {@condition poisoned} condition (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: In the blight's hand, its weapon deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and applies the {@condition poisoned} condition (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the ice wraith can make a Freezing Bite attack as a bonus action and has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.
optionalfeature.effect: In the first round of a combat, the ice wraith can make a Freezing Bite attack as a bonus action and has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Club
entries: In the wood woad's hand, its club is magical and deals 7 ({@damage 3d4}) extra damage (included in its attacks).
optionalfeature.effect: In the wood woad's hand, its club is magical and deals 7 ({@damage 3d4}) extra damage (included in its attacks).

optionalfeature.name: Mind Blank, Weir
entries: ind blank, weird
optionalfeature.effect: ind blank, weird

optionalfeature.name: Retraction
entries: Instead of moving, a flail snail can pull its fleshy parts back into its shell, increasing its armor class to 22, but it can't move or take actions while retracted. Extending itself again also takes the place of any other movement that turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Instead of moving, a flail snail can pull its fleshy parts back into its shell, increasing its armor class to 22, but it can't move or take actions while retracted. Extending itself again also takes the place of any other movement that turn.

optionalfeature.name: Sand Step
entries: Instead of moving, the anubian's humanoid form collapses into loose sand and immediately reforms at another unoccupied space within 10 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. After using this trait in sand terrain, the anubian can Hide as part of this movement even if under direct observation. Anubians can sand step under doors or through similar obstacles, provided there's a gap large enough for sand to sift through.
optionalfeature.effect: Instead of moving, the anubian's humanoid form collapses into loose sand and immediately reforms at another unoccupied space within 10 feet. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. After using this trait in sand terrain, the anubian can Hide as part of this movement even if under direct observation. Anubians can sand step under doors or through similar obstacles, provided there's a gap large enough for sand to sift through.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Shift
entries: Instead of moving, the tree woad can shift its essence into a Large tree within 60 feet. If it does so, its body turns into a mundane Large tree, club and shield melding into its form and the target tree becomes the tree woad's new body, parts of the tree reforming its club and shield. Any damage the tree woad has taken and conditions it is currently affected by are transferred to its new body. Objects, plants, and fungus that are attached to the target tree are unharmed by the transformation and remain attached to the tree woad, being uprooted from the ground along with it, but continuing to be nourished by the tree woad. If the tree woad shifts into a different tree, all uprooted plants attached to it root themselves once again as the tree transforms back to its natural state. The target tree of this ability must be Large, it cannot be bigger or smaller.
optionalfeature.effect: Instead of moving, the tree woad can shift its essence into a Large tree within 60 feet. If it does so, its body turns into a mundane Large tree, club and shield melding into its form and the target tree becomes the tree woad's new body, parts of the tree reforming its club and shield. Any damage the tree woad has taken and conditions it is currently affected by are transferred to its new body. Objects, plants, and fungus that are attached to the target tree are unharmed by the transformation and remain attached to the tree woad, being uprooted from the ground along with it, but continuing to be nourished by the tree woad. If the tree woad shifts into a different tree, all uprooted plants attached to it root themselves once again as the tree transforms back to its natural state. The target tree of this ability must be Large, it cannot be bigger or smaller.

optionalfeature.name: Frozen Aura
entries: Intense cold radiates from the golem in an aura with a 20-foot radius. A creature that starts its turn in that area takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. Additionally, the ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: Intense cold radiates from the golem in an aura with a 20-foot radius. A creature that starts its turn in that area takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. Additionally, the ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Defender
entries: It is the sacred duty of a church grim to defend the bodies and souls of those buried in its churchyard. Casting animate dead or a similar spell within the confines of a church grim's domain requires a successful {@dc 15} concentration check by the caster. If the check fails, the spell slot fizzles away just as if it had been cast. Whether the check succeeds or not, the caster immediately attracts the attention and the wrath of the church grim.
optionalfeature.effect: It is the sacred duty of a church grim to defend the bodies and souls of those buried in its churchyard. Casting animate dead or a similar spell within the confines of a church grim's domain requires a successful {@dc 15} concentration check by the caster. If the check fails, the spell slot fizzles away just as if it had been cast. Whether the check succeeds or not, the caster immediately attracts the attention and the wrath of the church grim.

optionalfeature.name: Goblin's Trumpet
entries: It takes {@dice 1d4} days for the infected creature to start showing symptoms, which include shortness of breath and increased sensitivity to sunlight. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight when it or whatever it is trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one and the disease intensifies. After one failed save, the creature has a strong desire to surround itself with as many creatures as possible. After two failed saves, the creature becomes more irritable and violent. If the infected creature has 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion} (hit points halved), spines of fungus erupt from its body, killing it, and the fungus takes full control of the creature's corpse. It gains the Explosive Death trait and Bite and Vomit Spores attacks from the afflicted cave goblin's stat block.
optionalfeature.effect: It takes {@dice 1d4} days for the infected creature to start showing symptoms, which include shortness of breath and increased sensitivity to sunlight. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight when it or whatever it is trying to perceive is in direct sunlight. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one and the disease intensifies. After one failed save, the creature has a strong desire to surround itself with as many creatures as possible. After two failed saves, the creature becomes more irritable and violent. If the infected creature has 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion} (hit points halved), spines of fungus erupt from its body, killing it, and the fungus takes full control of the creature's corpse. It gains the Explosive Death trait and Bite and Vomit Spores attacks from the afflicted cave goblin's stat block.

optionalfeature.name: Camouflaged Webs
entries: It takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the j'ba fofi's web. A creature that fails to notice a web and comes into contact with it is {@condition restrained} by the web. A {@condition restrained} creature can pull free from the web by using an action and making a successful {@dc 12} Strength check. The web can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerable to fire damage; immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).
optionalfeature.effect: It takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the j'ba fofi's web. A creature that fails to notice a web and comes into contact with it is {@condition restrained} by the web. A {@condition restrained} creature can pull free from the web by using an action and making a successful {@dc 12} Strength check. The web can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerable to fire damage; immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

optionalfeature.name: Immortality
entries: Jotuns suffer no ill effects from age and are immune to life drain, and effects that reduce ability scores and hit point maximum.
optionalfeature.effect: Jotuns suffer no ill effects from age and are immune to life drain, and effects that reduce ability scores and hit point maximum.

optionalfeature.name: Extinguish Flames
entries: Kalkes can extinguish candles, lamps, lanterns and low-burning campfires within 120 feet as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: Kalkes can extinguish candles, lamps, lanterns and low-burning campfires within 120 feet as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Rune Weapons
entries: Kept keen with runic magic, runespears and runestaves are two-handed weapons that count as magical, though they provide no bonus to attack. Their magic must be renewed each week by a doom croaker or by Odin's own hand.
optionalfeature.effect: Kept keen with runic magic, runespears and runestaves are two-handed weapons that count as magical, though they provide no bonus to attack. Their magic must be renewed each week by a doom croaker or by Odin's own hand.

optionalfeature.name: Quickload
entries: Kobold air cavalry ignore the loading quality of light crossbows.
optionalfeature.effect: Kobold air cavalry ignore the loading quality of light crossbows.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instinct
entries: lao-shan Lung ignores medium size or smaller creatures and attempts to flee when it reaches 1/4 of its maximum hit points (153). While fleeing, the lao-shan Lung can only use its action to dash.
optionalfeature.effect: lao-shan Lung ignores medium size or smaller creatures and attempts to flee when it reaches 1/4 of its maximum hit points (153). While fleeing, the lao-shan Lung can only use its action to dash.

optionalfeature.name: Crush the Weak
entries: Large or smaller creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made against the giant's attacks.
optionalfeature.effect: Large or smaller creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made against the giant's attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Metal Immunity
entries: Lava children are completely unaffected by metal. They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.
optionalfeature.effect: Lava children are completely unaffected by metal. They can walk through metal doors or bars as if the metal wasn't there, and metal objects and weapons, including magic weapons, pass right through a lava child's body without affecting it in any way. Because of this, a lava child also has tactical advantage on melee attack rolls against targets wearing armor that is predominantly metal.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Vulnerability
entries: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.
optionalfeature.effect: Lava children take 1 extra damage per damage die from spells of the tempest domain. They are unaffected (either directly or indirectly) by spells of the transmutation school.

optionalfeature.name: Control Elemental
entries: Lava weirds have the ability to dominate elementals of the earth or fire type. When the lava weird uses an action to issue a command to an elemental within 50 feet, the elemental must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be dominated. The effect is permanent, but the elemental is allowed to repeat the saving throw if it is commanded to do something that will clearly result in its own destruction. An elemental that makes a successful save is not dominated and is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Theres no limit to the number of elementals a lava weird can control. Once domination is established, it has no range limitation, provided the lava weird and the elemental remain on the same plane of existence. Lava weirds are immune to this effect.
optionalfeature.effect: Lava weirds have the ability to dominate elementals of the earth or fire type. When the lava weird uses an action to issue a command to an elemental within 50 feet, the elemental must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be dominated. The effect is permanent, but the elemental is allowed to repeat the saving throw if it is commanded to do something that will clearly result in its own destruction. An elemental that makes a successful save is not dominated and is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Theres no limit to the number of elementals a lava weird can control. Once domination is established, it has no range limitation, provided the lava weird and the elemental remain on the same plane of existence. Lava weirds are immune to this effect.

optionalfeature.name: See in Darkness
entries: Light conditions are reversed in effect for dark stalkers. They treat complete darkness as bright light and bright light as complete darkness. A dark stalker sees perfectly in darkness of any kind, including magical darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: Light conditions are reversed in effect for dark stalkers. They treat complete darkness as bright light and bright light as complete darkness. A dark stalker sees perfectly in darkness of any kind, including magical darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Aura
entries: Lightning sparks off of the lagiacrus into the surrounding area. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the Lagiacrus takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Lightning damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Lightning sparks off of the lagiacrus into the surrounding area. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the Lagiacrus takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Dual State
entries: Like its nihileth creator, a nihilethic zombie can assume either a material or ethereal form. When in its material form, it has resistance to nonmagical weapons. In its ethereal form, it is immune to nonmagical weapons. Its ethereal form appears as a dark purple outline of its material form, with a blackish-purple haze within.
optionalfeature.effect: Like its nihileth creator, a nihilethic zombie can assume either a material or ethereal form. When in its material form, it has resistance to nonmagical weapons. In its ethereal form, it is immune to nonmagical weapons. Its ethereal form appears as a dark purple outline of its material form, with a blackish-purple haze within.

optionalfeature.name: Distending Maw
entries: Like snakes, nightgarms can open their mouths far wider than other creatures of similar size. This ability grants it a formidable bite and allows it to swallow creatures up to Medium size.
optionalfeature.effect: Like snakes, nightgarms can open their mouths far wider than other creatures of similar size. This ability grants it a formidable bite and allows it to swallow creatures up to Medium size.

optionalfeature.name: Skittering Skater
entries: Lindwurms suffer no penalties from difficult terrain on ice and are immune to the effects of the grease spell.
optionalfeature.effect: Lindwurms suffer no penalties from difficult terrain on ice and are immune to the effects of the grease spell.

optionalfeature.name: Lightform
entries: Liosalfar are composed entirely of light. They are incorporeal and not subject to ability damage, polymorph, petrification, or attacks that alter their form.
optionalfeature.effect: Liosalfar are composed entirely of light. They are incorporeal and not subject to ability damage, polymorph, petrification, or attacks that alter their form.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Glow
entries: Liosalfar shed rainbow illumination equal to a daylight spell. They cannot extinguish this glow without perishing but can reduce it to the level of torchlight at will. Even when using alter self they have a faint, diffused glow that's visible in dim light or darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: Liosalfar shed rainbow illumination equal to a daylight spell. They cannot extinguish this glow without perishing but can reduce it to the level of torchlight at will. Even when using alter self they have a faint, diffused glow that's visible in dim light or darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Dread
entries: Living creatures with line of sight to one or more sepulchral guardians and within 50 feet of them must make a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. A successful save renders the target immune to any guardians dread for 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: Living creatures with line of sight to one or more sepulchral guardians and within 50 feet of them must make a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. A successful save renders the target immune to any guardians dread for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Controlled
entries: Living wicks cannot move, attack, or perform actions when they are not lit. Living wicks only respond to the telepathic commands of the individual that lit them.
optionalfeature.effect: Living wicks cannot move, attack, or perform actions when they are not lit. Living wicks only respond to the telepathic commands of the individual that lit them.

optionalfeature.name: Freedom of the Wind
entries: Locks, shackles, ropes, and other bindings cannot hold Boreas.
optionalfeature.effect: Locks, shackles, ropes, and other bindings cannot hold Boreas.

optionalfeature.name: Asgardian Battleaxes
entries: Made in Valhalla and kept keen with runic magic, Asgardian axes have a +2 enchantment and add a second die of weapon damage. Their magic must be renewed each week by a valkyrie or Odin's own hand.
optionalfeature.effect: Made in Valhalla and kept keen with runic magic, Asgardian axes have a +2 enchantment and add a second die of weapon damage. Their magic must be renewed each week by a valkyrie or Odin's own hand.

optionalfeature.name: Stuff of Dreams
entries: Made partially from dreams and imagination, a sandman takes only half damage from critical hits and from sneak attacks. All of the attack's damage is halved, not just bonus damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Made partially from dreams and imagination, a sandman takes only half damage from critical hits and from sneak attacks. All of the attack's damage is halved, not just bonus damage.

optionalfeature.name: Elder Sight
entries: Magical Darkness doesn't impede the chameleos's darkvision.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical Darkness doesn't impede the chameleos's darkvision.

optionalfeature.name: Darksight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dark folk's darkvision.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dark folk's darkvision.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Hunter
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dimcat's darkvision, and it treats all locations as though they were brightly lit for the purposes of perceiving objects and creatures.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness doesn't impede the dimcat's darkvision, and it treats all locations as though they were brightly lit for the purposes of perceiving objects and creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Shade's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the elemental's darkvision
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness doesn't impede the elemental's darkvision

optionalfeature.name: Fiend Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the fiend's darkvision.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness doesn't impede the fiend's darkvision.

optionalfeature.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shantak's darkvision.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness doesn't impede the shantak's darkvision.

optionalfeature.name: Darkness Vulnerability
entries: Magical darkness is harmful to a liosalfar: They take {@dice 2d10} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, each time they start their turn inside magical darkness. Natural darkness is unpleasant to them but not harmful.
optionalfeature.effect: Magical darkness is harmful to a liosalfar: They take {@dice 2d10} necrotic damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, each time they start their turn inside magical darkness. Natural darkness is unpleasant to them but not harmful.

optionalfeature.name: Swordtrained
entries: Malphas are trained from youth in combat. They are proficient with all martial melee and ranged weapons.
optionalfeature.effect: Malphas are trained from youth in combat. They are proficient with all martial melee and ranged weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Merciless Ferocity
entries: Mantik has advantage on all opportunity attacks, and a creature reduced to 0 hp by his attacks has disadvantage on its first death saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: Mantik has advantage on all opportunity attacks, and a creature reduced to 0 hp by his attacks has disadvantage on its first death saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cursed
entries: Mantik may not fly, levitate, or be polymorphed by any spell or effect.
optionalfeature.effect: Mantik may not fly, levitate, or be polymorphed by any spell or effect.

optionalfeature.name: Gifted Gamer
entries: Marcus the Magi has advantage on all gaming tools ability checks
optionalfeature.effect: Marcus the Magi has advantage on all gaming tools ability checks

optionalfeature.name: Clumsy
entries: Marcus the Magi has disadvantage on Dexterity Saves and Athletics ability checks.
optionalfeature.effect: Marcus the Magi has disadvantage on Dexterity Saves and Athletics ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Speak with Apes
entries: Mechuiti can communicate simple concepts to apes.
optionalfeature.effect: Mechuiti can communicate simple concepts to apes.

optionalfeature.name: Smite the Weak
entries: Medium or smaller creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made against the verbeeg's spells.
optionalfeature.effect: Medium or smaller creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made against the verbeeg's spells.

optionalfeature.name: Grim Mask
entries: Melee attacks targeting the bloodless wanderer are made with disadvantage. When a creature makes a melee attack targeting it and misses, it takes {@dice 1d6} slashing damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Melee attacks targeting the bloodless wanderer are made with disadvantage. When a creature makes a melee attack targeting it and misses, it takes {@dice 1d6} slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Astral Travelers
entries: Mi-go do not require air or heat to survive, only sunlight (and very little of that). They can enter a sporulated form capable of surviving travel through the void and returning to consciousness when conditions are right.
optionalfeature.effect: Mi-go do not require air or heat to survive, only sunlight (and very little of that). They can enter a sporulated form capable of surviving travel through the void and returning to consciousness when conditions are right.

optionalfeature.name: Mill
entries: Mill effects on your cards are active while the opponent's graveyard contains at least the specified number of cards.
optionalfeature.effect: Mill effects on your cards are active while the opponent's graveyard contains at least the specified number of cards.

optionalfeature.name: Pitted Sockets
entries: Mist swirls in the depths of Belphegor's pit-like eyes. Creatures who look upon Belphegor lose all benefits from their next long rest as they struggle to expel the devil's hollow gaze from their minds.
optionalfeature.effect: Mist swirls in the depths of Belphegor's pit-like eyes. Creatures who look upon Belphegor lose all benefits from their next long rest as they struggle to expel the devil's hollow gaze from their minds.

optionalfeature.name: Simple Construction
entries: Monolith footmen are designed with a delicate fey construction. They burst into pieces and are destroyed when they receive a critical hit.
optionalfeature.effect: Monolith footmen are designed with a delicate fey construction. They burst into pieces and are destroyed when they receive a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Mountain Stride
entries: Mountain slopes and stone outcroppings pose no obstacle to a stuhac's movement. In mountainous areas, it scrambles through difficult terrain without hindrance.
optionalfeature.effect: Mountain slopes and stone outcroppings pose no obstacle to a stuhac's movement. In mountainous areas, it scrambles through difficult terrain without hindrance.

optionalfeature.name: Saddleborn
entries: Mounting or dismounting a creature costs 5 ft. of movement for the standard bearer. It has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount, and if it falls, it can automatically land on it feet if it falls less than 10 feet and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: Mounting or dismounting a creature costs 5 ft. of movement for the standard bearer. It has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount, and if it falls, it can automatically land on it feet if it falls less than 10 feet and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Cave Strider
entries: Moving through nonmagical difcult cavern or underground terrain doesn't cost the choker extra movement.
optionalfeature.effect: Moving through nonmagical difcult cavern or underground terrain doesn't cost the choker extra movement.

optionalfeature.name: Douser of Light
entries: Natural fires and other light sources not worn or carried by a creature are magically extinguished when the sorcerer starts its turn within 30 feet of them. While not in direct sunlight, the sorcerer can choose to magically appear as a black silhouette, granting it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. A {@dc 10} Wisdom (Insight) check exposes the sorcerer's true appearance (but doesn't reveal the sorcerer if it is hidden).
optionalfeature.effect: Natural fires and other light sources not worn or carried by a creature are magically extinguished when the sorcerer starts its turn within 30 feet of them. While not in direct sunlight, the sorcerer can choose to magically appear as a black silhouette, granting it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. A {@dc 10} Wisdom (Insight) check exposes the sorcerer's true appearance (but doesn't reveal the sorcerer if it is hidden).

optionalfeature.name: Home Sick
entries: Naughty works like a {@item Sending Stones| Sending Stone}, whose opposite resides in the Queendom of Anne to talk with Princess Clara.
optionalfeature.effect: Naughty works like a {@item Sending Stones| Sending Stone}, whose opposite resides in the Queendom of Anne to talk with Princess Clara.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Decay
entries: Negative energy radiates from the herald in an aura with 120-foot radius. Any creature in that area can't regain hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: Negative energy radiates from the herald in an aura with 120-foot radius. Any creature in that area can't regain hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Elusive
entries: No attack roll has advantage on the grandfather of assassins as long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: No attack roll has advantage on the grandfather of assassins as long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Bat Passivism
entries: No bats or werebats can willingly attack the Bat King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: No bats or werebats can willingly attack the Bat King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Bird Passivism
entries: No bird or ravenfolk can willingly attack <$name$>.
optionalfeature.effect: No bird or ravenfolk can willingly attack <$name$>.

optionalfeature.name: Bovine Passivism
entries: No bovine creatures or wereboars can willingly attack Brother Ox. They can be forced to do so through magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: No bovine creatures or wereboars can willingly attack Brother Ox. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Cat Passivism
entries: No cats or weretigers can willingly attack the Queen of Cats. They can be forced to do so through magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: No cats or weretigers can willingly attack the Queen of Cats. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: The Law of Motion
entries: No enemies within 60 feet can gain the benefit of magical movement.
optionalfeature.effect: No enemies within 60 feet can gain the benefit of magical movement.

optionalfeature.name: Spider Symbiosis
entries: No ordinary spider will attack the j'ba fofi unless magically controlled or the j'ba fofi attacks it first. In addition, every j'ba fofi is accompanied by a swarm of spiders (a variant of the swarm of insects), which moves and attacks according to the j'ba fofi's mental command (commanding the swarm does not require an action by the j'ba fofi).
optionalfeature.effect: No ordinary spider will attack the j'ba fofi unless magically controlled or the j'ba fofi attacks it first. In addition, every j'ba fofi is accompanied by a swarm of spiders (a variant of the swarm of insects), which moves and attacks according to the j'ba fofi's mental command (commanding the swarm does not require an action by the j'ba fofi).

optionalfeature.name: Rodent Passivism
entries: No rodents, ratfolk, or wererats can willingly attack the Mouse King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: No rodents, ratfolk, or wererats can willingly attack the Mouse King. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Serpent Passivism
entries: No serpents can willingly attack the Queen of Serpents. They can be forced to do so through magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: No serpents can willingly attack the Queen of Serpents. They can be forced to do so through magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Head Start
entries: On its first turn of combat, the centuar can take the dash action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: On its first turn of combat, the centuar can take the dash action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzied Rage
entries: On its next turn after a deep one archimandrite takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its attacks, it adds +4 to damage, and it can make one extra unholy trident attack.
optionalfeature.effect: On its next turn after a deep one archimandrite takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its attacks, it adds +4 to damage, and it can make one extra unholy trident attack.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzied Rage
entries: On its next turn after a deep one hybrid priest takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its melee attacks and adds +4 to spell and claws damage.
optionalfeature.effect: On its next turn after a deep one hybrid priest takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its melee attacks and adds +4 to spell and claws damage.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzied Rage
entries: On its next turn after a deep one takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its claws attack and adds +2 to damage.
optionalfeature.effect: On its next turn after a deep one takes 10 or more damage from a single attack, it has advantage on its claws attack and adds +2 to damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mirror Bound
entries: On the Material Plane, the wraith can only move within the span of reflection of reflective surfaces, such as mirrors, still pools, and polished steel, that are at least a square foot. If it is more than 30 feet away from any such surface, the wraith immediately shifts to the Ethereal Plane.
optionalfeature.effect: On the Material Plane, the wraith can only move within the span of reflection of reflective surfaces, such as mirrors, still pools, and polished steel, that are at least a square foot. If it is more than 30 feet away from any such surface, the wraith immediately shifts to the Ethereal Plane.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Tracking
entries: Once an elusa hound has seen the magical aura of a living creature with its arcane sight ability, or has seen the magical residue of a spell or effect created by a particular spellcaster or other creature, it gets tactical advantage on Survival checks to follow that spellcaster's trail. The trail must be no more than three hours old for the elusa hound to get this bonus.
optionalfeature.effect: Once an elusa hound has seen the magical aura of a living creature with its arcane sight ability, or has seen the magical residue of a spell or effect created by a particular spellcaster or other creature, it gets tactical advantage on Survival checks to follow that spellcaster's trail. The trail must be no more than three hours old for the elusa hound to get this bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Consume Brain
entries: Once it has its victim underground, the cerebral stalker begins gnawing on the victim's head, rapidly chewing through bone and tissue, dealing 13 ({@dice 2d8 + 4}) points of piercing damage each round. When the victim dies, the cerebral stalker reaches its goal: the victim's brain, which it promptly devours. A victim slain in this manner reanimates in {@dice 1d4} rounds as a zombie. Typically, the cerebral stalker tosses them back up to the surface of the ground so their traveling companions can witness the reanimation and deal with their newly undead friend. Zombies created in this manner are under no one's control.
optionalfeature.effect: Once it has its victim underground, the cerebral stalker begins gnawing on the victim's head, rapidly chewing through bone and tissue, dealing 13 ({@dice 2d8 + 4}) points of piercing damage each round. When the victim dies, the cerebral stalker reaches its goal: the victim's brain, which it promptly devours. A victim slain in this manner reanimates in {@dice 1d4} rounds as a zombie. Typically, the cerebral stalker tosses them back up to the surface of the ground so their traveling companions can witness the reanimation and deal with their newly undead friend. Zombies created in this manner are under no one's control.

optionalfeature.name: Totem Stride
entries: Once on its turn, the leshen can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one of his totem within its reach and emerge from a second totem within its territory, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second totem.
optionalfeature.effect: Once on its turn, the leshen can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one of his totem within its reach and emerge from a second totem within its territory, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second totem.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Bones (1/Day)
entries: Once per day as an action, a bone cobbler can animate up to five skeletal statues within 30 feet of itself. These creatures use the stat block of skeletons, though their forms and structures do not need to resemble humanoids or anything remotely humanoid. The skeletal statues remain animated until destroyed, until the bone cobbler wills them back into statues, or for 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day as an action, a bone cobbler can animate up to five skeletal statues within 30 feet of itself. These creatures use the stat block of skeletons, though their forms and structures do not need to resemble humanoids or anything remotely humanoid. The skeletal statues remain animated until destroyed, until the bone cobbler wills them back into statues, or for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Symbol of Discord (1/Day)
entries: Once per day as an action, a darnoc can scribe a symbol of discord in the air. All creatures with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher within 60 feet who see the symbol must make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or immediately fall into loud bickering and arguing with those around him or her. Meaningful communication is impossible while bickering. If creatures of different alignments are affected and bickering, each has a 30% chance that they feel compelled to attack the person they are bickering with who is the most different in alignment. Bickering lasts {@dice 5d4} rounds. Fighting (if it occurs) begins {@dice 1d4} rounds into the bickering and lasts {@dice 2d4} rounds. Once drawn, the darnoc's symbol lasts two hours, making it useful as a temporary trap or delaying tactic.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day as an action, a darnoc can scribe a symbol of discord in the air. All creatures with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher within 60 feet who see the symbol must make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or immediately fall into loud bickering and arguing with those around him or her. Meaningful communication is impossible while bickering. If creatures of different alignments are affected and bickering, each has a 30% chance that they feel compelled to attack the person they are bickering with who is the most different in alignment. Bickering lasts {@dice 5d4} rounds. Fighting (if it occurs) begins {@dice 1d4} rounds into the bickering and lasts {@dice 2d4} rounds. Once drawn, the darnoc's symbol lasts two hours, making it useful as a temporary trap or delaying tactic.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Demonic Aid (1/Day)
entries: Once per day as an action, a demonic knight can summon additional demons to his side. He can summon {@dice 1d4} shadow demons, 2 glabrezus or hezrous, or 1 vrock or marilith. To complete the summoning, the demonic knight must make a successful {@dc 18} Cha check (normally a 50% chance). The summoned demons teleport into empty spaces within 60 feet of the demon knight, of his choosing, and remain until they're slain or for one hour.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day as an action, a demonic knight can summon additional demons to his side. He can summon {@dice 1d4} shadow demons, 2 glabrezus or hezrous, or 1 vrock or marilith. To complete the summoning, the demonic knight must make a successful {@dc 18} Cha check (normally a 50% chance). The summoned demons teleport into empty spaces within 60 feet of the demon knight, of his choosing, and remain until they're slain or for one hour.

optionalfeature.name: Teleport Other (1/Day)
entries: Once per day as an attack, a crypt thing can teleport all creatures within 50 feet of it to another location. A targeted creature resists teleporting with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. Affected creatures are teleported a random distance ({@dice 1d10 x 100} feet) in a random direction. Roll separately for each creature that fails its saving throw. A teleported creature arrives in an open space as close as possible to the determined destination spot. A creature can teleport into midair rather than onto a solid surface, if the crypt thing wishes. A creature that teleports into midair takes falling damage normally unless it has some means to prevent falling.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day as an attack, a crypt thing can teleport all creatures within 50 feet of it to another location. A targeted creature resists teleporting with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. Affected creatures are teleported a random distance ({@dice 1d10 x 100} feet) in a random direction. Roll separately for each creature that fails its saving throw. A teleported creature arrives in an open space as close as possible to the determined destination spot. A creature can teleport into midair rather than onto a solid surface, if the crypt thing wishes. A creature that teleports into midair takes falling damage normally unless it has some means to prevent falling.

optionalfeature.name: Aided Insight
entries: Once per day, a pseudosphinx can tap into the wisdom of its ancestors to answer a question for another creature. To do so, the pseudosphinx attempts a Wisdom check, gaining a bonus on the check equal to the querent's level and treating the result of the check as the result of an appropriate Knowledge check. The pseudosphinx must be touching the querent to use this ability.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day, a pseudosphinx can tap into the wisdom of its ancestors to answer a question for another creature. To do so, the pseudosphinx attempts a Wisdom check, gaining a bonus on the check equal to the querent's level and treating the result of the check as the result of an appropriate Knowledge check. The pseudosphinx must be touching the querent to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Levitate (1/Day)
entries: Once per day, a worker amphoron can cast levitate on itself as an action. No components are required.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per day, a worker amphoron can cast levitate on itself as an action. No components are required.

optionalfeature.name: Sprint
entries: Once per hour, a cooshee can move ten times its normal speed (400 ft.) for one round. When sprinting, it gains tactical advantage on Stealth checks.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per hour, a cooshee can move ten times its normal speed (400 ft.) for one round. When sprinting, it gains tactical advantage on Stealth checks.

optionalfeature.name: Seed
entries: Once per month, a bloodsuckle generates a walnutsized seed that it implants in one host's body. The host's maximum number of hit points reduces by {@dice 1d10} per day. When its maximum hit points reach 0, the host dies and a new bloodsuckle plant erupts from the corpse. A greater restoration or blight spell destroys the seedling.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per month, a bloodsuckle generates a walnutsized seed that it implants in one host's body. The host's maximum number of hit points reduces by {@dice 1d10} per day. When its maximum hit points reach 0, the host dies and a new bloodsuckle plant erupts from the corpse. A greater restoration or blight spell destroys the seedling.

optionalfeature.name: Philosopher's Stone
entries: Once per round when the alkahzir is attacked by a creature, the attacker can target the philosopher's stone trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 11 ({@dice 2d10}) damage to the alkahzir, and the alkahzir gains an additional action on its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per round when the alkahzir is attacked by a creature, the attacker can target the philosopher's stone trapped in it. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 11 ({@dice 2d10}) damage to the alkahzir, and the alkahzir gains an additional action on its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Duplicate Pack Tactics
entries: Once per round when the berbalang hits a creature threatened by another berbalang or berbalang duplicate with a claw attack, it may deal an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage to the target.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per round when the berbalang hits a creature threatened by another berbalang or berbalang duplicate with a claw attack, it may deal an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Lightwalking
entries: Once per round, the lunar devil magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, from one beam of moonlight to another within 80 feet. This relocation uses half of its speed.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per round, the lunar devil magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, from one beam of moonlight to another within 80 feet. This relocation uses half of its speed.

optionalfeature.name: Grim Harvest
entries: Once per turn when a living creature fails a saving throw against or is harmed by one of the necromancer's Necromancy spells of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hp equal to three times the spell's level.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn when a living creature fails a saving throw against or is harmed by one of the necromancer's Necromancy spells of 1st level or higher, the necromancer regains hp equal to three times the spell's level.

optionalfeature.name: Might of the Goddess
entries: Once per turn, the noble can deal an extra 22 ({@dice 5d8}) damage of one of the following types (noble's choice) to a creature it hits with a melee weapon attack: lightning, radiant, or thunder.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, the noble can deal an extra 22 ({@dice 5d8}) damage of one of the following types (noble's choice) to a creature it hits with a melee weapon attack: lightning, radiant, or thunder.

optionalfeature.name: Offensive Stance
entries: Once per turn, the okiti swashbuckler can add {@dice 1d4} to its attack roll.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, the okiti swashbuckler can add {@dice 1d4} to its attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Aim
entries: Once per turn, when the archer makes a ranged attack with its longbow and hits, the target takes an extra 28 ({@dice 8d6}) damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the archer makes a ranged attack with its longbow and hits, the target takes an extra 28 ({@dice 8d6}) damage.

optionalfeature.name: Tansfusion
entries: Once per turn, when the bloodbeast hits a creature with cruorwhip or with a bite attack, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage, and the bloodbeast regains hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.
