optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the bloodbeast hits a creature with cruorwhip or with a bite attack, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage, and the bloodbeast regains hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Might
entries: Once per turn, when the crypt horror hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can deal an extra 18 ({@dice 4d8}) damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the crypt horror hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can deal an extra 18 ({@dice 4d8}) damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the giant hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the giant hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Skewer
entries: Once per turn, when the lizardfolk makes a melee attack with its trident and hits, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage, and the lizardfolk gains temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the lizardfolk makes a melee attack with its trident and hits, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage, and the lizardfolk gains temporary hit points equal to the extra damage dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Stunning Strike (5/Day)
entries: Once per turn, when the tortle hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per turn, when the tortle hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can force the creature to make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the creature's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Soothsaying
entries: Once per week, a nichny can answer up to three questions about the past, present, or future. All three questions must be asked before the nichny can give its answers, which are short and may be in the form of a paradox or riddle. One answer always is false, and the other two must be true.
optionalfeature.effect: Once per week, a nichny can answer up to three questions about the past, present, or future. All three questions must be asked before the nichny can give its answers, which are short and may be in the form of a paradox or riddle. One answer always is false, and the other two must be true.

optionalfeature.name: Unstoppable
entries: Once the ogre charger gets moving, it is difficult to stop. If it moves at least 20 feet on its turn, it can move through spaces occupied by Large or smaller creatures and smash through stone barriers up to 3 feet thick.
optionalfeature.effect: Once the ogre charger gets moving, it is difficult to stop. If it moves at least 20 feet on its turn, it can move through spaces occupied by Large or smaller creatures and smash through stone barriers up to 3 feet thick.

optionalfeature.name: Wings
entries: One in ten chupacabras have leathery wings that give them a flying speed of 40 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: One in ten chupacabras have leathery wings that give them a flying speed of 40 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Pact Wrath
entries: One of the noctiny's weapons is infused with power. Its attacks with this weapon count as magical, and it adds its Charisma bonus to the weapon's damage (included below).
optionalfeature.effect: One of the noctiny's weapons is infused with power. Its attacks with this weapon count as magical, and it adds its Charisma bonus to the weapon's damage (included below).

optionalfeature.name: Conjure Elemental, Dominate Monster, Eyebite, Finger Of Death, Fly, Hellish Rebuke (5D10), Hold Monster, Slo
entries: onjure elemental, dominate monster, eyebite, finger of death, fly, hellish rebuke ({@dice 5d10}), hold monster, slow
optionalfeature.effect: onjure elemental, dominate monster, eyebite, finger of death, fly, hellish rebuke ({@dice 5d10}), hold monster, slow

optionalfeature.name: Armored Skull
entries: Only the tunnel worms head has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Attacks against any other portion of its body arent affected by that resistance.
optionalfeature.effect: Only the tunnel worms head has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Attacks against any other portion of its body arent affected by that resistance.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile
entries: Opportunity attacks made against the orc berserker are made with disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: Opportunity attacks made against the orc berserker are made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Enveloping Slime
entries: Other creatures can enter the slime's space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the slime's engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: Other creatures can enter the slime's space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the slime's engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Trackless Path
entries: Other creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track the skulk.
optionalfeature.effect: Other creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track the skulk.

optionalfeature.name: Writhing Tentacles
entries: Other creatures provoke opportunity attacks when they enter the reach of the tangle crawler's tentacles.
optionalfeature.effect: Other creatures provoke opportunity attacks when they enter the reach of the tangle crawler's tentacles.

optionalfeature.name: Desecrating Aura
entries: Other undead creatures have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 20 feet of the <$name$>.
optionalfeature.effect: Other undead creatures have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on attack rolls and saving throws while within 20 feet of the <$name$>.

optionalfeature.name: Past Losses
entries: Past Losses. The Grim makes creatures recall painful, tragic events and lost love ones that have haunted them. Each creature within range must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and become {@condition stunned} until the end of the Grim's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Past Losses. The Grim makes creatures recall painful, tragic events and lost love ones that have haunted them. Each creature within range must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and become {@condition stunned} until the end of the Grim's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Secretion
entries: Petriferns secrete a bitter toxin meant to make them distasteful to predators. Once per day when a creature touches a petrifern, the plant can release its toxin, causing the attacker to become {@condition poisoned}, getting a save at the end of turn or until an hour has passed. The save DC is Constitution-based.
optionalfeature.effect: Petriferns secrete a bitter toxin meant to make them distasteful to predators. Once per day when a creature touches a petrifern, the plant can release its toxin, causing the attacker to become {@condition poisoned}, getting a save at the end of turn or until an hour has passed. The save DC is Constitution-based.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: Piercing Arrow. The arcane archer doesn't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. On  a successful save, a target takes half asmuch damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Piercing Arrow. The arcane archer doesn't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 2d6} piercing damage. On  a successful save, a target takes half asmuch damage.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Arrow
entries: Poison Arrow. The target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage each.
optionalfeature.effect: Poison Arrow. The target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage each.

optionalfeature.name: Favored Servant
entries: Poison damage the cobra deals treats immunity to poison as resistance to poison. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are considered not immune, but they do have advantage on any saving throw against being {@condition poisoned} by the cobra.
optionalfeature.effect: Poison damage the cobra deals treats immunity to poison as resistance to poison. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are considered not immune, but they do have advantage on any saving throw against being {@condition poisoned} by the cobra.

optionalfeature.name: Process
entries: Process only works if the specified number of Void Gems are present. If so, then that many Void Gems become gems of your opponent's color, and the associated effect is triggered. Void Gems are created by cards with Ingest.
optionalfeature.effect: Process only works if the specified number of Void Gems are present. If so, then that many Void Gems become gems of your opponent's color, and the associated effect is triggered. Void Gems are created by cards with Ingest.

optionalfeature.name: Distortion
entries: Ranged attacks against the malakbel have disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: Ranged attacks against the malakbel have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Mad Hopping
entries: Ranged attacks against the toad have disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: Ranged attacks against the toad have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Hair Tendrils
entries: Ranged attacks against the ulgurstasta from non-siege weapons appropriate for Medium or smaller creatures, have disadvantage to hit. A creature that begins its turn within 40 feet of the ulgurstasta must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Ranged attacks against the ulgurstasta from non-siege weapons appropriate for Medium or smaller creatures, have disadvantage to hit. A creature that begins its turn within 40 feet of the ulgurstasta must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Chill Wind
entries: Ranged weapon attacks against the hawk are made with disadvantage. The hawk can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: Ranged weapon attacks against the hawk are made with disadvantage. The hawk can take the Disengage action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Flicker
entries: Roll {@dice 1d6} for every amphoron in play at the start of its turn. On a roll of 1, the amphoron "flickers" due to a momentary interruption of the connection across time and space. Flickering lasts until the start of the amphoron's next turn. While flickering, the amphoron can't be attacked and can't inflict damage. It regains 2 hit points when it rematerializes. A controller flickers only on a roll of 1 on {@dice 1d20}, but if it does, all amphorons under its control also flicker.
optionalfeature.effect: Roll {@dice 1d6} for every amphoron in play at the start of its turn. On a roll of 1, the amphoron "flickers" due to a momentary interruption of the connection across time and space. Flickering lasts until the start of the amphoron's next turn. While flickering, the amphoron can't be attacked and can't inflict damage. It regains 2 hit points when it rematerializes. A controller flickers only on a roll of 1 on {@dice 1d20}, but if it does, all amphorons under its control also flicker.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Camouflage
entries: The shadow goblin has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: The shadow goblin has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness.

optionalfeature.name: True Resurrectio
entries: True resurrection
optionalfeature.effect: rue resurrection

optionalfeature.name: Fire Breath
entries: Sardior breathes fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: Sardior breathes fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Dominance of Nessus (1/Day)
entries: Saving throws made against the next enchantment spell cast by the cult exarch this turn are made with disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: Saving throws made against the next enchantment spell cast by the cult exarch this turn are made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Vault Keeper
entries: Secret doors and illusory walls within 1,500 feet of the sentinel have the DC to detect their presence increased by 5.
optionalfeature.effect: Secret doors and illusory walls within 1,500 feet of the sentinel have the DC to detect their presence increased by 5.

optionalfeature.name: Flanking
entries: See Pack Tactics: get advantage on attack rolls if one of their allies is within 5ft of their target.
optionalfeature.effect: See Pack Tactics: get advantage on attack rolls if one of their allies is within 5ft of their target.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: Shadow Arrow. If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of the arcane archer's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Shadow Arrow. If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of the arcane archer's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Enshrouded
entries: Shadows cling to the Aurochon, increasing its Armor Class by two and providing resistance to piercing damage. In bright daylight, these bonuses are removed.
optionalfeature.effect: Shadows cling to the Aurochon, increasing its Armor Class by two and providing resistance to piercing damage. In bright daylight, these bonuses are removed.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Evolution
entries: Shrouds instantly become shadows once they cause a total of 12 damage. Any damage they've suffered is subtracted from the shadow's total hit points or abilities.
optionalfeature.effect: Shrouds instantly become shadows once they cause a total of 12 damage. Any damage they've suffered is subtracted from the shadow's total hit points or abilities.

optionalfeature.name: Siege Vulnerability
entries: Siege weapons ignore dah'ren mohran immunities and resistances.
optionalfeature.effect: Siege weapons ignore dah'ren mohran immunities and resistances.

optionalfeature.name: The Star Knight
entries: Sir Pelliton has resistance to cold, fire, lightning, and psychic damage as a sign of his pact, and cannot be {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. His hellish rebuke does 20 damage (no roll) to enemies who fail their save.
optionalfeature.effect: Sir Pelliton has resistance to cold, fire, lightning, and psychic damage as a sign of his pact, and cannot be {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. His hellish rebuke does 20 damage (no roll) to enemies who fail their save.

optionalfeature.name: White and Black Death
entries: Some ryven (approximately 1 in 5) coat their weapons and claws with a poison known as the white and black death. A living creature struck by a {@condition poisoned} weapon or claw must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage immediately and be {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds.
optionalfeature.effect: Some ryven (approximately 1 in 5) coat their weapons and claws with a poison known as the white and black death. A living creature struck by a {@condition poisoned} weapon or claw must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage immediately and be {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Song of Horror
entries: Song of Horror. Provided the dread dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, an enemy that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dread dirgesinger and can hear the dread dirgesinger must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the dread dirgesinger's Song of Horror for the next 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: Song of Horror. Provided the dread dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, an enemy that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dread dirgesinger and can hear the dread dirgesinger must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} until the end the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the dread dirgesinger's Song of Horror for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Song of Sorrow
entries: Song of Sorrow. Provided the dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, an enemy that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dirgesinger and can hear the dirgesinger must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or start wailing and weeping in grief until the start of its next turn. Until this wailing and weeping ends, the target can't take  actions or reactions, and its speed is halved and can't be increased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the dirgesinger's Song of Sorrow for the next 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: Song of Sorrow. Provided the dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, an enemy that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dirgesinger and can hear the dirgesinger must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or start wailing and weeping in grief until the start of its next turn. Until this wailing and weeping ends, the target can't take  actions or reactions, and its speed is halved and can't be increased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the dirgesinger's Song of Sorrow for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Song of the Profane
entries: Song of the Profane. Provided the dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, any undead that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dirgesinger and can hear the dirgesinger gains advantage on melee attack rolls and saving throws against features that turn undead.
optionalfeature.effect: Song of the Profane. Provided the dirgesinger isn't {@condition incapacitated}, any undead that starts its turn within 60 feet of the dirgesinger and can hear the dirgesinger gains advantage on melee attack rolls and saving throws against features that turn undead.

optionalfeature.name: Scent Communication
entries: Spawn of Arbeyach can communicate with each other and all swarms of insects within 60 feet via pheromone transmission. In a hive, this range extends to cover the entire hive. This is a silent and instantaneous mode of communication that only Arbeyach, spawn of Arbeyach, and swarms of insects can understand. As a bonus action, the spawn of Arbeyach can use this trait to control and give orders to one swarm of insects within 60 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: Spawn of Arbeyach can communicate with each other and all swarms of insects within 60 feet via pheromone transmission. In a hive, this range extends to cover the entire hive. This is a silent and instantaneous mode of communication that only Arbeyach, spawn of Arbeyach, and swarms of insects can understand. As a bonus action, the spawn of Arbeyach can use this trait to control and give orders to one swarm of insects within 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Touch
entries: Spells and attacks the tulgar makes ignore all damage resistances of creatures with the Incorporeal Movement ability.
optionalfeature.effect: Spells and attacks the tulgar makes ignore all damage resistances of creatures with the Incorporeal Movement ability.

optionalfeature.name: Slowed by Darkness
entries: Spells that engulf the hangman tree in darkness affect it as the slow spell for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
optionalfeature.effect: Spells that engulf the hangman tree in darkness affect it as the slow spell for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Spider-Infested
entries: Spiders continually crawl out of corpsespun, swarm over them, and fall to the ground around the undead's feet. All creatures other than a corpsepinner or other corpsespun that are adjacent to a corpsespun at the end of the corpsespun's turn take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage from spider bites. This damage is cumulative from multiple adjacent corpsespun.
optionalfeature.effect: Spiders continually crawl out of corpsespun, swarm over them, and fall to the ground around the undead's feet. All creatures other than a corpsepinner or other corpsespun that are adjacent to a corpsespun at the end of the corpsespun's turn take 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage from spider bites. This damage is cumulative from multiple adjacent corpsespun.

optionalfeature.name: Lantern Spirits
entries: Spirits of creatures that died within the lantern's light haunt it. While the lantern is open, these spirits surround the spirit lamp, slowing and attacking all creatures within the lantern's light. A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the spirit lamp has its speed halved and must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the spirit lamp dies and the lantern is open, the lantern's spirits continue to harm creatures within 30 feet of it until the lantern is destroyed or closed.
optionalfeature.effect: Spirits of creatures that died within the lantern's light haunt it. While the lantern is open, these spirits surround the spirit lamp, slowing and attacking all creatures within the lantern's light. A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the spirit lamp has its speed halved and must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the spirit lamp dies and the lantern is open, the lantern's spirits continue to harm creatures within 30 feet of it until the lantern is destroyed or closed.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Infusion
entries: Syringes on the golem's back pierce its silver hide and infuse it with a powerful admixture. At the start of its turn, the alchemical golem can select one of the following infusions. Each infusion lasts until the start of its next turn. The golem can't use multiple infusions at once.
optionalfeature.effect: Syringes on the golem's back pierce its silver hide and infuse it with a powerful admixture. At the start of its turn, the alchemical golem can select one of the following infusions. Each infusion lasts until the start of its next turn. The golem can't use multiple infusions at once.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Aptitude
entries: Tabaxis have an instinctive affinity for weapons. They add twice their proficiency bonus to attack rolls with one-handed weapons and thrown weapons. This bonus is included in the attack modifiers listed above.
optionalfeature.effect: Tabaxis have an instinctive affinity for weapons. They add twice their proficiency bonus to attack rolls with one-handed weapons and thrown weapons. This bonus is included in the attack modifiers listed above.

optionalfeature.name: Teratashia's Necklace of Skulls
entries: Teratashia's necklace is a powerful magic item. It is made from 13 skulls, and each skull has gems set into the eye sockets. Each gem stores one magic spell; the wearer of the necklace can use an action (or reaction for counterspell) to cast one of the spells. Spells are cast at their lowest level, using the caster's attack bonus and saving throw DC. The necklace recovers one expended charge per hour when worn by Teratashia; it doesn't recover charges when worn by anyone else. arcane lock (x2) bestow curse (x2) cloudkill (x2) cone of cold (x4) counterspell (x2) cure wounds (x4) fireball (x2) hypnotic pattern (x2) knock (x2) mirror image (x2) witch bolt (x2)
optionalfeature.effect: Teratashia's necklace is a powerful magic item. It is made from 13 skulls, and each skull has gems set into the eye sockets. Each gem stores one magic spell; the wearer of the necklace can use an action (or reaction for counterspell) to cast one of the spells. Spells are cast at their lowest level, using the caster's attack bonus and saving throw DC. The necklace recovers one expended charge per hour when worn by Teratashia; it doesn't recover charges when worn by anyone else. arcane lock (x2) bestow curse (x2) cloudkill (x2) cone of cold (x4) counterspell (x2) cure wounds (x4) fireball (x2) hypnotic pattern (x2) knock (x2) mirror image (x2) witch bolt (x2)

optionalfeature.name: Light Avoidance
entries: Teratashia's speed increases to 50 feet and her flying speed increases to 70 feet if she is in bright light at the start of her turn. Her speed returns to normal when she starts her turn in dim light or darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: Teratashia's speed increases to 50 feet and her flying speed increases to 70 feet if she is in bright light at the start of her turn. Her speed returns to normal when she starts her turn in dim light or darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Blighted Trail
entries: Terrain that the devastator passes over turns to white ash. Plants are destroyed in that area and cannot regrow for {@dice 1d10} days.
optionalfeature.effect: Terrain that the devastator passes over turns to white ash. Plants are destroyed in that area and cannot regrow for {@dice 1d10} days.

optionalfeature.name: Passing Bite
entries: Terror birds who move at least 20 feet straight toward a target have advantage on the next attack roll against that target.
optionalfeature.effect: Terror birds who move at least 20 feet straight toward a target have advantage on the next attack roll against that target.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Ink (3/Day)
entries: Thalasskoptis can squirt a cloud of poisonous ink into air or water. The ink creates a sphere 60 feet in radius centered on Thalasskoptis, and it lasts for one minute. The cloud is stationary; it doesn't move with Thalasskoptis. The area inside the cloud is heavily obscured. Creatures other than Thalasskoptis in the ink cloud must make a successful {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw against poison or be {@condition stunned} for as long as they remain inside the ink cloud.
optionalfeature.effect: Thalasskoptis can squirt a cloud of poisonous ink into air or water. The ink creates a sphere 60 feet in radius centered on Thalasskoptis, and it lasts for one minute. The cloud is stationary; it doesn't move with Thalasskoptis. The area inside the cloud is heavily obscured. Creatures other than Thalasskoptis in the ink cloud must make a successful {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw against poison or be {@condition stunned} for as long as they remain inside the ink cloud.

optionalfeature.name: Paralytic Poison
entries: The {@condition poisoned} creature has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition poisoned} creature must attempt a Constitution saving throw, On a result of 16 or higher, the {@condition poisoned} condition ends and the character becomes immune to this aranea's poison. On a result of 11–15, the {@condition poisoned} condition continues. On a result of 10 or lower, the creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} and no more saving throws are needed. Paralysis lasts for 1 hour or until the poison is neutralized.
optionalfeature.effect: The {@condition poisoned} creature has tactical disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. At the end of each of its turns, the {@condition poisoned} creature must attempt a Constitution saving throw, On a result of 16 or higher, the {@condition poisoned} condition ends and the character becomes immune to this aranea's poison. On a result of 11–15, the {@condition poisoned} condition continues. On a result of 10 or lower, the creature becomes {@condition paralyzed} and no more saving throws are needed. Paralysis lasts for 1 hour or until the poison is neutralized.

optionalfeature.name: Crows
entries: The <$name$> has an infinite number of crows (using the Raven stat block). Should any die, the  <$name$> more at the start of its turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The <$name$> has an infinite number of crows (using the Raven stat block). Should any die, the  <$name$> more at the start of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of Aerdrie
entries: The aarakocra's staff attacks deal and additional {@dice 1d8} thunder damage, included in the attack. When the aarakocra hits a creature with their staff, they can use their bonus action and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to deal an additional {@dice 2d8} thunder damage. If a spell slot of 2nd level or higher is expended, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 1st.
optionalfeature.effect: The aarakocra's staff attacks deal and additional {@dice 1d8} thunder damage, included in the attack. When the aarakocra hits a creature with their staff, they can use their bonus action and expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher to deal an additional {@dice 2d8} thunder damage. If a spell slot of 2nd level or higher is expended, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 1st.

optionalfeature.name: Know Thoughts
entries: The aatxe can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration. It can end this effect as a bonus action or by using an action to change the target.
optionalfeature.effect: The aatxe can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration. It can end this effect as a bonus action or by using an action to change the target.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Speech (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: The aatxe can verbally communicate only simple ideas and phrases, though it can understand and follow a conversation without issue.
optionalfeature.effect: The aatxe can verbally communicate only simple ideas and phrases, though it can understand and follow a conversation without issue.

optionalfeature.name: Piston Reach
entries: The abomination's melee attacks have a deceptively long reach thanks to the pistons powering them.
optionalfeature.effect: The abomination's melee attacks have a deceptively long reach thanks to the pistons powering them.

optionalfeature.name: Verdant Blessing
entries: The AC of the dryad includes her Charisma bonus.
optionalfeature.effect: The AC of the dryad includes her Charisma bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Kraken's Blessing
entries: The AC of the melusina includes its Charisma bonus.
optionalfeature.effect: The AC of the melusina includes its Charisma bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Blessing
entries: The AC of the valkyrie includes its Charisma bonus.
optionalfeature.effect: The AC of the valkyrie includes its Charisma bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Braindead
entries: The afflicted cave goblin is immune to spells that require an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The afflicted cave goblin is immune to spells that require an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Volcanic Swimmer
entries: The agnaktor can swim in lava as if it was water.
optionalfeature.effect: The agnaktor can swim in lava as if it was water.

optionalfeature.name: Lava Armor
entries: The agnaktors body is covered in a lava-like armor which hardens when cooled and softens when heated. At the start of its turn, if agnaktor is above ground, it gains +1 AC and its movement speed is reduced by 5 feet. to a maximum of +4 AC and -20 feet of movement. If the agnaktor takes fire damage, the bonus AC from this skill is reduced by 1 and movement is increased by 5 feet. The agnaktor can reset this effect by staying submerged in lava or underground for one round.
optionalfeature.effect: The agnaktors body is covered in a lava-like armor which hardens when cooled and softens when heated. At the start of its turn, if agnaktor is above ground, it gains +1 AC and its movement speed is reduced by 5 feet. to a maximum of +4 AC and -20 feet of movement. If the agnaktor takes fire damage, the bonus AC from this skill is reduced by 1 and movement is increased by 5 feet. The agnaktor can reset this effect by staying submerged in lava or underground for one round.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Creature
entries: The ahtal-ka counts as a number of creatures equal to it's paragon multiplier (3, counting the ahtal-nesto) for the purposes of determining combat encounters. The XP value for a ahtal-ka is multiplied by it's paragon multiplier.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-ka counts as a number of creatures equal to it's paragon multiplier (3, counting the ahtal-nesto) for the purposes of determining combat encounters. The XP value for a ahtal-ka is multiplied by it's paragon multiplier.

optionalfeature.name: Reel in
entries: The ahtal-ka has a 10-foot beam on its back. When it throws the rusted beam it can pull it back to itself as a bonus action. Any creature in the path of the beam as it is pulled in must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-ka has a 10-foot beam on its back. When it throws the rusted beam it can pull it back to itself as a bonus action. Any creature in the path of the beam as it is pulled in must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking 40 ({@damage 9d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Fortitude
entries: The ahtal-ka has multiple pools of hit points (2), each which is tracked separately. Damage and healing only applies to the current hit point pool. When a pool is depleted of all hit points, it becomes inactive. When this happens, the ahtal-ka immediately saves against all ongoing conditions and effects. If all hit point pools are inactive, the ahtal-ka dies. When it takes a long rest, the ahtal-ka heals all hit points in the current pool and fully heals one depleted hit point pool.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-ka has multiple pools of hit points (2), each which is tracked separately. Damage and healing only applies to the current hit point pool. When a pool is depleted of all hit points, it becomes inactive. When this happens, the ahtal-ka immediately saves against all ongoing conditions and effects. If all hit point pools are inactive, the ahtal-ka dies. When it takes a long rest, the ahtal-ka heals all hit points in the current pool and fully heals one depleted hit point pool.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The ahtal-ka rolls initiative with advantage. The ahtal-ka starts with 1 paragon action. If a hit point pool is depleted, the ahtal-ka gains one additional paragon action. The ahtal-ka may use a paragon action after any other creature takes a turn. If the ahtal-ka does so, they regain their reaction. A paragon action is a complete turn. They have an action, bonus action and may move up to their full speed. The paragon actions refresh at the start of the ahtal-ka's turn and any remaining actions from the previous turn are lost.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-ka rolls initiative with advantage. The ahtal-ka starts with 1 paragon action. If a hit point pool is depleted, the ahtal-ka gains one additional paragon action. The ahtal-ka may use a paragon action after any other creature takes a turn. If the ahtal-ka does so, they regain their reaction. A paragon action is a complete turn. They have an action, bonus action and may move up to their full speed. The paragon actions refresh at the start of the ahtal-ka's turn and any remaining actions from the previous turn are lost.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Orb
entries: The ahtal-nesto has 3 golden orbs made up of webbing, that fit in a 5 foot cube each, on its body, two are on either side of back between its front and hind leg, the other is located 15 feet above its back on its neck. Each orb has an AC of 20 and 50 hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-nesto has 3 golden orbs made up of webbing, that fit in a 5 foot cube each, on its body, two are on either side of back between its front and hind leg, the other is located 15 feet above its back on its neck. Each orb has an AC of 20 and 50 hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Walking Fortress
entries: The ahtal-nesto is a walking fortress, with four 20-foot tall climbable legs (Climb {@dc 20}). Its back has two 20-foot long by 5-foot wide walkways adjacent to its legs.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-nesto is a walking fortress, with four 20-foot tall climbable legs (Climb {@dc 20}). Its back has two 20-foot long by 5-foot wide walkways adjacent to its legs.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Regeneration
entries: The ahtal-nesto regenerates 90 hit points a round as it reconnects its scrap metal and debris with is golden threads. For each Golden Orb that is destroyed, the ahtal-nesto's regeneration is reduced by 30.
optionalfeature.effect: The ahtal-nesto regenerates 90 hit points a round as it reconnects its scrap metal and debris with is golden threads. For each Golden Orb that is destroyed, the ahtal-nesto's regeneration is reduced by 30.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Flesh
entries: The ala's poison infuses its flesh. A creature that makes a successful bite attack against an ala must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw; if it fails, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The ala's poison infuses its flesh. A creature that makes a successful bite attack against an ala must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw; if it fails, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

optionalfeature.name: Produce Potion (1/Day)
entries: The alchemical apprentice can produce one common potion, oil, tincture, or alchemical draught each day. If no creature is there to bottle, or otherwise collect, the substance when it is produced, it trickles away and is wasted.
optionalfeature.effect: The alchemical apprentice can produce one common potion, oil, tincture, or alchemical draught each day. If no creature is there to bottle, or otherwise collect, the substance when it is produced, it trickles away and is wasted.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Quaffer
entries: The alchemist can drink a potion as a bonus action on each of its turns.
optionalfeature.effect: The alchemist can drink a potion as a bonus action on each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Foresight
entries: the alu-fiend cannot be surprised, and adds its Charisma bonus to its initiative rolls.
optionalfeature.effect: the alu-fiend cannot be surprised, and adds its Charisma bonus to its initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Six Heads
entries: The anathema has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.
optionalfeature.effect: The anathema has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Wrath
entries: The angatra immediately recognizes any individual that is descended from its tribe. It has advantage on attack rolls against such creatures, and those creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the angatra's traits and attacks.
optionalfeature.effect: The angatra immediately recognizes any individual that is descended from its tribe. It has advantage on attack rolls against such creatures, and those creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the angatra's traits and attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Corrupted Weapons
entries: The angel's weapons attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The angel's weapons attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Two Dimensional
entries: The animate image cannot stand on its own, but it can cover any surface without being harmed. Whenever it is touching a creature or object that moves, the image goes with it. The image can slide through cracks as thin as paper without suffering ill effect. If the image is located on an object held in midair that isn't touching anything else, as though by levitation, it is trapped and cannot move. The animate image does not occupy a space.
optionalfeature.effect: The animate image cannot stand on its own, but it can cover any surface without being harmed. Whenever it is touching a creature or object that moves, the image goes with it. The image can slide through cracks as thin as paper without suffering ill effect. If the image is located on an object held in midair that isn't touching anything else, as though by levitation, it is trapped and cannot move. The animate image does not occupy a space.

optionalfeature.name: Equipment
entries: The animate shield can be equipped as a shield and the bearer is always considered proficient in its use. The only action it can take while it is equipped is to remove itself from the bearer. While equipped, it is treated as an object and does not take damage from attacks or other effects.
optionalfeature.effect: The animate shield can be equipped as a shield and the bearer is always considered proficient in its use. The only action it can take while it is equipped is to remove itself from the bearer. While equipped, it is treated as an object and does not take damage from attacks or other effects.

optionalfeature.name: Death's Apotheosis
entries: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type and its weapon attacks are magical.
optionalfeature.effect: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type and its weapon attacks are magical.

optionalfeature.name: Death Ascended
entries: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type.
optionalfeature.effect: The ankou has the celestial type in addition to the dragon type.

optionalfeature.name: Monkey Grip
entries: The ape can wield a two-handed weapon in one hand.
optionalfeature.effect: The ape can wield a two-handed weapon in one hand.

optionalfeature.name: Springy
entries: The ape's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.
optionalfeature.effect: The ape's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Boscage Brachiation
entries: The arboreal grappler doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach by climbing.
optionalfeature.effect: The arboreal grappler doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach by climbing.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Scent
entries: The arcanamite can pinpoint, by scent, the location of a creature that can cast spells within 60 feet of it.
optionalfeature.effect: The arcanamite can pinpoint, by scent, the location of a creature that can cast spells within 60 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Speech of the Woods
entries: The arch shepherd can communicate with animals as if they share a language. Most beasts lack the intelligence to convey complex ideas, but can express emotions and short memories with ease.
optionalfeature.effect: The arch shepherd can communicate with animals as if they share a language. Most beasts lack the intelligence to convey complex ideas, but can express emotions and short memories with ease.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Mastery
entries: The archlich can cast {@spell magic missile} and {@spell mirror image} at their lowest level without expending a spell slot, and may add its Intelligence modifier to any damage dealt by a spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The archlich can cast {@spell magic missile} and {@spell mirror image} at their lowest level without expending a spell slot, and may add its Intelligence modifier to any damage dealt by a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Olive Slime Defenses
entries: The armor class and hit points listed above are for a Large patch of olive slime in its native environment. Olive slime on a victim has the victim's AC and hit points equal to the number of Constitution points the victim has lost.
optionalfeature.effect: The armor class and hit points listed above are for a Large patch of olive slime in its native environment. Olive slime on a victim has the victim's AC and hit points equal to the number of Constitution points the victim has lost.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Coat
entries: The armor class of the mngwa includes its Charisma modifier. All attack rolls against the mngwa have disadvantage. If the mngwa is adjacent to an area of smoke or mist, it can take a Hide action even if under direct observation.
optionalfeature.effect: The armor class of the mngwa includes its Charisma modifier. All attack rolls against the mngwa have disadvantage. If the mngwa is adjacent to an area of smoke or mist, it can take a Hide action even if under direct observation.

optionalfeature.name: Point Blank Shot
entries: The arrow demon can ignore disadvantage on an attack roll if they are within 5 feet of a hostile creature who they can see and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: The arrow demon can ignore disadvantage on an attack roll if they are within 5 feet of a hostile creature who they can see and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Large Weapon Wielder
entries: The arrow demon can wield weapons up to one size larger than their size would allow.
optionalfeature.effect: The arrow demon can wield weapons up to one size larger than their size would allow.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Courage
entries: The aspect and friendly creatures within 30 feet of it can't be {@condition frightened} while the aspect is conscious.
optionalfeature.effect: The aspect and friendly creatures within 30 feet of it can't be {@condition frightened} while the aspect is conscious.

optionalfeature.name: Dreadful
entries: The Aspect of Bael can use a bonus action to appear dreadful until the start of his next turn. Each creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Aspect of Bael must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the start of the creature's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The Aspect of Bael can use a bonus action to appear dreadful until the start of his next turn. Each creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Aspect of Bael must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the start of the creature's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Fiery Weapons
entries: The Aspect of Zariel's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage (included in the weapon attacks below).
optionalfeature.effect: The Aspect of Zariel's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage (included in the weapon attacks below).

optionalfeature.name: Resourceful
entries: The associated effects of your cards in play with Resourceful are triggered whenever you draw a card beyond the first in a turn, up to a maximum number of times per turn equal to the number beside the Resourceful keyword.
optionalfeature.effect: The associated effects of your cards in play with Resourceful are triggered whenever you draw a card beyond the first in a turn, up to a maximum number of times per turn equal to the number beside the Resourceful keyword.

optionalfeature.name: Elusive
entries: The azeban can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
optionalfeature.effect: The azeban can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Master Crafted Weapons
entries: The azer's weapons are masterfully crafted. Their warhammer is a +1 weapon (included in the attack), and it has four charges, which are regained at dawn. The azer can expend on of the charges to cast the following spells as a 2nd level spell: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher}, {@spell flaming sphere}, {@spell pyrotechnics}, or {@spell scorching ray}. (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks)
optionalfeature.effect: The azer's weapons are masterfully crafted. Their warhammer is a +1 weapon (included in the attack), and it has four charges, which are regained at dawn. The azer can expend on of the charges to cast the following spells as a 2nd level spell: {@spell aganazzar's scorcher}, {@spell flaming sphere}, {@spell pyrotechnics}, or {@spell scorching ray}. (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks)

optionalfeature.name: Dream Sense
entries: The baku can magicly sense the presence of sleeping creatures up to 1 mile away. The baku knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.
optionalfeature.effect: The baku can magicly sense the presence of sleeping creatures up to 1 mile away. The baku knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

optionalfeature.name: Unsleeping
entries: The baku cannot be magically put to sleep.
optionalfeature.effect: The baku cannot be magically put to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Dweomersight
entries: The balhannoth can see magic auras as if affected by a constant detect magic spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The balhannoth can see magic auras as if affected by a constant detect magic spell.

optionalfeature.name: Improvised Weapon {@recharge 4}
entries: The banbaro can use its bonus action to dig up a large boulder or strike a nearby tree, or pick up a tree trunk and hold it in its antlers.
optionalfeature.effect: The banbaro can use its bonus action to dig up a large boulder or strike a nearby tree, or pick up a tree trunk and hold it in its antlers.

optionalfeature.name: Drag Away
entries: The banderhobb may move its full speed and even take Dash actions while grappling a creature.
optionalfeature.effect: The banderhobb may move its full speed and even take Dash actions while grappling a creature.

optionalfeature.name: Petrification Resistance
entries: The banelar has advantage on saving throws against petrification.
optionalfeature.effect: The banelar has advantage on saving throws against petrification.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Absorption
entries: The banisher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the banisher is subjected to a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The banisher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the banisher is subjected to a spell or magical effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Song of Rest
entries: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends an Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.
optionalfeature.effect: The bard can perform a song while taking a short rest. Any ally who hears the song regains an extra {@dice 1d6} hit points if it spends an Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest. The bard can confer this benefit on itself as well.

optionalfeature.name: Speak To Bats
entries: The Bat King can communicate with bats as if they shared a language.
optionalfeature.effect: The Bat King can communicate with bats as if they shared a language.

optionalfeature.name: Soapy
entries: The bathhouse drake has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.
optionalfeature.effect: The bathhouse drake has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Scales
entries: The bazelgeuse scales, when dislodged from its body, act as a time bomb. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties) all scales explode dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to all creature in a 5-foot radius of them.
optionalfeature.effect: The bazelgeuse scales, when dislodged from its body, act as a time bomb. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties) all scales explode dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage to all creature in a 5-foot radius of them.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Scales
entries: The bazelgeuse scales, when dislodged from its body, act as a time bomb. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties) all scales explode dealing 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage to all creature in a 10-foot radius of them.
optionalfeature.effect: The bazelgeuse scales, when dislodged from its body, act as a time bomb. On initiative count 20 (losing all initiative ties) all scales explode dealing 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage to all creature in a 10-foot radius of them.

optionalfeature.name: Bear Speech
entries: The bearskin can speak with bears as if under the constant effect of a speak with animals spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The bearskin can speak with bears as if under the constant effect of a speak with animals spell.

optionalfeature.name: Bear's Hide
entries: The bearskin can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true giant form. It's statistics, other than AC are the same in each form its. The bearskin's hide armor is transformed with it, other equipment it is wearing or carrying is not transformed.
optionalfeature.effect: The bearskin can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true giant form. It's statistics, other than AC are the same in each form its. The bearskin's hide armor is transformed with it, other equipment it is wearing or carrying is not transformed.

optionalfeature.name: Unfavorable Target
entries: The beast is unaffected by critical hits.
optionalfeature.effect: The beast is unaffected by critical hits.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Companion
entries: The beastmaster is bonded to a beast, which is its animal companion. The companion acts on its own initiative, but otherwise obeys the beastmaster's commands. As a bonus action, the beastmaster can command its companion to use its reaction to take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action.
optionalfeature.effect: The beastmaster is bonded to a beast, which is its animal companion. The companion acts on its own initiative, but otherwise obeys the beastmaster's commands. As a bonus action, the beastmaster can command its companion to use its reaction to take the Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or Help action.

optionalfeature.name: Apocalypse
entries: The behemoth can only use its Ecliptic Meteor if it is below one-quarter of its maximum hit points (112), or if it has used Comet action three times in the same battle.
optionalfeature.effect: The behemoth can only use its Ecliptic Meteor if it is below one-quarter of its maximum hit points (112), or if it has used Comet action three times in the same battle.

optionalfeature.name: Fleshbag
entries: The behemoth starts with two arms and two legs. If it loses one arm, it can't multiattack. If it loses both arms, it can't slam. If it loses one leg, its speed is halved. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.
optionalfeature.effect: The behemoth starts with two arms and two legs. If it loses one arm, it can't multiattack. If it loses both arms, it can't slam. If it loses one leg, its speed is halved. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

optionalfeature.name: Cone Of Light
entries: The beholder's central eye emits a 20-foot cone of magical light. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whenever the cone is active. Any creature that starts its turn in the area that can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The beholder's central eye emits a 20-foot cone of magical light. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whenever the cone is active. Any creature that starts its turn in the area that can see must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Wade
entries: The beotodus can partially submerge itself in snowy or icy terrain. While partially submerged, it has three-quarters cover (+5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws) and can only use the following actions: horn attack, deadly Leap, and slip 'n' slide.
optionalfeature.effect: The beotodus can partially submerge itself in snowy or icy terrain. While partially submerged, it has three-quarters cover (+5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws) and can only use the following actions: horn attack, deadly Leap, and slip 'n' slide.

optionalfeature.name: False Presence
entries: The berstuc counts as a fey for purposes of spells and magical effects that detect otherworldly creatures. Beasts and plants are comfortable around the berstuc and will not attack it unless ordered to or provoked.
optionalfeature.effect: The berstuc counts as a fey for purposes of spells and magical effects that detect otherworldly creatures. Beasts and plants are comfortable around the berstuc and will not attack it unless ordered to or provoked.

optionalfeature.name: Twisted Path
entries: The berstuc leaves no path through natural terrain and can't be tracked with skill checks or other natural means. Creatures that travel with it can't retrace their own trails, and they become hopelessly lost after 1 hour of travel. Creatures led astray by a berstuc have disadvantage on attempts to discern their location or to navigate for 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The berstuc leaves no path through natural terrain and can't be tracked with skill checks or other natural means. Creatures that travel with it can't retrace their own trails, and they become hopelessly lost after 1 hour of travel. Creatures led astray by a berstuc have disadvantage on attempts to discern their location or to navigate for 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Timed Etherealness
entries: The bewailer is trapped in the ethereal plane during all times of the day except the time period within 1 hour of her death. During this time, if the bewailer is on the Ethereal Plane at the start of her turn, she is immedialy transported to the Material Plane. At the end of this 2-hour period, she forcibly returns to the Ethereal Plane
optionalfeature.effect: The bewailer is trapped in the ethereal plane during all times of the day except the time period within 1 hour of her death. During this time, if the bewailer is on the Ethereal Plane at the start of her turn, she is immedialy transported to the Material Plane. At the end of this 2-hour period, she forcibly returns to the Ethereal Plane

optionalfeature.name: Boneneedle Poison
entries: The bite of a boneneedle injects a syrupy neurotoxin that destroys flesh and weakens bone. A creature that fails its saving throw against boneneedle poison gains the {@condition poisoned} condition. While the creature is {@condition poisoned} by boneneedle poison, it also takes an extra 2 points of damage whenever it takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Cumulative bites do not increase the extra damage. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw after a long or short rest, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition with a successful save. A lesser restoration spell or comparable magic also neutralizes the poison.
optionalfeature.effect: The bite of a boneneedle injects a syrupy neurotoxin that destroys flesh and weakens bone. A creature that fails its saving throw against boneneedle poison gains the {@condition poisoned} condition. While the creature is {@condition poisoned} by boneneedle poison, it also takes an extra 2 points of damage whenever it takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. Cumulative bites do not increase the extra damage. The {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw after a long or short rest, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition with a successful save. A lesser restoration spell or comparable magic also neutralizes the poison.

optionalfeature.name: Discreet Bite
entries: The bite of a dipsa is barely perceptible and the wound is quickly anesthetized. A creature bitten must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the attack or any damage taken from it.
optionalfeature.effect: The bite of a dipsa is barely perceptible and the wound is quickly anesthetized. A creature bitten must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the attack or any damage taken from it.

optionalfeature.name: Hateful Aura
entries: The black knight commander and allies within 10 feet of the commander add its Charisma modifier to weapon damage rolls (included in damage below).
optionalfeature.effect: The black knight commander and allies within 10 feet of the commander add its Charisma modifier to weapon damage rolls (included in damage below).

optionalfeature.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The blackspawn stalker deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: The blackspawn stalker deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Victorious Blades
entries: The bladesinger's melee weapon attacks are magical, and it adds its Intelligence modifier to the weapon's damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The bladesinger's melee weapon attacks are magical, and it adds its Intelligence modifier to the weapon's damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Horrific Imitation
entries: The bloody bones chooses one creature it can see. It moves, acts, and speaks in a macabre imitation of the creature. Its utterances are nonsense, and it can't understand the languages of its chosen target. It maintains this imitation until it dies. A creature that hears and sees the bloody bones can tell it is performing an imitation with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.
optionalfeature.effect: The bloody bones chooses one creature it can see. It moves, acts, and speaks in a macabre imitation of the creature. Its utterances are nonsense, and it can't understand the languages of its chosen target. It maintains this imitation until it dies. A creature that hears and sees the bloody bones can tell it is performing an imitation with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

optionalfeature.name: Popo Mask
entries: The boaboa wear crude imitations of popo heads as masks, with the tusk's tips painted in colors that correspond to the spear it uses. The color on the tusks range from blue to yellow to purple to black. To determine which color the tusks are and which spear the boaboa uses Roll {@dice 1d4}, On a 1, the tusks are blue and it uses a stone spear; On a 2, the tusks are yellow and it uses a paralysis spear; On a 3, the tusks are purple and it uses a poison spear; and on a 4, the tusks are black and it uses a blind spear.
optionalfeature.effect: The boaboa wear crude imitations of popo heads as masks, with the tusk's tips painted in colors that correspond to the spear it uses. The color on the tusks range from blue to yellow to purple to black. To determine which color the tusks are and which spear the boaboa uses Roll {@dice 1d4}, On a 1, the tusks are blue and it uses a stone spear; On a 2, the tusks are yellow and it uses a paralysis spear; On a 3, the tusks are purple and it uses a poison spear; and on a 4, the tusks are black and it uses a blind spear.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Annihilation
entries: The bodak can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.
optionalfeature.effect: The bodak can activate or deactivate this feature as a bonus action. While active, the aura deals 5 necrotic damage to any creature that ends its turn within 30 feet of the bodak. Undead and fiends ignore this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Ring of Fire
entries: The body of a greater fire crab generates intense heat. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a greater fire crab takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. This damage is cumulative if more than one fire crab is within 5 feet of the character.
optionalfeature.effect: The body of a greater fire crab generates intense heat. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of a greater fire crab takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. This damage is cumulative if more than one fire crab is within 5 feet of the character.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Devourer
entries: The body of any creature killed by a grue, along with everything it wore or carried, fades from existence {@dice 1d6 x 10} minutes after its death unless it is protected by magic such as a gentle repose spell. Four days later, the vanished person's soul returns as a grue, and it becomes impossible for the slain creature to ever be raised.
optionalfeature.effect: The body of any creature killed by a grue, along with everything it wore or carried, fades from existence {@dice 1d6 x 10} minutes after its death unless it is protected by magic such as a gentle repose spell. Four days later, the vanished person's soul returns as a grue, and it becomes impossible for the slain creature to ever be raised.

optionalfeature.name: Boggle Oil
entries: The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. The boggle chooses whether the oil is slippery or sticky and can change the oil on its skin from one consistency to another as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The boggle excretes nonflammable oil from its pores. The boggle chooses whether the oil is slippery or sticky and can change the oil on its skin from one consistency to another as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Boggoul Bile
entries: The boggoul excretes a bilious fluid from its pores. The boggoul chooses whether the bile is noxious or paralyzing. It can change the property of its bile from one to another as a bonus action. Noxious Bile: A creature other than an undead, that touches the boggoul takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. Paralyzing Bile: A creature other than an elf or undead, that touches the boggoul must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
optionalfeature.effect: The boggoul excretes a bilious fluid from its pores. The boggoul chooses whether the bile is noxious or paralyzing. It can change the property of its bile from one to another as a bonus action. Noxious Bile: A creature other than an undead, that touches the boggoul takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. Paralyzing Bile: A creature other than an elf or undead, that touches the boggoul must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: No Passing
entries: The boneclaw gets an additional reaction every turn that can only be used to make opportunity attacks. A boneclaw may make opportunity attacks when creatures enter the reach of its claws. When a creature takes damage from a boneclaw's opportunity attack, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of the turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The boneclaw gets an additional reaction every turn that can only be used to make opportunity attacks. A boneclaw may make opportunity attacks when creatures enter the reach of its claws. When a creature takes damage from a boneclaw's opportunity attack, the creature's speed is reduced to 0 for the rest of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cooperative Magic
entries: The bonesinger aids an allied bonesinger in casting a spell or using its Wind of Death action. Saving throws against the ally's spell or Wind of Death have disadvantage, and spell attack rolls the ally makes have advantage. The bonesinger can only use this ability by using the Ready action to trigger when an allied bonesinger within 5 feet of the bonesinger casts a spell or uses its Wind of Death ability.
optionalfeature.effect: The bonesinger aids an allied bonesinger in casting a spell or using its Wind of Death action. Saving throws against the ally's spell or Wind of Death have disadvantage, and spell attack rolls the ally makes have advantage. The bonesinger can only use this ability by using the Ready action to trigger when an allied bonesinger within 5 feet of the bonesinger casts a spell or uses its Wind of Death ability.

optionalfeature.name: Defiling Smear (1/Day)
entries: The bouda can secrete a disgusting whitish-yellow substance with the viscosity of tar to mark food and territory. As a bonus action, the bouda marks a single adjacent 5-foot space, object, or helpless creature. Any living creature within 30 feet of the smear at the start of its turn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against poison or be {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to that particular bouda's defiling smear for 24 hours. The stench of a smear remains potent for one week.
optionalfeature.effect: The bouda can secrete a disgusting whitish-yellow substance with the viscosity of tar to mark food and territory. As a bonus action, the bouda marks a single adjacent 5-foot space, object, or helpless creature. Any living creature within 30 feet of the smear at the start of its turn must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against poison or be {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d6} rounds. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to that particular bouda's defiling smear for 24 hours. The stench of a smear remains potent for one week.

optionalfeature.name: Multiple Arms
entries: The bound colossus has four arms. Each arm can be attacked (AC 17; 30 hit points; vulnerability to thunder damage). Destroying an arm deals 15 damage to the colossus. The colossus can construct a new arm by using an action to pull one out of its body but it must have a free arm to do so.
optionalfeature.effect: The bound colossus has four arms. Each arm can be attacked (AC 17; 30 hit points; vulnerability to thunder damage). Destroying an arm deals 15 damage to the colossus. The colossus can construct a new arm by using an action to pull one out of its body but it must have a free arm to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Body Arms
entries: The brachavyrm gains a pair of arms each time it consumes a humanoid creature. For every fve pairs of humanoid arms the brachavyrm has, its speed is increased by 5 feet. A pair of arms wither and die after a month it was created.
optionalfeature.effect: The brachavyrm gains a pair of arms each time it consumes a humanoid creature. For every fve pairs of humanoid arms the brachavyrm has, its speed is increased by 5 feet. A pair of arms wither and die after a month it was created.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Breath
entries: The breath weapon used by a gorgimera's dragon head depends on the color of its dragon head, as listed on the table below. Regardless of its type, a gorgimera's breath weapon deals 13 ({@dice 3d8}) points of damage, or half damage to targets that make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. To determine a gorgimera's head color and breath weapon randomly, roll {@dice 1d10} and consult the table.
optionalfeature.effect: The breath weapon used by a gorgimera's dragon head depends on the color of its dragon head, as listed on the table below. Regardless of its type, a gorgimera's breath weapon deals 13 ({@dice 3d8}) points of damage, or half damage to targets that make a successful {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. To determine a gorgimera's head color and breath weapon randomly, roll {@dice 1d10} and consult the table.

optionalfeature.name: Heart of Hruggek
entries: The bugbear has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition stunned}, or put to sleep.
optionalfeature.effect: The bugbear has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition poisoned}, {@condition stunned}, or put to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Precise Attacker
entries: The bugbear's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. When the bugbear scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.
optionalfeature.effect: The bugbear's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. When the bugbear scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

optionalfeature.name: Ravage the Fallen
entries: The bulezau deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to {@condition prone} targets.
optionalfeature.effect: The bulezau deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to {@condition prone} targets.

optionalfeature.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.
optionalfeature.effect: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Of Fury
entries: The calm emotion spell instantly fails when cast within 60 feet of Chemosh. In addition, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Chemosh must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or enter a mad rage, attacking the nearest creature it can see until the start of its next turn. At the start of his turn, Chemosh can decide whether this aura is active.
optionalfeature.effect: The calm emotion spell instantly fails when cast within 60 feet of Chemosh. In addition, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of Chemosh must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or enter a mad rage, attacking the nearest creature it can see until the start of its next turn. At the start of his turn, Chemosh can decide whether this aura is active.

optionalfeature.name: Savannah Stalker
entries: The catfolk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to move in plains terrain.
optionalfeature.effect: The catfolk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to move in plains terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Stunning Ugliness
entries: The catoblepas is so shockingly ugly that just glimpsing one can blind the viewer. Characters fighting a catoblepas must either either avert their eyes and take tactical disadvantage on attack rolls against the catoblepas, or make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw before making their attack roll. Failure on the saving throw means the character is {@condition blinded} until the start of his or her next turn. Anyone who rolls a lower initiative result than the catoblepas must attempt this saving throw immediately at the beginning of combat.
optionalfeature.effect: The catoblepas is so shockingly ugly that just glimpsing one can blind the viewer. Characters fighting a catoblepas must either either avert their eyes and take tactical disadvantage on attack rolls against the catoblepas, or make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw before making their attack roll. Failure on the saving throw means the character is {@condition blinded} until the start of his or her next turn. Anyone who rolls a lower initiative result than the catoblepas must attempt this saving throw immediately at the beginning of combat.

optionalfeature.name: Detect Elixir
entries: The cauldronborn can pinpoint the location of potions and magic items within 60 feet of it. Outside of 60 feet, it can sense the general direction of potions within 1 mile of it.
optionalfeature.effect: The cauldronborn can pinpoint the location of potions and magic items within 60 feet of it. Outside of 60 feet, it can sense the general direction of potions within 1 mile of it.

optionalfeature.name: Sprint
entries: The cauldronborn triples its speed until the end of its turn when moving toward a potion it has detected.
optionalfeature.effect: The cauldronborn triples its speed until the end of its turn when moving toward a potion it has detected.

optionalfeature.name: Saddle Master
entries: The cavalier has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount. If the cavalier falls off its mount and descends no more than 10 feet, it can land on its feet, and it isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Dismounting a creature only takes 5 feet of movement for the cavalier.
optionalfeature.effect: The cavalier has advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off its mount. If the cavalier falls off its mount and descends no more than 10 feet, it can land on its feet, and it isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Dismounting a creature only takes 5 feet of movement for the cavalier.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Filament
