entries: The cave fisher can use its action to extend a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the filament is {@condition grappled} by the cave fisher (escape {@dc 13}), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. A creature that begins its turn adhered to the cave fisher's filament, must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for one minute. While {@condition poisoned}, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be {@condition stunned} for 1 round and take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw on two consecutive turns, ends the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage; vulnerability to fire damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 13} Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher, which can extrude a replacement filament on its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The cave fisher can use its action to extend a sticky filament up to 60 feet, and the filament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the filament is {@condition grappled} by the cave fisher (escape {@dc 13}), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. A creature that begins its turn adhered to the cave fisher's filament, must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for one minute. While {@condition poisoned}, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be {@condition stunned} for 1 round and take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw on two consecutive turns, ends the {@condition poisoned} condition on itself. The filament can be attacked (AC 15; 5 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage; vulnerability to fire damage), but a weapon that fails to sever it becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 13} Strength check to pull free. Destroying the filament deals no damage to the cave fisher, which can extrude a replacement filament on its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Adhesive Filament
entries: The cave fsher can use its action to extend a sticky flament up to 120 feet, and the flament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the flament is {@condition grappled} by the cave fsher (escape {@dc 17}), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. A creature that starts its turn adhered to the flament takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) acid damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The cave fsher can use its action to extend a sticky flament up to 120 feet, and the flament adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the flament is {@condition grappled} by the cave fsher (escape {@dc 17}), and ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. A creature that starts its turn adhered to the flament takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Arrows
entries: The centaur's attacks with its longbow are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an additional {@dice 4d8} damage on a hit (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The centaur's attacks with its longbow are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an additional {@dice 4d8} damage on a hit (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Variable CR
entries: The challenge rating of a were-mist is the same as the type of beast it transforms victims into; CR 2 for wererats, CR 3 for werewolves, or CR 4 for wereboars. If it transforms victims into more than one type in an encounter, use the highest value.
optionalfeature.effect: The challenge rating of a were-mist is the same as the type of beast it transforms victims into; CR 2 for wererats, CR 3 for werewolves, or CR 4 for wereboars. If it transforms victims into more than one type in an encounter, use the highest value.

optionalfeature.name: Possessed By Ancestors
entries: The chaos of combat causes an elophar to swap between personalities at the start of each of its turns. To determine which spirit is in control, roll on the table below (it is possible for one spirit to remain in control for multiple rounds if it is rolled multiple rounds in a row). See Spirit Control Table.
optionalfeature.effect: The chaos of combat causes an elophar to swap between personalities at the start of each of its turns. To determine which spirit is in control, roll on the table below (it is possible for one spirit to remain in control for multiple rounds if it is rolled multiple rounds in a row). See Spirit Control Table.

optionalfeature.name: Drone
entries: The chasme produces a horrid droning sound to which demons are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn with in 30 feet of the chasme must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. A creature that can't hear the drone automatically succeeds on the save. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to splash it with holy water. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the drone for the next 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The chasme produces a horrid droning sound to which demons are immune. Any other creature that starts its turn with in 30 feet of the chasme must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes. A creature that can't hear the drone automatically succeeds on the save. The effect on the creature ends if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to splash it with holy water. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to the drone for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Siphon Spell Slots
entries: The chelicerae cannot replenish its spells naturally. Instead, it uses {@condition grappled} spellcasters as spell reservoirs, draining uncast spells to power its own casting. Whenever the chelicerae wishes to cast a spell, it consumes a number of spell slots from its victim equal to the spell slots necessary to cast the spell. If the victim has too few spell slots available, the chelicerae cannot cast that spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The chelicerae cannot replenish its spells naturally. Instead, it uses {@condition grappled} spellcasters as spell reservoirs, draining uncast spells to power its own casting. Whenever the chelicerae wishes to cast a spell, it consumes a number of spell slots from its victim equal to the spell slots necessary to cast the spell. If the victim has too few spell slots available, the chelicerae cannot cast that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Luminescence
entries: The chemicals within cavelight moss make the entire creature shed light as a torch. A cavelight moss cannot suppress this effect. It can, however, diminish the light produced to shed illumination as a candle.
optionalfeature.effect: The chemicals within cavelight moss make the entire creature shed light as a torch. A cavelight moss cannot suppress this effect. It can, however, diminish the light produced to shed illumination as a candle.

optionalfeature.name: Wing Assisted Movement
entries: The chicken has advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to move to a higher position (such as moving up a steep incline or jumping up).
optionalfeature.effect: The chicken has advantage on Strength (Athletics) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to move to a higher position (such as moving up a steep incline or jumping up).

optionalfeature.name: Boneless
entries: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.
optionalfeature.effect: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

optionalfeature.name: Ruin Camouflage
entries: The choker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in stone buildings, ruins and in caves.
optionalfeature.effect: The choker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in stone buildings, ruins and in caves.

optionalfeature.name: Quickness
entries: The choker may make a dash action or a single tentacle attack as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The choker may make a dash action or a single tentacle attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: The chosen magically adds 5 ({@dice 2d4}) to the result of each attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes.
optionalfeature.effect: The chosen magically adds 5 ({@dice 2d4}) to the result of each attack roll, ability check, and saving throw it makes.

optionalfeature.name: Stretch Time (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The chronomancer can take on additional action on its turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The chronomancer can take on additional action on its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Insight
entries: The city watch captain has advantage on initiative rolls. City watch soldiers under the captain's command take their turns on the same initiative count as the captain.
optionalfeature.effect: The city watch captain has advantage on initiative rolls. City watch soldiers under the captain's command take their turns on the same initiative count as the captain.

optionalfeature.name: Master Brewer
entries: The cleric has a +6 bonus on ability checks to brew beer, has advantage on saving throws against poison, and can't be intoxicated unless it chooses to be.
optionalfeature.effect: The cleric has a +6 bonus on ability checks to brew beer, has advantage on saving throws against poison, and can't be intoxicated unless it chooses to be.

optionalfeature.name: Fragile Inner Ear
entries: The cockatrice's balance can easily be thrown off by loud sounds. If the great cockatrice takes thunder damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its flying speed is reduced to 0 feet until the end of its next turn. An airborne cockatrice affected by this effect descends at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground.
optionalfeature.effect: The cockatrice's balance can easily be thrown off by loud sounds. If the great cockatrice takes thunder damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its flying speed is reduced to 0 feet until the end of its next turn. An airborne cockatrice affected by this effect descends at 60 feet per round until it reaches the ground.

optionalfeature.name: Color Changing
entries: The coloration of a Crocotta can change to match the background of any environment at will. This effect gives it a +5 circumstance bonus on Stealth checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The coloration of a Crocotta can change to match the background of any environment at will. This effect gives it a +5 circumstance bonus on Stealth checks.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetism
entries: The colossus emits its own magnetic field to a radius of 240 feet. If a creature that is wearing or carrying metal equipment enters this space or begins its turn there, they must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are drawn 30 feet closer to the base of the colossus. A creature who fails this saving throw may choose to drop the worn or carried items to automatically succeed on this check instead. If a creature hits the base of the colossus after failing this saving throw, they are {@condition restrained} and must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw in order to escape.
optionalfeature.effect: The colossus emits its own magnetic field to a radius of 240 feet. If a creature that is wearing or carrying metal equipment enters this space or begins its turn there, they must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw. On a failure, they are drawn 30 feet closer to the base of the colossus. A creature who fails this saving throw may choose to drop the worn or carried items to automatically succeed on this check instead. If a creature hits the base of the colossus after failing this saving throw, they are {@condition restrained} and must succeed a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw in order to escape.

optionalfeature.name: Mutation
entries: The corrupted ogre chieftain has one mutation from the list below:
optionalfeature.effect: The corrupted ogre chieftain has one mutation from the list below:

optionalfeature.name: Fey Step
entries: The count is unaffected by difficult terrain.
optionalfeature.effect: The count is unaffected by difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Clockwork Encasement
entries: The creature within the machine is a somewhat shapeless mass, both protected and given concrete manipulators by its armor. The clockwork armor has a variety of manipulators that the ahu-nixta can use to attack or to interact with objects outside of the armor. When the ahu-nixta is reduced to 0 hp, its clockwork armor breaks and the ahunixta exits it. Once out of its armor, the creature s pulpy mass no longer receives the benefits of the listed Damage or Condition Immunities, except for psychic and {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: The creature within the machine is a somewhat shapeless mass, both protected and given concrete manipulators by its armor. The clockwork armor has a variety of manipulators that the ahu-nixta can use to attack or to interact with objects outside of the armor. When the ahu-nixta is reduced to 0 hp, its clockwork armor breaks and the ahunixta exits it. Once out of its armor, the creature s pulpy mass no longer receives the benefits of the listed Damage or Condition Immunities, except for psychic and {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Pseudocorporeal
entries: The crimson mist is weightless and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing.
optionalfeature.effect: The crimson mist is weightless and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing.

optionalfeature.name: Human Voice
entries: The Crocotta can mimic names and simple sentences it has heard before. It uses it to draw prey into the forest.
optionalfeature.effect: The Crocotta can mimic names and simple sentences it has heard before. It uses it to draw prey into the forest.

optionalfeature.name: Flylby
entries: The crow does not provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.
optionalfeature.effect: The crow does not provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Mimicry
entries: The crowlock can mimic any sounds it has heard, including a person's voice. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.
optionalfeature.effect: The crowlock can mimic any sounds it has heard, including a person's voice. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom (Insight) check.

optionalfeature.name: Crystalline Tail
entries: The crysmal's tail is made from a magical crystal the absorbs and reacts with cold, fire, and lightning. Whenever the crysmal takes cold, fire, or lightning damage, its tail becomes charged with that damage type until it becomes charged with a different one. The crysmal's tail attack deals an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage of the damage type it is charged with.
optionalfeature.effect: The crysmal's tail is made from a magical crystal the absorbs and reacts with cold, fire, and lightning. Whenever the crysmal takes cold, fire, or lightning damage, its tail becomes charged with that damage type until it becomes charged with a different one. The crysmal's tail attack deals an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage of the damage type it is charged with.

optionalfeature.name: Squishy
entries: The cube is immune to falling damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The cube is immune to falling damage.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube occupies its entire space whenever it is Medium or larger. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The cube occupies its entire space whenever it is Medium or larger. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Ooze Cube
entries: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Speak With Sea Life
entries: The cueyatl sea priest can communicate with amphibious and water breathing beasts and monstrosities as if they shared a language.
optionalfeature.effect: The cueyatl sea priest can communicate with amphibious and water breathing beasts and monstrosities as if they shared a language.

optionalfeature.name: One-Eyed
entries: The cultist has disadvantage on any attack roll made against a target more than 30 feet away.
optionalfeature.effect: The cultist has disadvantage on any attack roll made against a target more than 30 feet away.

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Focus
entries: The cyclops has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell, and cannot lose concentration because of turbulent weather.
optionalfeature.effect: The cyclops has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell, and cannot lose concentration because of turbulent weather.

optionalfeature.name: Sand Surfing
entries: The dah'ren mohran can swim through desert terrain as if it was water.
optionalfeature.effect: The dah'ren mohran can swim through desert terrain as if it was water.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: The darakhul high priestess can make three extra bite attacks on her turn as a bonus action. If any of these attacks miss, all attacks against her have advantage until the end of her next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The darakhul high priestess can make three extra bite attacks on her turn as a bonus action. If any of these attacks miss, all attacks against her have advantage until the end of her next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Death Waits
entries: The dark father has disadvantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has all of its hp.
optionalfeature.effect: The dark father has disadvantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that has all of its hp.

optionalfeature.name: Guardian Spirits
entries: The death giant is constantly surrounded by the souls of its victims, which swirl around it and warn it of danger. The death giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and Initiative rolls. The guardian spirits can be suppressed by a cleric's turn undead, a paladin's turn the unholy ability, or similar abilities. When the death giant is in the area of effect or becomes the target of such an ability, it must make a Charisma saving throw against the ability's save DC. On a failed save the giant's guardian spirits are suppressed for the duration of the ability. While they are suppressed the giant loses its immunity to necrotic damage, does not benefit from the advantage the guardian spirits provide, from steal soul and cannot use its frightful keening. If the frightful keening is already in effect, it immediately ends. The death giant can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
optionalfeature.effect: The death giant is constantly surrounded by the souls of its victims, which swirl around it and warn it of danger. The death giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and Initiative rolls. The guardian spirits can be suppressed by a cleric's turn undead, a paladin's turn the unholy ability, or similar abilities. When the death giant is in the area of effect or becomes the target of such an ability, it must make a Charisma saving throw against the ability's save DC. On a failed save the giant's guardian spirits are suppressed for the duration of the ability. While they are suppressed the giant loses its immunity to necrotic damage, does not benefit from the advantage the guardian spirits provide, from steal soul and cannot use its frightful keening. If the frightful keening is already in effect, it immediately ends. The death giant can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Frightful Keening
entries: The death giant uses its action to make the guardian souls surrounding it wail in anguish until the giant uses another action to end the keening. Creatures within 60 ft. who can hear the keening must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the death giant until they can no longer hear the keening or are out of range. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the giant's frightful keening for the next 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The death giant uses its action to make the guardian souls surrounding it wail in anguish until the giant uses another action to end the keening. Creatures within 60 ft. who can hear the keening must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of the death giant until they can no longer hear the keening or are out of range. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the giant's frightful keening for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Death
entries: The deathpriest exarch emanates a deathly aura that extends 30 feet in every direction from its space while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}. The aura is blocked by total cover. While in the aura, the deathpriest exarch and any undead ally are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition and have resistance to radiant damage. Enemies suffer disadvantage on death saving throws while in the aura.
optionalfeature.effect: The deathpriest exarch emanates a deathly aura that extends 30 feet in every direction from its space while it isn't {@condition incapacitated}. The aura is blocked by total cover. While in the aura, the deathpriest exarch and any undead ally are immune to the {@condition frightened} condition and have resistance to radiant damage. Enemies suffer disadvantage on death saving throws while in the aura.

optionalfeature.name: Archer's Step
entries: The deathsworn can use Disengage as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The deathsworn can use Disengage as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Flicker
entries: The deathwisp flickers in and out of sight, and ranged weapon attacks against it are made with disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: The deathwisp flickers in and out of sight, and ranged weapon attacks against it are made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Prehensile Tentacles
entries: The deepspawn can wield weapons in its prehensile tentacles. Each tentacle can wield a Huge one-handed or Large or smaller one- or two-handed melee weapon. The tentacle attack is then resolved with the weapon's damage die and type as well as its special qualities.
optionalfeature.effect: The deepspawn can wield weapons in its prehensile tentacles. Each tentacle can wield a Huge one-handed or Large or smaller one- or two-handed melee weapon. The tentacle attack is then resolved with the weapon's damage die and type as well as its special qualities.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Conduit
entries: The deity that created the eye of the gods can see everything the eye sees and can instantly recall the eye to its side at any time.
optionalfeature.effect: The deity that created the eye of the gods can see everything the eye sees and can instantly recall the eye to its side at any time.

optionalfeature.name: Tunnel
entries: The delex doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it burrows out of an enemy's reach.
optionalfeature.effect: The delex doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it burrows out of an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Of Cacophony
entries: The demon's presence is extremely distracting. Each creature within 100 feet of the echo demon and that can hear it has disadvantage on concentration checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The demon's presence is extremely distracting. Each creature within 100 feet of the echo demon and that can hear it has disadvantage on concentration checks.

optionalfeature.name: Insanity
entries: The derro has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
optionalfeature.effect: The derro has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowstrike
entries: The derro's weapon attacks deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage (included in its Actions list).
optionalfeature.effect: The derro's weapon attacks deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage (included in its Actions list).

optionalfeature.name: Grinding Maw
entries: The devil bough has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by its bite attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The devil bough has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by its bite attack.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Pact
entries: The devil can make an infernal pact with a willing creature, granting it special boons in exchange for its soul.
optionalfeature.effect: The devil can make an infernal pact with a willing creature, granting it special boons in exchange for its soul.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Spines
entries: The devil has twelve tail spines. Used spines regrow by the time the devil finishes a long rest.
optionalfeature.effect: The devil has twelve tail spines. Used spines regrow by the time the devil finishes a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Light Incorporeality
entries: The devil is semi-incorporeal when standing in moonlight, and is immune to all nonmagical attacks in such conditions. Even when hit by spells or magic weapons, it takes only half damage from a corporeal source, with the exception of force damage. Holy water can affect the devil as it does incorporeal undead.
optionalfeature.effect: The devil is semi-incorporeal when standing in moonlight, and is immune to all nonmagical attacks in such conditions. Even when hit by spells or magic weapons, it takes only half damage from a corporeal source, with the exception of force damage. Holy water can affect the devil as it does incorporeal undead.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Tie
entries: The devilbound gnomish prince can perceive through his imp's senses, communicate telepathically through its mind, and speak through his imp's mouth as long as both of them are on the same plane of existence.
optionalfeature.effect: The devilbound gnomish prince can perceive through his imp's senses, communicate telepathically through its mind, and speak through his imp's mouth as long as both of them are on the same plane of existence.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Blessing
entries: The devilbound gnomish prince gains 21 temporary hit points when it reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: The devilbound gnomish prince gains 21 temporary hit points when it reduces a hostile creature to 0 hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Translucent
entries: The dipsa can take the Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.
optionalfeature.effect: The dipsa can take the Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Rhythmic Fighting
entries: The dirge can play songs while wielding a melee weapon in one hand.
optionalfeature.effect: The dirge can play songs while wielding a melee weapon in one hand.

optionalfeature.name: Luminous Skeleton
entries: The doom golem sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.
optionalfeature.effect: The doom golem sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

optionalfeature.name: Luminous Projection
entries: The dragon can project itself through a beam of pure light and use its move to travel to any location it can see. This travel must be in a straight line, but otherwise the dragon can travel anywhere that light can enter.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragon can project itself through a beam of pure light and use its move to travel to any location it can see. This travel must be in a straight line, but otherwise the dragon can travel anywhere that light can enter.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Immunity
entries: The dragon can use its bonus action to gain immunity to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. The immunity lasts until the dragon uses its ability again.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragon can use its bonus action to gain immunity to one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. The immunity lasts until the dragon uses its ability again.

optionalfeature.name: Void Travel
entries: The dragon does not need to breathe and is immune to the hazards of outer space. It can fly beyond a planet's atmosphere and travel between planets. Travelling between planets using the void travel ability requires {@dice 6d10} days of travel time regardless of the actual distance. Riders it carries while travelling through space are also protected from the void of outer space.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragon does not need to breathe and is immune to the hazards of outer space. It can fly beyond a planet's atmosphere and travel between planets. Travelling between planets using the void travel ability requires {@dice 6d10} days of travel time regardless of the actual distance. Riders it carries while travelling through space are also protected from the void of outer space.

optionalfeature.name: Locked Saddle
entries: The dragonborn can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn can't be knocked {@condition prone}, dismounted, or moved against its will while mounted.

optionalfeature.name: Tide (Water)
entries: The dragonborn has resistance to cold damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn has resistance to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Flame (Fire)
entries: The dragonborn has resistance to fire damage. It can cast the produce flame cantrip at will and can cast heat metal or scorching ray three times per day.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn has resistance to fire damage. It can cast the produce flame cantrip at will and can cast heat metal or scorching ray three times per day.

optionalfeature.name: Storm (Air)
entries: The dragonborn has resistance to lightning damage. It can cast the shocking grasp cantrip at will and can cast blur or gust of wind three times per day.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn has resistance to lightning damage. It can cast the shocking grasp cantrip at will and can cast blur or gust of wind three times per day.

optionalfeature.name: Cave (Earth)
entries: The dragonborn has resistance to poison damage. It can cast the blade ward cantrip at will and can cast meld into stone or shatter three times per day.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn has resistance to poison damage. It can cast the blade ward cantrip at will and can cast meld into stone or shatter three times per day.

optionalfeature.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: The dragonborn is rarely seen without its giant lizard mount.
optionalfeature.effect: The dragonborn is rarely seen without its giant lizard mount.

optionalfeature.name: Perfect Climber
entries: The drake has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made while climbing.
optionalfeature.effect: The drake has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made while climbing.

optionalfeature.name: Nimbus of Stars
entries: The drake is surrounded by a whirling nimbus of tiny motes of starlight. A sighted creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the drake must make a successful {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated}. At the start of a character's turn, a character can choose to avert its eyes and gain immunity against this effect until the start of its next turn, but it must treat the drake as {@condition invisible} while the character's eyes are averted.
optionalfeature.effect: The drake is surrounded by a whirling nimbus of tiny motes of starlight. A sighted creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the drake must make a successful {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition incapacitated}. At the start of a character's turn, a character can choose to avert its eyes and gain immunity against this effect until the start of its next turn, but it must treat the drake as {@condition invisible} while the character's eyes are averted.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Falsehood
entries: The drake knows if it hears a lie.
optionalfeature.effect: The drake knows if it hears a lie.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Leap
entries: The drake's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.
optionalfeature.effect: The drake's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Bound Devotion
entries: The dream squire has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. If an effect would cause the squire to take a harmful action against its master, it can immediately repeat the saving throw (if any), ending the effect on a success. The squire has disadvantage on attack rolls or ability checks made against its master.
optionalfeature.effect: The dream squire has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. If an effect would cause the squire to take a harmful action against its master, it can immediately repeat the saving throw (if any), ending the effect on a success. The squire has disadvantage on attack rolls or ability checks made against its master.

optionalfeature.name: Master's Bond
entries: The dream squire is bound to serve another creature as its master. The squire obeys all the master's commands, and the master can communicate telepathically with the squire as long as they are on the same plane.
optionalfeature.effect: The dream squire is bound to serve another creature as its master. The squire obeys all the master's commands, and the master can communicate telepathically with the squire as long as they are on the same plane.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Hair
entries: The drowned maiden's hair attacks as though it were three separate limbs, each of which can be attacked (AC 19; 15 hit points; immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage; resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered). A lock of hair can be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 15} Strength check against it.
optionalfeature.effect: The drowned maiden's hair attacks as though it were three separate limbs, each of which can be attacked (AC 19; 15 hit points; immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage; resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered). A lock of hair can be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a {@dc 15} Strength check against it.

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The druid can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The druid also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Lucky (3/Day)
entries: The drunken master can re-roll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes and use either result.
optionalfeature.effect: The drunken master can re-roll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes and use either result.

optionalfeature.name: Drunken Technique
entries: The drunken master does not trigger opportunity attacks when it moves on its turn. Also, when {@condition prone}, the drunken master can spend 5 feet of movement to stand up.
optionalfeature.effect: The drunken master does not trigger opportunity attacks when it moves on its turn. Also, when {@condition prone}, the drunken master can spend 5 feet of movement to stand up.

optionalfeature.name: Slow Fall
entries: The drunken master takes no damage as a result of a fall.
optionalfeature.effect: The drunken master takes no damage as a result of a fall.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Dependent
entries: The dryad is mystically bonded to her duskthorn vines and must remain within 300 yards of them or become {@condition poisoned}. If she remains out of range of her vines for 24 hours, she suffers {@dice 1d6} Constitution damage, and another {@dice 1d6} points of Constitution damage every day that follows—eventually, this separation kills the dryad. A dryad can bond with new vines by performing a 24-hour ritual.
optionalfeature.effect: The dryad is mystically bonded to her duskthorn vines and must remain within 300 yards of them or become {@condition poisoned}. If she remains out of range of her vines for 24 hours, she suffers {@dice 1d6} Constitution damage, and another {@dice 1d6} points of Constitution damage every day that follows—eventually, this separation kills the dryad. A dryad can bond with new vines by performing a 24-hour ritual.

optionalfeature.name: Duelist
entries: The duelist has a +2 bonus to damage rolls with melee weapons it wields with one hand, (included in the attack). It does not benefit from this trait if it is holding an item or wielding a weapon in its other hand.
optionalfeature.effect: The duelist has a +2 bonus to damage rolls with melee weapons it wields with one hand, (included in the attack). It does not benefit from this trait if it is holding an item or wielding a weapon in its other hand.

optionalfeature.name: Phalanx Formation
entries: The duergar has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of a duergar ally wielding a shield.
optionalfeature.effect: The duergar has advantage on attack rolls and Dexterity saving throws while standing within 5 feet of a duergar ally wielding a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Loader
entries: The duergar ignores the loading quality of crossbows.
optionalfeature.effect: The duergar ignores the loading quality of crossbows.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Advance
entries: The dullahan is unaffected by difficult terrain, and can ride over water and other liquid surfaces.
optionalfeature.effect: The dullahan is unaffected by difficult terrain, and can ride over water and other liquid surfaces.

optionalfeature.name: High Jump
entries: The duramboros's high jump is up to 20 feet, without a running start. In addition, the duramboros does not incur attacks of opportunity while jumping.
optionalfeature.effect: The duramboros's high jump is up to 20 feet, without a running start. In addition, the duramboros does not incur attacks of opportunity while jumping.

optionalfeature.name: Ring Magic
entries: The dwarven ringmage can imbue a nonmagical ring with a spell that has a range of self or touch. Doing so expends components as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell normally and uses a spell slot one level higher than the spell normally requires. When the wearer of the ring activates the ring as an action, the spell is cast as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell. The dwarven ringmage does not regain the spell slot until the ring is discharged or the dwarven ringmage chooses to dismiss the spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The dwarven ringmage can imbue a nonmagical ring with a spell that has a range of self or touch. Doing so expends components as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell normally and uses a spell slot one level higher than the spell normally requires. When the wearer of the ring activates the ring as an action, the spell is cast as if the dwarven ringmage had cast the spell. The dwarven ringmage does not regain the spell slot until the ring is discharged or the dwarven ringmage chooses to dismiss the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Ring-Staff Focus
entries: The dwarven ringmage can use his ring-staff as a focus for spells that require rings as a focus or component, or for his Ring Magic ability. If used as a focus for Ring Magic, the spell does not require a spell slot one level higher than the spell normally requires. Once per day, the dwarven ringmage can imbue a spell of 4th level or lower into his ring-staff by expending a spell slot equal to the spell being imbued.
optionalfeature.effect: The dwarven ringmage can use his ring-staff as a focus for spells that require rings as a focus or component, or for his Ring Magic ability. If used as a focus for Ring Magic, the spell does not require a spell slot one level higher than the spell normally requires. Once per day, the dwarven ringmage can imbue a spell of 4th level or lower into his ring-staff by expending a spell slot equal to the spell being imbued.

optionalfeature.name: Unnatural Quickness
entries: The ekolid may make the dash or disengage action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The ekolid may make the dash or disengage action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.
optionalfeature.effect: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Speed Surge (3/Day)
entries: The elder shadow drake takes one additional move action on its turn. It can use only one speed surge per round.
optionalfeature.effect: The elder shadow drake takes one additional move action on its turn. It can use only one speed surge per round.

optionalfeature.name: Steal Weapons
entries: The eldritch magic that powers the pillar produces a magnetic power that seizes metal objects that touch it, including metal weapons. When a creature successfully strikes the pillar with a metal melee weapon, the attacker must make a successful {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw or the weapon becomes stuck to the pillar until the pillar releases it or is destroyed. The saving throw uses the same ability as the attack used. The pillar can release all metal weapons stuck to it whenever it wants. A pillar always drops all weapons stuck to it when it believes it's no longer threatened. This ability affects armor only during a grapple.
optionalfeature.effect: The eldritch magic that powers the pillar produces a magnetic power that seizes metal objects that touch it, including metal weapons. When a creature successfully strikes the pillar with a metal melee weapon, the attacker must make a successful {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw or the weapon becomes stuck to the pillar until the pillar releases it or is destroyed. The saving throw uses the same ability as the attack used. The pillar can release all metal weapons stuck to it whenever it wants. A pillar always drops all weapons stuck to it when it believes it's no longer threatened. This ability affects armor only during a grapple.

optionalfeature.name: Reed Walk
entries: The eleinomae can move across undergrowth or rivers without making an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain of this kind doesn't cost it extra moment.
optionalfeature.effect: The eleinomae can move across undergrowth or rivers without making an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain of this kind doesn't cost it extra moment.

optionalfeature.name: Magma Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the weapon becomes stuck in the elemental. If the weapon's wielder can't or won't let go of the weapon, the wielder is {@condition grappled} while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. Until the grapple ends, the wielder takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. To end the grapple, the wielder can release the weapon or pull it free by taking an action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check and succeeding.
optionalfeature.effect: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the weapon becomes stuck in the elemental. If the weapon's wielder can't or won't let go of the weapon, the wielder is {@condition grappled} while the weapon is stuck. While stuck, the weapon can't be used. Until the grapple ends, the wielder takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. To end the grapple, the wielder can release the weapon or pull it free by taking an action to make a {@dc 16} Strength check and succeeding.

optionalfeature.name: Molten Form
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, becoming {@condition restrained} on a failure. When the begins its turn while {@condition restrained} in this way, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, becoming {@condition restrained} on a failure. When the begins its turn while {@condition restrained} in this way, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Hunter
entries: The elvish veteran archer has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track beasts and on Intelligence (Nature) checks to recall information about beasts.
optionalfeature.effect: The elvish veteran archer has advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track beasts and on Intelligence (Nature) checks to recall information about beasts.

optionalfeature.name: Form of Ash
entries: The emberborn can pass through openings as small as a 1-inch square without being slowed or hindered. Opportunity attacks against the emberborn are made with disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: The emberborn can pass through openings as small as a 1-inch square without being slowed or hindered. Opportunity attacks against the emberborn are made with disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Key of Prophecy
entries: The Emerald Order cult leader can always act in a surprise round, but if he fails to notice a foe, he is still considered surprised until he takes an action. He receives a +3 bonus on initiative checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The Emerald Order cult leader can always act in a surprise round, but if he fails to notice a foe, he is still considered surprised until he takes an action. He receives a +3 bonus on initiative checks.

optionalfeature.name: Hardy
entries: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison.
optionalfeature.effect: The erina has advantage on saving throws against poison.

optionalfeature.name: Hellish Weapons
entries: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).
optionalfeature.effect: The erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a hit (included in the attacks).

optionalfeature.name: Two-Headed Battle Caster
entries: The ettin can cast a spell in place of one of its melee weapon attacks. In addition, it can maintain concentration on up to two spells. If the ettin casts a third spell that requires concentration while already maintaining concentraion on two other spells, one of the two previous spells ends (ettin's choice). If the ettin is required to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it must make a separate saving throw for each spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The ettin can cast a spell in place of one of its melee weapon attacks. In addition, it can maintain concentration on up to two spells. If the ettin casts a third spell that requires concentration while already maintaining concentraion on two other spells, one of the two previous spells ends (ettin's choice). If the ettin is required to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it must make a separate saving throw for each spell.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Cone
entries: The eye of the deep's central eye emits a 120-foot cone of blinding light. At the start of each of its turns, the eye of the deep decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. Creatures that start their turn in the cone must make a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the beginning of their next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The eye of the deep's central eye emits a 120-foot cone of blinding light. At the start of each of its turns, the eye of the deep decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. Creatures that start their turn in the cone must make a successful {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the beginning of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Baleful Flash
entries: The eye of the deep's central eye projects a blinding flash of light in a 60-foot cone as a bonus action. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.
optionalfeature.effect: The eye of the deep's central eye projects a blinding flash of light in a 60-foot cone as a bonus action. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Eerie Whispers
entries: The eyeless watcher can take the Help action at a range of 10 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The eyeless watcher can take the Help action at a range of 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Trader
entries: The far wanderer understands the literal meaning of any spoken or written language it hears or reads. In addition, it can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration.
optionalfeature.effect: The far wanderer understands the literal meaning of any spoken or written language it hears or reads. In addition, it can use an action to read the surface thoughts of one creature within 30 feet. This works like the detect thoughts spell, except it can only read surface thoughts and there is no limit to the duration.

optionalfeature.name: White Scales Emperor's Roar {@recharge 5}
entries: The fatalis calls down a giant bolt of red lightning enveloping the area around the fatalis with a bright red glow. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the ground below the fatalis must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) lighting damage plus 22 ({@dice 5d8}) fire on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: The fatalis calls down a giant bolt of red lightning enveloping the area around the fatalis with a bright red glow. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on the ground below the fatalis must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) lighting damage plus 22 ({@dice 5d8}) fire on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Crimson Scales Crimson Demons Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The fatalis exhales 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) fire damage plus 28 ({@dice 8d6}) necrotic on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: The fatalis exhales 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) fire damage plus 28 ({@dice 8d6}) necrotic on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Black Scales Black Fire {@recharge 5}
entries: The fatalis exhales a black flame in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage plus 28 ({@dice 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: The fatalis exhales a black flame in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage plus 28 ({@dice 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Shifting Scales
entries: The fatalis has three forms; black, crimson, and white. At the start of the fatalis turn its scales shift, black to crimson, crimson to white, or white to black. The Fatalis loses its breath weapon, damage immunities, and elemental damage from their bite or claw attacks and gain the benefits below of its new scale color. Breath attacks all share the same recharge.
optionalfeature.effect: The fatalis has three forms; black, crimson, and white. At the start of the fatalis turn its scales shift, black to crimson, crimson to white, or white to black. The Fatalis loses its breath weapon, damage immunities, and elemental damage from their bite or claw attacks and gain the benefits below of its new scale color. Breath attacks all share the same recharge.

optionalfeature.name: Unwatchable
entries: The fear liath becomes incorporeal and appears as a dark gray shadow while any living creature looks directly at it. While incorporeal, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. While incorporeal, it also gains resistance to acid, fire, lightning, and thunder damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. The fear liath has no control over this trait.
optionalfeature.effect: The fear liath becomes incorporeal and appears as a dark gray shadow while any living creature looks directly at it. While incorporeal, it can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. While incorporeal, it also gains resistance to acid, fire, lightning, and thunder damage, and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. The fear liath has no control over this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Eye
entries: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against the {@condition blinded} condition.
optionalfeature.effect: The fear smith has advantage on saving throws against the {@condition blinded} condition.

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The fianna can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The fianna also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The fianna can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The fianna also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Opportunist
entries: The fianna deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with an opportunity attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The fianna deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with an opportunity attack.

optionalfeature.name: Lock Picking
entries: The fihyr can use its tentacles to attempt Dexterity checks to open locks.
optionalfeature.effect: The fihyr can use its tentacles to attempt Dexterity checks to open locks.

optionalfeature.name: Warming Presence
entries: The firebird and any creatures within a 5-foot radius are immune to the effects of natural, environmental cold. Invited into a home or building, a firebird can expand this warming presence to its inhabitants no matter how close they are to the creature.
optionalfeature.effect: The firebird and any creatures within a 5-foot radius are immune to the effects of natural, environmental cold. Invited into a home or building, a firebird can expand this warming presence to its inhabitants no matter how close they are to the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Light of the World
entries: The firebird's feathers glow with a warm light. The creature sheds light as dim as a candle or as bright as a lantern. It always sheds light, and any feathers plucked from the creature continue to shed light as a torch.
optionalfeature.effect: The firebird's feathers glow with a warm light. The creature sheds light as dim as a candle or as bright as a lantern. It always sheds light, and any feathers plucked from the creature continue to shed light as a torch.

optionalfeature.name: Centipede Poison
entries: The first time a character takes damage from a centipede nest, the character must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the character is immune to the poison from that swarm. On a failed save, the character becomes {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition paralyzed} character repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a successful save, the paralysis ends and the character becomes {@condition poisoned} instead. The character remains {@condition poisoned} for 5 minutes.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time a character takes damage from a centipede nest, the character must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the character is immune to the poison from that swarm. On a failed save, the character becomes {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition paralyzed} character repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns; on a successful save, the paralysis ends and the character becomes {@condition poisoned} instead. The character remains {@condition poisoned} for 5 minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Deceiving Death
entries: The first time a coffer corpse's hit points are reduced below 20, the creature collapses to the ground as if slain. A {@condition grappled} creature is released. To all inspection, the coffer corpse appears destroyed. At the start of its next turn, the coffer corpse regains {@dice 3d6} hit points and rises again as if reanimated. Every creature that sees the coffer corpse rise must make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds or until they see the coffer corpse destroyed.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time a coffer corpse's hit points are reduced below 20, the creature collapses to the ground as if slain. A {@condition grappled} creature is released. To all inspection, the coffer corpse appears destroyed. At the start of its next turn, the coffer corpse regains {@dice 3d6} hit points and rises again as if reanimated. Every creature that sees the coffer corpse rise must make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds or until they see the coffer corpse destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Majesty
entries: The first time a creature attacks the bard on a turn, the attacker must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it can't attack the bard on this turn, and it must choose a new target for the attack or the attack is wasted.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time a creature attacks the bard on a turn, the attacker must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it can't attack the bard on this turn, and it must choose a new target for the attack or the attack is wasted.

optionalfeature.name: Rheopectic Hardening
entries: The first time each turn the slime takes force, bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, the AC of its natural armor increases by 5. <!-- If the triggering damage was force, increase it by an additional 5.--> Once the slime's natural armor AC reaches 20, the slime is {@condition petrified} and regains all its hitpoints.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time each turn the slime takes force, bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, the AC of its natural armor increases by 5. <!-- If the triggering damage was force, increase it by an additional 5.--> Once the slime's natural armor AC reaches 20, the slime is {@condition petrified} and regains all its hitpoints.

optionalfeature.name: Rheopectic Hardening
entries: The first time each turn the slime takes force, bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, the AC of its natural armor increases by 5. <!-- If the triggering damage was force, increase the AC of its natural armor by 10.--> Once the slime's natural armor AC reaches 25, the slime is {@condition petrified}<!-- and regains all its hitpoints-->.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time each turn the slime takes force, bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, the AC of its natural armor increases by 5. <!-- If the triggering damage was force, increase the AC of its natural armor by 10.--> Once the slime's natural armor AC reaches 25, the slime is {@condition petrified}<!-- and regains all its hitpoints-->.

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Appetite
entries: The first time the evistro hits with a weapon attack on its turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw, or for the rest of the combat it must always attack the closest creature that is not an evistro to the best of its ability, even if it is an ally of the evistro.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time the evistro hits with a weapon attack on its turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw, or for the rest of the combat it must always attack the closest creature that is not an evistro to the best of its ability, even if it is an ally of the evistro.

optionalfeature.name: Enrage (1/day)
entries: The first time the tigrex drops below half of its maximum hit points, it enrages for 10 minutes and gains the following benefits:
optionalfeature.effect: The first time the tigrex drops below half of its maximum hit points, it enrages for 10 minutes and gains the following benefits:

optionalfeature.name: Enrage (1/Day)
entries: The first time the tigrex hp drop below half of its maximum, it enrages for 1 minute. While enraged, the tigrex damage is increased by +5 and its movement is increased by 10 ft.
optionalfeature.effect: The first time the tigrex hp drop below half of its maximum, it enrages for 1 minute. While enraged, the tigrex damage is increased by +5 and its movement is increased by 10 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Fanatical Devotion
entries: The flagellant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. While the flagellant can see a friendly, higher-ranking member of its religion, the flagellant ignores the effects of being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
optionalfeature.effect: The flagellant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. While the flagellant can see a friendly, higher-ranking member of its religion, the flagellant ignores the effects of being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Sensitivity
entries: The flesh of a mallqui putrefies and dissolves rapidly when soaked with water in the following ways:
optionalfeature.effect: The flesh of a mallqui putrefies and dissolves rapidly when soaked with water in the following ways:

optionalfeature.name: Chained Ones
entries: The fleshfiend is accompanied by two chained ones, which act on the same turn as the fleshfiend, and must remain within 10 feet of it. The chained ones have the same statistics as the fleshfiend, except they are size medium, have 40 hit points, and they have no abilities besides the slash action option. A chained one immediately disappears if they or the fleshfiend are reduced to 0 hit points. After 24 hours, both chained ones reform if the fleshfiend is alive
optionalfeature.effect: The fleshfiend is accompanied by two chained ones, which act on the same turn as the fleshfiend, and must remain within 10 feet of it. The chained ones have the same statistics as the fleshfiend, except they are size medium, have 40 hit points, and they have no abilities besides the slash action option. A chained one immediately disappears if they or the fleshfiend are reduced to 0 hit points. After 24 hours, both chained ones reform if the fleshfiend is alive

optionalfeature.name: Silent Wings
entries: The flight of a leonine is especially silent and difficult to notice in forests and urban settings. It has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while flying in these areas.
optionalfeature.effect: The flight of a leonine is especially silent and difficult to notice in forests and urban settings. It has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while flying in these areas.

optionalfeature.name: Hideous Piping
entries: The fluting noises made by a shoggoth are otherworldly and mind-shattering. A creature that can hear this cacophony at the start of its turn and is within 120 feet of a shoggoth must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be confused (as the spell confusion) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. Creatures that roll a natural 20 on this saving throw become immune to the Hideous Piping for 24 hours. Otherwise, characters who meet the conditions must repeat the saving throw every round.
optionalfeature.effect: The fluting noises made by a shoggoth are otherworldly and mind-shattering. A creature that can hear this cacophony at the start of its turn and is within 120 feet of a shoggoth must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be confused (as the spell confusion) for {@dice 1d4} rounds. Creatures that roll a natural 20 on this saving throw become immune to the Hideous Piping for 24 hours. Otherwise, characters who meet the conditions must repeat the saving throw every round.

optionalfeature.name: Void Stare
entries: The folk of Leng can see through doors and around corners as a bonus action. As a result, they are very rarely surprised.
optionalfeature.effect: The folk of Leng can see through doors and around corners as a bonus action. As a result, they are very rarely surprised.

optionalfeature.name: Void Sailors
entries: The folk of Leng can travel the airless void without harm.
optionalfeature.effect: The folk of Leng can travel the airless void without harm.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Magic
entries: The forest goblin shaman can use its action to sacrifice a Tiny mammal to innately cast one of the following spells: bestow curse, cure wounds, or healing word. The forest goblin shaman starts combat with 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) Tiny mammals in its possession.
optionalfeature.effect: The forest goblin shaman can use its action to sacrifice a Tiny mammal to innately cast one of the following spells: bestow curse, cure wounds, or healing word. The forest goblin shaman starts combat with 6 ({@dice 1d6 + 3}) Tiny mammals in its possession.

optionalfeature.name: Thought Components
entries: The formian queen ignores all component requirements for both her innate spells and sorcerer spells.
optionalfeature.effect: The formian queen ignores all component requirements for both her innate spells and sorcerer spells.

optionalfeature.name: Immobile
entries: The formian queen is incapable of moving. Her speed is always 0 feet and it can't be increased beyond that. She cannot use any actions that require moving her body in any way. Attack rolls against the formian queen have advantage and she automatically fails Dexterity and Strength saving throws.
optionalfeature.effect: The formian queen is incapable of moving. Her speed is always 0 feet and it can't be increased beyond that. She cannot use any actions that require moving her body in any way. Attack rolls against the formian queen have advantage and she automatically fails Dexterity and Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Sand Glide (Sand Form Only)
entries: The fragrite can burrow through sand without disturbing the material it moves through.
optionalfeature.effect: The fragrite can burrow through sand without disturbing the material it moves through.

optionalfeature.name: Sand Camouflage (Sand Form Only)
entries: The fragrite has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.
optionalfeature.effect: The fragrite has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Walker
entries: The fraughashar's speed is unimpeded by rocky, snowy, or icy terrain. It never needs to make Dexterity checks to move or avoid falling {@condition prone} because of icy or snowy ground.
optionalfeature.effect: The fraughashar's speed is unimpeded by rocky, snowy, or icy terrain. It never needs to make Dexterity checks to move or avoid falling {@condition prone} because of icy or snowy ground.

optionalfeature.name: Leap Attack
entries: The froghoul doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.
optionalfeature.effect: The froghoul doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Acid
entries: The frostveil's frozen acidic mist breaks down flesh and organic materials into useable nutrients. Creatures who strike the frostveil with a non-reach melee weapon or an unarmed strike take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The frostveil's frozen acidic mist breaks down flesh and organic materials into useable nutrients. Creatures who strike the frostveil with a non-reach melee weapon or an unarmed strike take 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Form
entries: The fulminar can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the fulminar or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Merciless
entries: The fury has advantage on melee attack rolls against a {@condition frightened} creature.
optionalfeature.effect: The fury has advantage on melee attack rolls against a {@condition frightened} creature.

optionalfeature.name: Tribal Mask
entries: The gajalaka wears a red mask. These red masks have different color accents, ranging from blue to yellow to purple to black, to represent what condition their weapons afflict. Roll {@dice 1d4}, On a 1 blue represents stone knife; On a 2 yellow represents paralysis knife; On a 3 purple represents poison knife; and on a 4 black represents blind knife.
optionalfeature.effect: The gajalaka wears a red mask. These red masks have different color accents, ranging from blue to yellow to purple to black, to represent what condition their weapons afflict. Roll {@dice 1d4}, On a 1 blue represents stone knife; On a 2 yellow represents paralysis knife; On a 3 purple represents poison knife; and on a 4 black represents blind knife.

optionalfeature.name: Hungry Frenzy
entries: The gaki has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.
optionalfeature.effect: The gaki has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hp.

optionalfeature.name: Shifting Camouflage
entries: The gargoctopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.
optionalfeature.effect: The gargoctopus has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

optionalfeature.name: Eerie Resemblance
entries: The gas spore resembles a beholder. A creature that can see the gas spore can discern its true nature with a successful {@dc 15} Intelligence (Nature) check.
optionalfeature.effect: The gas spore resembles a beholder. A creature that can see the gas spore can discern its true nature with a successful {@dc 15} Intelligence (Nature) check.

optionalfeature.name: Metal Shape (1/Day)
entries: The gear mage can reshape metal with a touch. When grasping a Small or smaller piece of nonmagical metal, the gear mage can alter the form into any shape that suits its purpose. The item must be in the gear mage's hands and under its control; the mage can't, for example, reshape a piece of armor or a weapon that's being worn or wielded by someone else. To create a specific object, such as a key or mechanical component, the gear mage must be completely familiar with it. Thus, it could replicate a key that it had in its possession for an extended period of time, but it could not create a working key based on seeing the lock alone. Objects the gear mage creates can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail is not possible.
optionalfeature.effect: The gear mage can reshape metal with a touch. When grasping a Small or smaller piece of nonmagical metal, the gear mage can alter the form into any shape that suits its purpose. The item must be in the gear mage's hands and under its control; the mage can't, for example, reshape a piece of armor or a weapon that's being worn or wielded by someone else. To create a specific object, such as a key or mechanical component, the gear mage must be completely familiar with it. Thus, it could replicate a key that it had in its possession for an extended period of time, but it could not create a working key based on seeing the lock alone. Objects the gear mage creates can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail is not possible.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive Zone
entries: The gearforged templar can make an opportunity attack when a creature enters its reach.
optionalfeature.effect: The gearforged templar can make an opportunity attack when a creature enters its reach.

optionalfeature.name: Pain Indifference
entries: The general's AC includes its Constitution modifier.
optionalfeature.effect: The general's AC includes its Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The general's weapon attacks are magical. When the general hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The general's weapon attacks are magical. When the general hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Turn Defiance
entries: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
optionalfeature.effect: The ghast and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

optionalfeature.name: Lesser Regeneration
entries: The ghast regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.
optionalfeature.effect: The ghast regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point but fewer hit points than half its hit point maximum.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Of Defiance
entries: The ghost dwarf and any undead within 10 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
optionalfeature.effect: The ghost dwarf and any undead within 10 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

optionalfeature.name: Skulker
entries: The ghoul gains an additional action during the first round of combat. Any hit it scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.
optionalfeature.effect: The ghoul gains an additional action during the first round of combat. Any hit it scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

optionalfeature.name: Foul Regeneration
entries: The ghoul regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghoul is targeted by dispel magic or is in the area of an antimagic field, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghoul's next turn. The ghoul is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.
optionalfeature.effect: The ghoul regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghoul is targeted by dispel magic or is in the area of an antimagic field, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghoul's next turn. The ghoul is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

optionalfeature.name: Cast Iron Stomach
entries: The giant can consume half of its weight in food without ill effect, and it has advantage against anything that would give it the {@condition poisoned} condition. Poisonous and spoiled foodstuffs are common in a thursir lair.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant can consume half of its weight in food without ill effect, and it has advantage against anything that would give it the {@condition poisoned} condition. Poisonous and spoiled foodstuffs are common in a thursir lair.

optionalfeature.name: See Invisibility
entries: The giant can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible and can see into the Ethereal Plane. This trait is granted by the ancestral spirits.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant can see {@condition invisible} creatures and objects as if they were visible and can see into the Ethereal Plane. This trait is granted by the ancestral spirits.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: The giant can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Skirmish Advantage
entries: The giant gains advantage on the first attack roll of its turn if it has moved to a space at least 15 feet from the space it occupied at the start of its turn.
