optionalfeature.effect: The giant gains advantage on the first attack roll of its turn if it has moved to a space at least 15 feet from the space it occupied at the start of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Earthbound Superiority (3/day)
entries: The giant has advantage on attack rolls made against targets that are touching the earth. In addition, creatures that are touching the earth have disadvantage on saving throws made against spells cast by the giant.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant has advantage on attack rolls made against targets that are touching the earth. In addition, creatures that are touching the earth have disadvantage on saving throws made against spells cast by the giant.

optionalfeature.name: Sand Camouflage
entries: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in sandy terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Hunter's Dash (1/Day)
entries: The giant sloth moves double its normal speed and has advantage on all of its attacks for 1 round.
optionalfeature.effect: The giant sloth moves double its normal speed and has advantage on all of its attacks for 1 round.

optionalfeature.name: Headfirst Charge
entries: The giff can try to knock a creature over; if the giff moves at least 20 feet in a straight line that ends with in 5 feet of a Large or smaller creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: The giff can try to knock a creature over; if the giff moves at least 20 feet in a straight line that ends with in 5 feet of a Large or smaller creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Firearms Knowledge
entries: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of muskets and pistols.
optionalfeature.effect: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of muskets and pistols.

optionalfeature.name: Firearms Knowledge
entries: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of muskets and pistols.
optionalfeature.effect: The giff's mastery of its weapons enables it to ignore the loading property of muskets and pistols.

optionalfeature.name: Swimby
entries: The gill-man doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it swims out of an enemy's reach.
optionalfeature.effect: The gill-man doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it swims out of an enemy's reach.

optionalfeature.name: Transparency
entries: The glass gator has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater or in dim light.
optionalfeature.effect: The glass gator has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while underwater or in dim light.

optionalfeature.name: Glavenus Tail
entries: The glavenus can use its bonus action to to sharpen its tail, removing the acidic crystals that cover it; or it can use the bonus action to regrow them.
optionalfeature.effect: The glavenus can use its bonus action to to sharpen its tail, removing the acidic crystals that cover it; or it can use the bonus action to regrow them.

optionalfeature.name: Vanish
entries: The gloom stalker can take the Hide action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The gloom stalker can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Glittering Carapace
entries: The glossy, iridescent carapaces of the beetles in the swarm scatter and tint light in a dazzling exhibition of colors. In bright light, a creature within 30 feet that looks at the prismatic beetle swarm must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked {@condition unconscious}. Unless it's surprised, a creature can avoid the saving throw by choosing to avert its eyes at the start of its turn. A creature that averts its eyes can't see the swarm until the start of its next turn, when it can choose to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the swarm in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw. The saving throw is made with advantage if the swarm of prismatic beetles is in dim light, and this ability has no effect if the swarm is in darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: The glossy, iridescent carapaces of the beetles in the swarm scatter and tint light in a dazzling exhibition of colors. In bright light, a creature within 30 feet that looks at the prismatic beetle swarm must make a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also knocked {@condition unconscious}. Unless it's surprised, a creature can avoid the saving throw by choosing to avert its eyes at the start of its turn. A creature that averts its eyes can't see the swarm until the start of its next turn, when it can choose to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the swarm in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw. The saving throw is made with advantage if the swarm of prismatic beetles is in dim light, and this ability has no effect if the swarm is in darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Lightning Lope
entries: The gnoll can Dash or Disengage as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The gnoll can Dash or Disengage as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Pitch
entries: The gogmazios secretes tar from its body like sweat. Every 10 feet the gogmazios moves, it leaves tar in a unoccupied 5-foot area. Each creature in that enters the area or starts its turn in that area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, or become {@condition Tarred|mhmm}.
optionalfeature.effect: The gogmazios secretes tar from its body like sweat. Every 10 feet the gogmazios moves, it leaves tar in a unoccupied 5-foot area. Each creature in that enters the area or starts its turn in that area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, or become {@condition Tarred|mhmm}.

optionalfeature.name: Escape Artist (1/Day)
entries: The golden cat teleports up to 30 feet as a move.
optionalfeature.effect: The golden cat teleports up to 30 feet as a move.

optionalfeature.name: Water Walker
entries: The golem can move across the surface of water as if it were harmless, solid ground. This trait works like the water walk spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The golem can move across the surface of water as if it were harmless, solid ground. This trait works like the water walk spell.

optionalfeature.name: Quicksilver
entries: The golem takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage when it activates this infusion. The golem's silver hide turns to shifting quicksilver, increasing its speed to 40 feet and granting it resistance to damage to which it is not already immune.
optionalfeature.effect: The golem takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage when it activates this infusion. The golem's silver hide turns to shifting quicksilver, increasing its speed to 40 feet and granting it resistance to damage to which it is not already immune.

optionalfeature.name: Salt
entries: The golem takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage when it activates this infusion. The golem's silver hide is covered with salt crystals, increasing its AC by 3. The golem's slam attacks deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and the ground within 20 feet of the golem becomes difficult terrain for 1 hour.
optionalfeature.effect: The golem takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage when it activates this infusion. The golem's silver hide is covered with salt crystals, increasing its AC by 3. The golem's slam attacks deal an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and the ground within 20 feet of the golem becomes difficult terrain for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Boiling Body
entries: The golem's body is hot to the touch, thanks to the boiler inside its chest. A creature that touches the golem or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The golem's body is hot to the touch, thanks to the boiler inside its chest. A creature that touches the golem or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vulnerable Legs
entries: The goliath longlegs has eight legs. While it has more than four legs, the goliath longlegs is immune to being knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition restrained}. Whenever the goliath longlegs takes 20 or more damage in a single turn, one of its legs is destroyed. Each time a leg is destroyed after the fourth one, the goliath longlegs must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Any creature in the goliath longlegs' space or within 5 feet of it when it falls {@condition prone} must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: The goliath longlegs has eight legs. While it has more than four legs, the goliath longlegs is immune to being knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition restrained}. Whenever the goliath longlegs takes 20 or more damage in a single turn, one of its legs is destroyed. Each time a leg is destroyed after the fourth one, the goliath longlegs must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Any creature in the goliath longlegs' space or within 5 feet of it when it falls {@condition prone} must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly To Fey
entries: The goo has advantage on attack rolls against fey and any creature with the Fey Ancestry trait.
optionalfeature.effect: The goo has advantage on attack rolls against fey and any creature with the Fey Ancestry trait.

optionalfeature.name: Beholder Slayer
entries: The gouger has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws made against beholders.
optionalfeature.effect: The gouger has advantage on attack rolls and saving throws made against beholders.

optionalfeature.name: Many-Eyed
entries: The gray render has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
optionalfeature.effect: The gray render has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

optionalfeature.name: Thirst
entries: The gray thirster projects a 30-foot aura of desiccating thirst. The first time a creature enters the aura on its turn, or when it starts its turn in the aura, it must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the gray thirster's Thirst for the next 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The gray thirster projects a 30-foot aura of desiccating thirst. The first time a creature enters the aura on its turn, or when it starts its turn in the aura, it must make a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If the saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the gray thirster's Thirst for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Flyer
entries: The great cockatrice can fly in spaces that would allow a creature of Medium size to do so. While it is airborne its AC increases by 2 and if the cockatrice is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.
optionalfeature.effect: The great cockatrice can fly in spaces that would allow a creature of Medium size to do so. While it is airborne its AC increases by 2 and if the cockatrice is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Mental Fortitude
entries: The great old master has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.
optionalfeature.effect: The great old master has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Gremlin Tactics
entries: The gremlin can move through, but not end its move in a square occupied by a Medium or larger creature, even an enemy, without being slowed.
optionalfeature.effect: The gremlin can move through, but not end its move in a square occupied by a Medium or larger creature, even an enemy, without being slowed.

optionalfeature.name: Ethereal Web
entries: The ground in a 30-foot radius around the uhogguath is covered in semi-solid ethereal webs, making the area difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the ethereal web until the start of its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The ground in a 30-foot radius around the uhogguath is covered in semi-solid ethereal webs, making the area difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the ethereal web until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rooted Defense
entries: The ground within 30 feet of the guardian is difficult terrain.
optionalfeature.effect: The ground within 30 feet of the guardian is difficult terrain.

optionalfeature.name: Sylvan Thorns
entries: The guardian's weapon attacks are magical. When the primeval guardian hits a creature with a slam attack, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The guardian's weapon attacks are magical. When the primeval guardian hits a creature with a slam attack, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Hearing
entries: The gulgar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on hearing, but it has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks not based on hearing.
optionalfeature.effect: The gulgar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks based on hearing, but it has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks not based on hearing.

optionalfeature.name: Crystalline Bone
entries: The gulgar's slam and gore attacks are adamantine.
optionalfeature.effect: The gulgar's slam and gore attacks are adamantine.

optionalfeature.name: Through Grass And Sheaves
entries: The gumienniki's speed is doubled when traveling over grassy areas or through planted crops.
optionalfeature.effect: The gumienniki's speed is doubled when traveling over grassy areas or through planted crops.

optionalfeature.name: Gutter Slyness
entries: The gutter gnoll fighter has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in sewers and alleyways that are in darkness or dim light.
optionalfeature.effect: The gutter gnoll fighter has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in sewers and alleyways that are in darkness or dim light.

optionalfeature.name: Elder Graystaff Magic
entries: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with her Innate Spellcasting trait (these spells are marked with an asterisk). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.
optionalfeature.effect: The hag carries a graystaff, a length of gray wood that is a focus for her inner power. She can ride the staff as if it were a broom of flying. While holding the staff, she can cast additional spells with her Innate Spellcasting trait (these spells are marked with an asterisk). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the hag must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a bheur hag can use a graystaff.

optionalfeature.name: Entangle
entries: The hanged man's noose is a 20-foot length of rope that moves on its own like an animated object to entangle opponents of any size. An entangled creature is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. If it is not already adjacent to the hanged man, the rope initiates a Strength contest against the entangled creature on each of the hanged man's turns. If the rope wins the contest, it pulls the entangled creature 10 feet closer to the hanged man. If the entangled creature wins the Str contest, it stays at its current range from the hanged man. Only one creature can be entangled at a time. The rope can be attacked directly (AC 13); it is destroyed by 15 points of slashing or fire damage but is immune to all other damage. If the rope is severed, both it and the hanged man are destroyed. The rope becomes nothing more than 20 feet of rotted rope if removed from the hanged man.
optionalfeature.effect: The hanged man's noose is a 20-foot length of rope that moves on its own like an animated object to entangle opponents of any size. An entangled creature is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. If it is not already adjacent to the hanged man, the rope initiates a Strength contest against the entangled creature on each of the hanged man's turns. If the rope wins the contest, it pulls the entangled creature 10 feet closer to the hanged man. If the entangled creature wins the Str contest, it stays at its current range from the hanged man. Only one creature can be entangled at a time. The rope can be attacked directly (AC 13); it is destroyed by 15 points of slashing or fire damage but is immune to all other damage. If the rope is severed, both it and the hanged man are destroyed. The rope becomes nothing more than 20 feet of rotted rope if removed from the hanged man.

optionalfeature.name: Cruel Mimicry
entries: The haunted crow can eerily copy voices that it has heard within the past day, and any of the voices of those that it has watched die. A {@dc 17} Wisdom (Insight) check reveals that the sound is false.
optionalfeature.effect: The haunted crow can eerily copy voices that it has heard within the past day, and any of the voices of those that it has watched die. A {@dc 17} Wisdom (Insight) check reveals that the sound is false.

optionalfeature.name: Shrouded Dance
entries: The haunted crow leaves a trail of dark shadow behind it as it flies that remains until the start of its next turn. Whenever it attacks using Peck, it can choose to attack from any point along that shadow trail.
optionalfeature.effect: The haunted crow leaves a trail of dark shadow behind it as it flies that remains until the start of its next turn. Whenever it attacks using Peck, it can choose to attack from any point along that shadow trail.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestor's Protection
entries: The heir has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the heir. If the heir's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the heir is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the heir, turning the caster into the target.
optionalfeature.effect: The heir has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the heir. If the heir's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the heir is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the heir, turning the caster into the target.

optionalfeature.name: Spellshield
entries: The hellfire disciple has advantage on saving throws against spells. If it succeeds on such a saving throw, it gains temporary hit points equal to the spell's level.
optionalfeature.effect: The hellfire disciple has advantage on saving throws against spells. If it succeeds on such a saving throw, it gains temporary hit points equal to the spell's level.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Immunity
entries: The helmed horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include {@spell fireball}, {@spell heat metal}, and {@spell lightning bolt}.
optionalfeature.effect: The helmed horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include {@spell fireball}, {@spell heat metal}, and {@spell lightning bolt}.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Armor
entries: The herald of blood takes no damage from the first attack against it each round and ignores any nondamaging effects of the attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The herald of blood takes no damage from the first attack against it each round and ignores any nondamaging effects of the attack.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Herald
entries: The herald of fire can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form. In each form, its eyes glow with magical fire and it wears a silver sword, revealing its identity as a herald. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying, other than the silver sword, transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.
optionalfeature.effect: The herald of fire can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form. In each form, its eyes glow with magical fire and it wears a silver sword, revealing its identity as a herald. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying, other than the silver sword, transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Herald
entries: The herald of the great wyrm can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form.
optionalfeature.effect: The herald of the great wyrm can use its action to polymorph into a Medium dragonborn, Medium human, Small kobold, or back into its true draconic humanoid form.

optionalfeature.name: Aura Of Immobility
entries: The herald of the great wyrm emits an area of antimagic within 60 feet of itself. This trait works like the antimagic field spell, except it only affects magical travel.
optionalfeature.effect: The herald of the great wyrm emits an area of antimagic within 60 feet of itself. This trait works like the antimagic field spell, except it only affects magical travel.

optionalfeature.name: Poultice (3/Day)
entries: The herbalist spends 1 minute to apply a poultice to a wounded creature. That creature regains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points. Alternatively, it can use this ability to cure the creature of one poison afflicting it.
optionalfeature.effect: The herbalist spends 1 minute to apply a poultice to a wounded creature. That creature regains 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points. Alternatively, it can use this ability to cure the creature of one poison afflicting it.

optionalfeature.name: Hexblade
entries: The hexblade wielder is bonded to a sentient weapon, for which it uses its Charisma modifier for its attack and damage rolls. The hexblade wielder and its weapon can communicate telepathically, and the hexblade wielder obeys its bonded weapon's commands. The hexblade wielder can use its bonus action to teleport its bonded weapon into a free hand, or a bonus action to temporarily dismiss the bonded weapon into a pocket dimension. If the hexblade wielder spends at least 1 hour without touching its bonded weapon, the hexblade wielder dies and the weapon appears in an empty space within 10 feet of it.
optionalfeature.effect: The hexblade wielder is bonded to a sentient weapon, for which it uses its Charisma modifier for its attack and damage rolls. The hexblade wielder and its weapon can communicate telepathically, and the hexblade wielder obeys its bonded weapon's commands. The hexblade wielder can use its bonus action to teleport its bonded weapon into a free hand, or a bonus action to temporarily dismiss the bonded weapon into a pocket dimension. If the hexblade wielder spends at least 1 hour without touching its bonded weapon, the hexblade wielder dies and the weapon appears in an empty space within 10 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Weapon Bond: Blackrazor
entries: The hexblade wielder's bonded weapon is Blackrazor, a chaotic evil sentient greatsword (Int 21, Wis 17, Cha 25). Blackrazor is a legendary +3 magic weapon.
optionalfeature.effect: The hexblade wielder's bonded weapon is Blackrazor, a chaotic evil sentient greatsword (Int 21, Wis 17, Cha 25). Blackrazor is a legendary +3 magic weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Summon Bat Swarm
entries: The high-frequency cries of a skin bat attract nearby mundane bats. When a skin bat faces danger, 0–3 ({@dice 1d4 - 1}) swarms of bats arrive within {@dice 1d6} rounds. These swarms are not under the skin bat's command, but they tend to reflexively attack whatever the skin bat is fighting.
optionalfeature.effect: The high-frequency cries of a skin bat attract nearby mundane bats. When a skin bat faces danger, 0–3 ({@dice 1d4 - 1}) swarms of bats arrive within {@dice 1d6} rounds. These swarms are not under the skin bat's command, but they tend to reflexively attack whatever the skin bat is fighting.

optionalfeature.name: Hallucinogen Immunity
entries: The hill goblin alchemist has immunity to the effects of its hallucinogenic potions as long as it is wearing its mask.
optionalfeature.effect: The hill goblin alchemist has immunity to the effects of its hallucinogenic potions as long as it is wearing its mask.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Trainer
entries: The hill goblin beast master has one of the following beasts or groups of beasts at its command (roll a {@dice d4}): 1. 4 worg pups 2. 3 worg runts 3. 2 worg mothers 4. 1 worg alpha
optionalfeature.effect: The hill goblin beast master has one of the following beasts or groups of beasts at its command (roll a {@dice d4}): 1. 4 worg pups 2. 3 worg runts 3. 2 worg mothers 4. 1 worg alpha

optionalfeature.name: Battled Hardened
entries: The hill goblin champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
optionalfeature.effect: The hill goblin champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Long Draw
entries: The hobgoblin archer deals one additional die of damage with its longbow (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The hobgoblin archer deals one additional die of damage with its longbow (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Sharpshooter
entries: The hobgoblin's ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the hobgoblin's ranged weapon attack rolls.
optionalfeature.effect: The hobgoblin's ranged weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the hobgoblin's ranged weapon attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Loud Machinery
entries: The horse has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The horse has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Darkvision
entries: The horseman can see perfectly in normal and magical darkness.
optionalfeature.effect: The horseman can see perfectly in normal and magical darkness.

optionalfeature.name: Entrance By Corners
entries: The hound of Tindalos may only enter the Material Plane at a sharp intersection of surfaces. As a bonus action, the hound can teleport from one location to another within sight of the first, provided it travels from one sharp corner to another.
optionalfeature.effect: The hound of Tindalos may only enter the Material Plane at a sharp intersection of surfaces. As a bonus action, the hound can teleport from one location to another within sight of the first, provided it travels from one sharp corner to another.

optionalfeature.name: Howl
entries: The howl of a church grim forces any evil creature within its limited domain (see below) to make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. Good or Neutral creatures are unaffected by the howl as long as they are not intending to steal anything or attack the church while inside the church grim's domain. Once a character succeeds or fails at this saving throw, it need not make another against the same church grim's howl until after the character takes a long rest.
optionalfeature.effect: The howl of a church grim forces any evil creature within its limited domain (see below) to make a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. Good or Neutral creatures are unaffected by the howl as long as they are not intending to steal anything or attack the church while inside the church grim's domain. Once a character succeeds or fails at this saving throw, it need not make another against the same church grim's howl until after the character takes a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Oblivious of Its Nature
entries: The howling echo can't use its incorporeal movement knowingly, it only passes through creatures or objects it is unaware of, or if it is forced by an outside source. A howling echo must always try to end its movement in contact with what it deems to be solid ground.
optionalfeature.effect: The howling echo can't use its incorporeal movement knowingly, it only passes through creatures or objects it is unaware of, or if it is forced by an outside source. A howling echo must always try to end its movement in contact with what it deems to be solid ground.

optionalfeature.name: Protection of Hatred
entries: The hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of it.
optionalfeature.effect: The hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures within 5 feet of it.

optionalfeature.name: Skilled Tracker
entries: The hunter magically knows the distance to and direction of its quarry, so long as the creature is within 50 miles of the hunter.
optionalfeature.effect: The hunter magically knows the distance to and direction of its quarry, so long as the creature is within 50 miles of the hunter.

optionalfeature.name: Swift Pursuit
entries: The huntmaster and a group of up to five other creatures can travel at a fast pace without taking the usual −5 penalty to their passive Wisdom (Perception) to notice hidden threats. Additionally, the huntmaster can track creatures and still contribute its passive Wisdom (Perception) score to the group's chance of noticing hidden threats.
optionalfeature.effect: The huntmaster and a group of up to five other creatures can travel at a fast pace without taking the usual −5 penalty to their passive Wisdom (Perception) to notice hidden threats. Additionally, the huntmaster can track creatures and still contribute its passive Wisdom (Perception) score to the group's chance of noticing hidden threats.

optionalfeature.name: Elk Speech
entries: The huntmaster can speak with elks and other types of deer as if under the constant effect of a speak with animals spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The huntmaster can speak with elks and other types of deer as if under the constant effect of a speak with animals spell.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The huntsman's weapon attacks are magical. When the huntsman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} cold damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The huntsman's weapon attacks are magical. When the huntsman hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Predator
entries: The ichneumon is immune to a dragon's Frightful Presence and has advantage on saving throws against the breath weapons of dragons.
optionalfeature.effect: The ichneumon is immune to a dragon's Frightful Presence and has advantage on saving throws against the breath weapons of dragons.

optionalfeature.name: Apostasy Aura
entries: The idolic deity's presence causes devout followers to doubt their faith. A cleric or paladin that can see the idolic deity and wishes to cast a spell or use a class feature must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell or class feature is spent as if it was used, but it has no effect.
optionalfeature.effect: The idolic deity's presence causes devout followers to doubt their faith. A cleric or paladin that can see the idolic deity and wishes to cast a spell or use a class feature must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell or class feature is spent as if it was used, but it has no effect.

optionalfeature.name: Slippery Scales
entries: The imperial cobra can take the Disengage or Dash actions as bonus actions. The cobra also has advantage on checks to escape a grapple.
optionalfeature.effect: The imperial cobra can take the Disengage or Dash actions as bonus actions. The cobra also has advantage on checks to escape a grapple.

optionalfeature.name: Unerring Eye (3/Day)
entries: The inquisitor can use a bonus action to sense the presence of illusions, shapechangers not in their original form, and other magic designed to deceive the senses within 30 feet of it, provided it isn't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. The inquisitor senses only the presence of these effects, not their form.
optionalfeature.effect: The inquisitor can use a bonus action to sense the presence of illusions, shapechangers not in their original form, and other magic designed to deceive the senses within 30 feet of it, provided it isn't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. The inquisitor senses only the presence of these effects, not their form.

optionalfeature.name: Eye for Detail
entries: The inquisitor has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks, and a +5 bonus to its passive Perception and passive Investigation scores.
optionalfeature.effect: The inquisitor has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks, and a +5 bonus to its passive Perception and passive Investigation scores.

optionalfeature.name: Enchanted Cage
entries: The iron cage that holds the fetal savant provides cover for the creature. The cage (AC 19, 10 hp) is considered an equipped object when borne by a derro and cannot be attacked directly. In addition, the cage protects the occupant from up to 20 spell levels of spells 4th level or lower but provides no protection to those outside of the cage. Spells of level 5 or higher take full, normal effect against the cage and its occupant. Once the cage protects against 20 or more spell levels it is rendered non-magical. If exposed to direct sunlight for over one hour of cumulative time it is destroyed.
optionalfeature.effect: The iron cage that holds the fetal savant provides cover for the creature. The cage (AC 19, 10 hp) is considered an equipped object when borne by a derro and cannot be attacked directly. In addition, the cage protects the occupant from up to 20 spell levels of spells 4th level or lower but provides no protection to those outside of the cage. Spells of level 5 or higher take full, normal effect against the cage and its occupant. Once the cage protects against 20 or more spell levels it is rendered non-magical. If exposed to direct sunlight for over one hour of cumulative time it is destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Grandmother's Teeth
entries: The iron teeth of Baba Yaga are sentient, magical, and airborne dentures that sometimes work at cross-purposes to the Old Witch. If the teeth and Baba Yaga are getting along, the teeth reside inside her mouth, providing her with a bite attack and access to its spell list. Baba Yaga can cast a spell from the teeth's innate spell list as a bonus action, using her spellcasting ability. Spells cast in this way are removed from the teeth's spells per day total. If the witch and her teeth are not getting along, the teeth will fly around casting its spells as it wishes (often to the benefit of Baba Yaga's enemies).
optionalfeature.effect: The iron teeth of Baba Yaga are sentient, magical, and airborne dentures that sometimes work at cross-purposes to the Old Witch. If the teeth and Baba Yaga are getting along, the teeth reside inside her mouth, providing her with a bite attack and access to its spell list. Baba Yaga can cast a spell from the teeth's innate spell list as a bonus action, using her spellcasting ability. Spells cast in this way are removed from the teeth's spells per day total. If the witch and her teeth are not getting along, the teeth will fly around casting its spells as it wishes (often to the benefit of Baba Yaga's enemies).

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The islander can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The islander also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The islander can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The islander also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Artisan
entries: The islander has proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of its choice.
optionalfeature.effect: The islander has proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of its choice.

optionalfeature.name: Atmospheric Immunity
entries: The isonade can comfortably exist at any level of the sea and suffers no penalties at any depth.
optionalfeature.effect: The isonade can comfortably exist at any level of the sea and suffers no penalties at any depth.

optionalfeature.name: Light-Footed
entries: The jester has resistance to damage taken as a result of a fall.
optionalfeature.effect: The jester has resistance to damage taken as a result of a fall.

optionalfeature.name: Pheromones
entries: The jeweled drone emits a sweet scent that empowers other tosculi within 15 feet of the drone. A tosculi that starts its turn within the area can add a {@dice d6} to one attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of its next turn, provided it can smell the scent. A tosculi can benefit from only one Pheromones die at a time. This effect ends if the jeweled drone dies.
optionalfeature.effect: The jeweled drone emits a sweet scent that empowers other tosculi within 15 feet of the drone. A tosculi that starts its turn within the area can add a {@dice d6} to one attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of its next turn, provided it can smell the scent. A tosculi can benefit from only one Pheromones die at a time. This effect ends if the jeweled drone dies.

optionalfeature.name: Prayer Of Magic Resistance
entries: The jiangshi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. A creature can take its action while within 5 feet of the jiangshi to rip the prayer off the jiangshi by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Strength check.
optionalfeature.effect: The jiangshi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. A creature can take its action while within 5 feet of the jiangshi to rip the prayer off the jiangshi by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Strength check.

optionalfeature.name: Processing
entries: The juggernaut amphoron is equipped with a large, moving crane mounted on its back. In addition to attacking with its whirling saw blades, the juggernaut can pick up one creature per round with its crane and hoist it aloft. On that creature's turn, it can make a Strength (Athletics) saving throw or Dexterity (Acrobatics) saving throw (with tactical disadvantage if the creature is wearing metal armor, because of the magnets in the crane), opposed by the juggernaut's Strength check. If the creature wins the contest, it struggles free from the crane and drops harmlessly to the ground. If the juggernaut wins the contest, then on its next turn, it drops the creature into the processing chamber. Any creature dropped through the hatch is immediately reduced to 0 hit points and must make a death saving throw each turn until either it dies or the juggernaut amphoron is destroyed; a dying creature can't stabilize inside a juggernaut's processing chamber. If the creature dies, it emerges from the juggernaut's ejection hatch on the juggernaut's next turn as a brick of processed concentrate. A death saving throw is not required on a turn when the juggernaut flickers.
optionalfeature.effect: The juggernaut amphoron is equipped with a large, moving crane mounted on its back. In addition to attacking with its whirling saw blades, the juggernaut can pick up one creature per round with its crane and hoist it aloft. On that creature's turn, it can make a Strength (Athletics) saving throw or Dexterity (Acrobatics) saving throw (with tactical disadvantage if the creature is wearing metal armor, because of the magnets in the crane), opposed by the juggernaut's Strength check. If the creature wins the contest, it struggles free from the crane and drops harmlessly to the ground. If the juggernaut wins the contest, then on its next turn, it drops the creature into the processing chamber. Any creature dropped through the hatch is immediately reduced to 0 hit points and must make a death saving throw each turn until either it dies or the juggernaut amphoron is destroyed; a dying creature can't stabilize inside a juggernaut's processing chamber. If the creature dies, it emerges from the juggernaut's ejection hatch on the juggernaut's next turn as a brick of processed concentrate. A death saving throw is not required on a turn when the juggernaut flickers.

optionalfeature.name: Wallow
entries: The jyuratodus wallows in mud, covering itself in a thick layer, which grants the Jyuratodus +3 AC for 1 minute or until it takes 25 damage in a single turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The jyuratodus wallows in mud, covering itself in a thick layer, which grants the Jyuratodus +3 AC for 1 minute or until it takes 25 damage in a single turn.

optionalfeature.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: The kapi can use its tail to pick up or hold a small object that isn't being worn or carried. It can use its tail to interact with objects, leaving its hands free to wield weapons or carry heavier objects. The kapi can't use its tail to wield a weapon but can use it to trip an opponent (see below).
optionalfeature.effect: The kapi can use its tail to pick up or hold a small object that isn't being worn or carried. It can use its tail to interact with objects, leaving its hands free to wield weapons or carry heavier objects. The kapi can't use its tail to wield a weapon but can use it to trip an opponent (see below).

optionalfeature.name: Expert Wrestler
entries: The kappa can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at full speed when dragging a creature it has {@condition grappled}.
optionalfeature.effect: The kappa can grapple creatures that are two sizes larger than itself and can move at full speed when dragging a creature it has {@condition grappled}.

optionalfeature.name: Head Bowl
entries: The kappa has a bowl-like indentation on its head which holds water from the river or lake where it lives. If the kappa's head bowl is empty, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the bowl is refilled with water.
optionalfeature.effect: The kappa has a bowl-like indentation on its head which holds water from the river or lake where it lives. If the kappa's head bowl is empty, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the bowl is refilled with water.

optionalfeature.name: Night Walkers
entries: The karakura can only exist on the Material Plane at night or underground. Spells or effects that count as sunlight cast the fiend back to the Plane of Shadow for {@dice 1d4} hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The karakura can only exist on the Material Plane at night or underground. Spells or effects that count as sunlight cast the fiend back to the Plane of Shadow for {@dice 1d4} hours.

optionalfeature.name: Gliding
entries: The kecha wacha can glide up to 40 feet instead of moving, when the kecha wacha glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 5 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the kecha wacha falls to the ground if it is still in the air.
optionalfeature.effect: The kecha wacha can glide up to 40 feet instead of moving, when the kecha wacha glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 5 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the kecha wacha falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

optionalfeature.name: Agile Parry
entries: The kensei gains the same benefits from its glaive as it would from a shield.
optionalfeature.effect: The kensei gains the same benefits from its glaive as it would from a shield.

optionalfeature.name: Electric Barrier
entries: The khezu shrouds its body in electricity. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the khezu takes 15 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage.
optionalfeature.effect: The khezu shrouds its body in electricity. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the khezu takes 15 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fortitude
entries: The kikimore has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.
optionalfeature.effect: The kikimore has advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: White Frost Weapons
entries: The king's weapon attacks are magical. When the king hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage and {@dice 4d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The king's weapon attacks are magical. When the king hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 4d8} cold damage and {@dice 4d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Sacred Weapons
entries: The kingsguard's weapon attacks are magical. When the kingsguard hits with its morningstar, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The kingsguard's weapon attacks are magical. When the kingsguard hits with its morningstar, the weapon deals an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Eternal Lovers
entries: The kinnara shares a powerful bond with its partner and can't be turned against its partner by magical or non-magical means.
optionalfeature.effect: The kinnara shares a powerful bond with its partner and can't be turned against its partner by magical or non-magical means.

optionalfeature.name: Control Lightning
entries: The kirin can choose any location within 30 feet of it as the starting location of the lightning bolt spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The kirin can choose any location within 30 feet of it as the starting location of the lightning bolt spell.

optionalfeature.name: Demon Wrangler
entries: The knife cultist has an affinity with summoned demons. They obey it without question and are immune to being {@condition charmed}. In addition, demons summoned by the cultist have advantage on saving throws against spells or effects that would send them to another plane (including their home plane).
optionalfeature.effect: The knife cultist has an affinity with summoned demons. They obey it without question and are immune to being {@condition charmed}. In addition, demons summoned by the cultist have advantage on saving throws against spells or effects that would send them to another plane (including their home plane).

optionalfeature.name: Aura of the Exalted
entries: The knight and friendly creatures within 30 feet of the knight have advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws.
optionalfeature.effect: The knight and friendly creatures within 30 feet of the knight have advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Righteous Might
entries: The knight conqueror scores a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19, or 20.
optionalfeature.effect: The knight conqueror scores a critical hit on a roll of 18, 19, or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Sunbeetle Armor
entries: The knight's armor is perpetually slick. Any attempts to grapple the knight have disadvantage.
optionalfeature.effect: The knight's armor is perpetually slick. Any attempts to grapple the knight have disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Animate Objects (1/Day)
entries: The kobold casts animate objects without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.
optionalfeature.effect: The kobold casts animate objects without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Quickload
entries: The kobold commando ignores the loading quality of light crossbows.
optionalfeature.effect: The kobold commando ignores the loading quality of light crossbows.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Leaper
entries: The kobold hunting drake has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks that involve jumping. The kobold hunting drake doubles its Strength score when determining long jump and high jump distances cleared.
optionalfeature.effect: The kobold hunting drake has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks that involve jumping. The kobold hunting drake doubles its Strength score when determining long jump and high jump distances cleared.

optionalfeature.name: Traps and Snares
entries: The kobold trapsmith excels at setting mechanical traps. Detecting, disarming, avoiding, or mitigating its traps require successful {@dc 13} checks or saving throws, and the traps have +5 attack bonuses. With thief's tools and basic construction materials, a trapsmith can set up one of the simple but effective traps listed below in 5 minutes. Triggers involve pressure plates, tripwires, small catches in a lock, or other simple mechanisms.
optionalfeature.effect: The kobold trapsmith excels at setting mechanical traps. Detecting, disarming, avoiding, or mitigating its traps require successful {@dc 13} checks or saving throws, and the traps have +5 attack bonuses. With thief's tools and basic construction materials, a trapsmith can set up one of the simple but effective traps listed below in 5 minutes. Triggers involve pressure plates, tripwires, small catches in a lock, or other simple mechanisms.

optionalfeature.name: Thief's Tools
entries: The kobold trapsmith has proficiency with thief's tools and is seldom without them. If its tools are taken away or lost, it can cobble together a new set from wire, bits of metal, and other junk in 30 minutes.
optionalfeature.effect: The kobold trapsmith has proficiency with thief's tools and is seldom without them. If its tools are taken away or lost, it can cobble together a new set from wire, bits of metal, and other junk in 30 minutes.

optionalfeature.name: Prophetic Vision (1/Turn)
entries: The kryt catches a glimpse of the immediate future and gains advantage on one attack roll or one saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The kryt catches a glimpse of the immediate future and gains advantage on one attack roll or one saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Sensitive Beak
entries: The kulu-ya-ku has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks when attempting to locate anything buried in the ground.
optionalfeature.effect: The kulu-ya-ku has advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks when attempting to locate anything buried in the ground.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Creature
entries: The kulve taroth counts as a number of creatures equal to it's paragon multiplier (3) for the purposes of determining combat encounters. The XP value for a kulve taroth is multiplied by it's paragon multiplier.
optionalfeature.effect: The kulve taroth counts as a number of creatures equal to it's paragon multiplier (3) for the purposes of determining combat encounters. The XP value for a kulve taroth is multiplied by it's paragon multiplier.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Fortitude
entries: The kulve taroth has multiple pools of hit points (3), each which is tracked separately. Damage and healing only applies to the current hit point pool. When a pool is depleted of all hit points, it becomes inactive. When this happens, the kulve taroth immediately saves against all ongoing conditions and effects. If all hit point pools are inactive, the kulve taroth dies. When it takes a long rest, the kulve taroth heals all hit points in the current pool and fully heals one depleted hit point pool.
optionalfeature.effect: The kulve taroth has multiple pools of hit points (3), each which is tracked separately. Damage and healing only applies to the current hit point pool. When a pool is depleted of all hit points, it becomes inactive. When this happens, the kulve taroth immediately saves against all ongoing conditions and effects. If all hit point pools are inactive, the kulve taroth dies. When it takes a long rest, the kulve taroth heals all hit points in the current pool and fully heals one depleted hit point pool.

optionalfeature.name: Gold Mantle
entries: The Kulve Taroth is covered in a gold plating While it remains intact, its AC is increased by 3 and its speed is reduced by 20 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The Kulve Taroth is covered in a gold plating While it remains intact, its AC is increased by 3 and its speed is reduced by 20 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Paragon Fury
entries: The kulve taroth rolls initiative with advantage. The kulve taroth starts with 0 paragon actions. If a hit point pool is depleted, the kulve taroth gains one additional paragon action. The kulve taroth may use a paragon action after any other creature takes a turn. If the kulve taroth does so, they regain their reaction. A paragon action is a complete turn. They have an action, bonus action and may move up to their full speed. The paragon actions refresh at the start of the kulve taroth's turn and any remaining actions from the previous turn are lost.
optionalfeature.effect: The kulve taroth rolls initiative with advantage. The kulve taroth starts with 0 paragon actions. If a hit point pool is depleted, the kulve taroth gains one additional paragon action. The kulve taroth may use a paragon action after any other creature takes a turn. If the kulve taroth does so, they regain their reaction. A paragon action is a complete turn. They have an action, bonus action and may move up to their full speed. The paragon actions refresh at the start of the kulve taroth's turn and any remaining actions from the previous turn are lost.

optionalfeature.name: Slide
entries: The Lacombi's reflexes and agility allow it to move with a burst of speed. When it moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed while traveling in a straight line. If the Lacombi runs into a creature after moving at least 20 feet the creature must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The Lacombi cannot use this skill again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.
optionalfeature.effect: The Lacombi's reflexes and agility allow it to move with a burst of speed. When it moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed while traveling in a straight line. If the Lacombi runs into a creature after moving at least 20 feet the creature must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. The Lacombi cannot use this skill again until it moves 0 feet on one of its turns.

optionalfeature.name: Walking Disaster
entries: The lao-shan lung can enter a Large or smaller creature's space. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, or begins its turn adjacent to or in a creatures space it can make a Stomp attack against the creature.
optionalfeature.effect: The lao-shan lung can enter a Large or smaller creature's space. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, or begins its turn adjacent to or in a creatures space it can make a Stomp attack against the creature.

optionalfeature.name: Casual Stroll
entries: the lao-shan lung cannot take the dash action, unless it is fleeing.
optionalfeature.effect: the lao-shan lung cannot take the dash action, unless it is fleeing.

optionalfeature.name: Prison Belly
entries: The large belly of the ammut magically sustains the life of those trapped inside it. A creature caught in its belly doesn't need food, water, or air. The ammut can maintain one Medium or smaller creature this way as long as the ammut remains alive.
optionalfeature.effect: The large belly of the ammut magically sustains the life of those trapped inside it. A creature caught in its belly doesn't need food, water, or air. The ammut can maintain one Medium or smaller creature this way as long as the ammut remains alive.

optionalfeature.name: Earthmother
entries: The leathdhia can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The leathdhia takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
optionalfeature.effect: The leathdhia can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. Each creature it moves through takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn. The leathdhia takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Glide
entries: The lemurfolk can glide for 1 minute, making almost no sound. It gains a fly speed of 40 feet, and it must move at least 20 feet on its turn to keep flying. A gliding lemurfolk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The lemurfolk can glide for 1 minute, making almost no sound. It gains a fly speed of 40 feet, and it must move at least 20 feet on its turn to keep flying. A gliding lemurfolk has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Poisoned Weapons
entries: The lesser erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a hit (included in its attacks).
optionalfeature.effect: The lesser erinyes's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage on a hit (included in its attacks).

optionalfeature.name: Shadowlike
entries: The leucrotta has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in darkness and areas of dim light.
optionalfeature.effect: The leucrotta has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks while in darkness and areas of dim light.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Tolerance
entries: The lizardfolk can comfortably breathe air saturated with smoke, as long as it is not created by burning substances that release toxic material when on fire, and have advantage on saving throws against poisons inhaled through smoke.
optionalfeature.effect: The lizardfolk can comfortably breathe air saturated with smoke, as long as it is not created by burning substances that release toxic material when on fire, and have advantage on saving throws against poisons inhaled through smoke.

optionalfeature.name: Warpstar
entries: The lodestar sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Every creature within the light has disadvantage on saving throws. Aberrations within the light, including the lodestar, have advantage on saving throws instead.
optionalfeature.effect: The lodestar sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. Every creature within the light has disadvantage on saving throws. Aberrations within the light, including the lodestar, have advantage on saving throws instead.

optionalfeature.name: Water Spirit
entries: The lorelei is under the effect of freedom of movement whenever she is in contact with a body of water.
optionalfeature.effect: The lorelei is under the effect of freedom of movement whenever she is in contact with a body of water.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Life
entries: The lost minotaur can magically sense the presence of living creatures within 1 mile away. It knows each creature's general direction but not exact location.
optionalfeature.effect: The lost minotaur can magically sense the presence of living creatures within 1 mile away. It knows each creature's general direction but not exact location.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Pool
entries: The lotus golem absorbs energy from nearby spellcasting. Most lotus golems hold 1 charge point at any given time but can hold up to 4. As a bonus action while casting a spell within 5 feet of the lotus golem, the golem's controller can expend the golem's charge points to cast the spell without expending a spell slot. To do so, the controller must expend a number of charge points equal to the level of the spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The lotus golem absorbs energy from nearby spellcasting. Most lotus golems hold 1 charge point at any given time but can hold up to 4. As a bonus action while casting a spell within 5 feet of the lotus golem, the golem's controller can expend the golem's charge points to cast the spell without expending a spell slot. To do so, the controller must expend a number of charge points equal to the level of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Kin Awareness
entries: The lubberkin knows the distance to and direction of any creature part of its family, even if the creature and the lubberkin are on different planes of existence. If a creature that is part of the family dies, the lubberkin knows.
optionalfeature.effect: The lubberkin knows the distance to and direction of any creature part of its family, even if the creature and the lubberkin are on different planes of existence. If a creature that is part of the family dies, the lubberkin knows.

optionalfeature.name: Glow
entries: The lubberkin sheds bright light in a 5-to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The lubberkin can alter the radius as a bonus action. While inside the radius of bright light, a friendly creature gains a +3 bonus to its saving throws.
optionalfeature.effect: The lubberkin sheds bright light in a 5-to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The lubberkin can alter the radius as a bonus action. While inside the radius of bright light, a friendly creature gains a +3 bonus to its saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Moonrider
entries: The lunar ravager can magically teleport at will by concentrating and not taking any other actions for 1 minute. The lunar ravager can use this only to teleport itself and items it is wearing or carrying. When outside a lunar ravager lodge, the lunar ravager must be in moonlight to use this ability and can only travel to the nearest lodge. When inside a lunar ravager lodge, it can teleport to any point within 10 miles of the lodge.
optionalfeature.effect: The lunar ravager can magically teleport at will by concentrating and not taking any other actions for 1 minute. The lunar ravager can use this only to teleport itself and items it is wearing or carrying. When outside a lunar ravager lodge, the lunar ravager must be in moonlight to use this ability and can only travel to the nearest lodge. When inside a lunar ravager lodge, it can teleport to any point within 10 miles of the lodge.

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The macnia can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The macnia also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The macnia can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The macnia also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Flesh Burrowing
entries: The maggot can burrow through a dead creature's flesh as though it had a burrow speed of 5 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The maggot can burrow through a dead creature's flesh as though it had a burrow speed of 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blistering Radiance
entries: The malakbel generates a 30-foot-radius aura of searing light and heat. A creature that starts its turn in the aura, or who enters it for the first time on a turn, takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage. The area in the aura is brightly lit, and it sheds dim light for another 30 feet. The aura dispels magical darkness of 3rd level or lower where the areas overlap.
optionalfeature.effect: The malakbel generates a 30-foot-radius aura of searing light and heat. A creature that starts its turn in the aura, or who enters it for the first time on a turn, takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage. The area in the aura is brightly lit, and it sheds dim light for another 30 feet. The aura dispels magical darkness of 3rd level or lower where the areas overlap.

optionalfeature.name: Scent Magic
entries: The manabane scarab swarm can detect the presence of magical creatures, active spells or spell effects, and magical items within 120 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The manabane scarab swarm can detect the presence of magical creatures, active spells or spell effects, and magical items within 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Mana Erosion
entries: The manabane scarab swarm consumes magic. Unattended magic items in the swarm's space at the end of the swarm's turn have their effects suppressed for 1 minute. Additionally, charged items in the swarm's space lose {@dice 1d6} charges at the start of each of the swarm's turns; items with limited uses per day lose one daily use instead, and single-use items such as potions or scrolls are destroyed. Magical effects in the swarm's space are dispelled (as if affected by dispel magic cast with +5 spellcasting ability).
optionalfeature.effect: The manabane scarab swarm consumes magic. Unattended magic items in the swarm's space at the end of the swarm's turn have their effects suppressed for 1 minute. Additionally, charged items in the swarm's space lose {@dice 1d6} charges at the start of each of the swarm's turns; items with limited uses per day lose one daily use instead, and single-use items such as potions or scrolls are destroyed. Magical effects in the swarm's space are dispelled (as if affected by dispel magic cast with +5 spellcasting ability).

optionalfeature.name: Mystic Messages
entries: The manastorm golem can communicate with its maker via magical whispers at a distance up to 120 feet. Only its master hears these messages and can reply. Its messages go through solid objects but are halted by stone, magical silence, a sheet of lead, and similar obstacles. Its voice can travel through keyholes and around corners.
optionalfeature.effect: The manastorm golem can communicate with its maker via magical whispers at a distance up to 120 feet. Only its master hears these messages and can reply. Its messages go through solid objects but are halted by stone, magical silence, a sheet of lead, and similar obstacles. Its voice can travel through keyholes and around corners.

optionalfeature.name: Vorpal Bite
entries: The mandibles of a slicer beetle are extremely sharp. It scores a critical hit if the attack roll is a natural 19 or 20. If a slicer beetle scores a critical hit on its attack roll, the affected creature must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. Failure indicates the slicer beetle severed one of the opponent's extremities (roll {@dice 1d8}: 1–4 = arm, 5–8 = leg; even = right, odd = left).
optionalfeature.effect: The mandibles of a slicer beetle are extremely sharp. It scores a critical hit if the attack roll is a natural 19 or 20. If a slicer beetle scores a critical hit on its attack roll, the affected creature must make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. Failure indicates the slicer beetle severed one of the opponent's extremities (roll {@dice 1d8}: 1–4 = arm, 5–8 = leg; even = right, odd = left).

optionalfeature.name: Healing Pool
entries: The master has a pool of 20 hit points it can draw from to use its Healing Hands action. It replenishes the pool when it completes a long rest.
optionalfeature.effect: The master has a pool of 20 hit points it can draw from to use its Healing Hands action. It replenishes the pool when it completes a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Diplomat
entries: The master has advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to calm violent emotions or to counsel peace.
optionalfeature.effect: The master has advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to calm violent emotions or to counsel peace.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Tactics
entries: The mastermind can use the Help action as a bonus action. When used to assist an ally in attacking a creature, the target of the attack can be within 30 feet of the mastermind.
optionalfeature.effect: The mastermind can use the Help action as a bonus action. When used to assist an ally in attacking a creature, the target of the attack can be within 30 feet of the mastermind.

optionalfeature.name: Speak With Snakes
entries: The matriarch serpentine lamia can communicate with snakes as if they shared a language.
optionalfeature.effect: The matriarch serpentine lamia can communicate with snakes as if they shared a language.

optionalfeature.name: Serpent Strike
entries: The matriarch serpentine lamia has advantage on attack rolls against a creature she has surprised or that is {@condition charmed} by her or her allies.
optionalfeature.effect: The matriarch serpentine lamia has advantage on attack rolls against a creature she has surprised or that is {@condition charmed} by her or her allies.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Body
entries: The matriarch serpentine lamia has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against being knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: The matriarch serpentine lamia has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against being knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Disease Carrier
entries: The meazel is immune to the ill effects of diseases, but can still be infected and transmit them to other creatures. All meazels carry a skin disease. A creature that touches the meazel, including being hit by its claw attack, must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw against this skin disease or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 hour. After one hour the diseased creature gains disadvantage on Dexterity and Constitution checks and saving throws until the disease is cured.
optionalfeature.effect: The meazel is immune to the ill effects of diseases, but can still be infected and transmit them to other creatures. All meazels carry a skin disease. A creature that touches the meazel, including being hit by its claw attack, must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw against this skin disease or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 hour. After one hour the diseased creature gains disadvantage on Dexterity and Constitution checks and saving throws until the disease is cured.

optionalfeature.name: Rend Mind {@recharge 5}
entries: The meenlock projects thoughts images of stalking monsters and peering eyes into a humanoid it is aware of within 120 feet of itself, inducing paranoia. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
optionalfeature.effect: The meenlock projects thoughts images of stalking monsters and peering eyes into a humanoid it is aware of within 120 feet of itself, inducing paranoia. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Metal Sense
entries: The megapede can sense any metal within 600 feet of it. It knows the direction to the metal and can identify the specific type of metal within the area.
optionalfeature.effect: The megapede can sense any metal within 600 feet of it. It knows the direction to the metal and can identify the specific type of metal within the area.

optionalfeature.name: Disquieting Technology
entries: The mi-go are a highly advanced race, and may carry items of powerful technology. Mi-go technology can be represented using the same rules as magic items, but their functions are very difficult to determine: identify is useless, but an hour of study and a successful {@dc 19} Arcana check can reveal the purpose and proper functioning of a mi-go item.
optionalfeature.effect: The mi-go are a highly advanced race, and may carry items of powerful technology. Mi-go technology can be represented using the same rules as magic items, but their functions are very difficult to determine: identify is useless, but an hour of study and a successful {@dc 19} Arcana check can reveal the purpose and proper functioning of a mi-go item.

optionalfeature.name: Plane Shift
entries: The midnight peddler can use the plane shift spell at will. He can shift only himself, his cart, and the nonliving contents of his cart; he can't bring along willing companions or banish other creatures.
optionalfeature.effect: The midnight peddler can use the plane shift spell at will. He can shift only himself, his cart, and the nonliving contents of his cart; he can't bring along willing companions or banish other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Mimic Page
entries: The mimic can disguise itself as any tiny, flat object—a piece of leather, a plate—not only a map. In any form, a map mimic can make a map on its skin leading to its mother mimic.
optionalfeature.effect: The mimic can disguise itself as any tiny, flat object—a piece of leather, a plate—not only a map. In any form, a map mimic can make a map on its skin leading to its mother mimic.

optionalfeature.name: Interior Awareness
entries: The mimic can sense everything going on inside it as though it had blindsight reaching everywhere in its interior.
optionalfeature.effect: The mimic can sense everything going on inside it as though it had blindsight reaching everywhere in its interior.

optionalfeature.name: Unassailable Mind
entries: The mind of a red jester is a twisted and dangerous place to peer into. If a living creature targets a red jester with an attack that normally causes psychic damage, or tries to use telepathy on a red jester, that creature must make a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or be cursed, with an effect identical to a permanent confusion spell. The confusion effect can be ended only by magic that lifts the curse.
optionalfeature.effect: The mind of a red jester is a twisted and dangerous place to peer into. If a living creature targets a red jester with an attack that normally causes psychic damage, or tries to use telepathy on a red jester, that creature must make a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or be cursed, with an effect identical to a permanent confusion spell. The confusion effect can be ended only by magic that lifts the curse.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Screen
entries: The mind of an encephalon gorger is an alien and dangerous place. Should a creature attempt to scan the mind or read the thoughts of an encephalon gorger with magic or psionics (not just gauging intent with Insight skill), the creature making the attempt must make a successful {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be driven insane (Intelligence and Wisdom both reduced to 3). Even on a successful save, the creature suffers the effects of a confusion spell for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
optionalfeature.effect: The mind of an encephalon gorger is an alien and dangerous place. Should a creature attempt to scan the mind or read the thoughts of an encephalon gorger with magic or psionics (not just gauging intent with Insight skill), the creature making the attempt must make a successful {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be driven insane (Intelligence and Wisdom both reduced to 3). Even on a successful save, the creature suffers the effects of a confusion spell for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Bloodgreed
entries: The minotaur has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: The minotaur has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Oiled Body
entries: The mizutsune has advantage on Dexterity (acrobatic) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The mizutsune has advantage on Dexterity (acrobatic) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Feline Empathy
entries: The mngwa has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to deal with felines.
optionalfeature.effect: The mngwa has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks to deal with felines.

optionalfeature.name: Master Tactician
entries: The monarch skeleton and any skeletons within 30 feet of it have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the skeleton's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: The monarch skeleton and any skeletons within 30 feet of it have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the skeleton's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Simian Affinity
entries: The Monkey King can communicate with primates as if they shared a language. In addition, he can control primates with an Intelligence of 8 or lower that are within 120 feet of him.
optionalfeature.effect: The Monkey King can communicate with primates as if they shared a language. In addition, he can control primates with an Intelligence of 8 or lower that are within 120 feet of him.

optionalfeature.name: Curative Saliva
entries: The moon drake's saliva can be bottled, distilled, and used in 1-ounce doses. An afflicted lycanthrope that drinks this concoction is instantly cured of lycanthropy, requiring no saving throw. This draught can't cure a natural-born lycanthrope of the curse of lycanthropy.
optionalfeature.effect: The moon drake's saliva can be bottled, distilled, and used in 1-ounce doses. An afflicted lycanthrope that drinks this concoction is instantly cured of lycanthropy, requiring no saving throw. This draught can't cure a natural-born lycanthrope of the curse of lycanthropy.

optionalfeature.name: Defensive Adaptation
entries: The morphlit can use its bonus action to polymorph gain immunity to any single damage type. The damage immunity remains until the morphlit uses this ability again. The morphlit also deals an extra 4 ({@dice 1d8}) damage of the chosen type when it hits with its bite attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The morphlit can use its bonus action to polymorph gain immunity to any single damage type. The damage immunity remains until the morphlit uses this ability again. The morphlit also deals an extra 4 ({@dice 1d8}) damage of the chosen type when it hits with its bite attack.

optionalfeature.name: Shapeshifter
entries: The morphoi can use its action to polymorph into a Medium creature or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment the morphoi is carrying or wearing isn't transformed. The morphoi reverts to its true form when it dies.
optionalfeature.effect: The morphoi can use its action to polymorph into a Medium creature or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment the morphoi is carrying or wearing isn't transformed. The morphoi reverts to its true form when it dies.
