entries: The sooze is trained and equipped as a warrior. Its Armor Class increases by 2. The sooze has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: The sooze is trained and equipped as a warrior. Its Armor Class increases by 2. The sooze has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Watery Form
entries: The sorcerer can move through a space as narrow as 3 inches wide without squeezing.
optionalfeature.effect: The sorcerer can move through a space as narrow as 3 inches wide without squeezing.

optionalfeature.name: Conductor of the Wind
entries: The sorcerer can use its bonus action to change the direction of the wind within a 100-foot radius around it. The sorcerer can choose the direction but not the strength of the wind.
optionalfeature.effect: The sorcerer can use its bonus action to change the direction of the wind within a 100-foot radius around it. The sorcerer can choose the direction but not the strength of the wind.

optionalfeature.name: Blessed by Stone
entries: The sorcerer's weapon attacks are magical. When the sorcerer hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The sorcerer's weapon attacks are magical. When the sorcerer hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Horn
entries: The source of a tentacled horrors power is its horn. If a tentacled horrors horn is removed or destroyed, the creature loses its regeneration ability, cant take legendary actions, and has disadvantage on attack rolls. The horn can be attacked specifically with targeted attacks but not area affects; it has AC 20, 30 hit points, and is immune to all damage types except slashing, bludgeoning, and force damage from spells or magic weapons. The horn can be torn off with a successful {@dc 25} Strength (Athletics) check made by a creature that is grappling the tentacled horror. Damage done to the horn does not reduce the tentacled horrors hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: The source of a tentacled horrors power is its horn. If a tentacled horrors horn is removed or destroyed, the creature loses its regeneration ability, cant take legendary actions, and has disadvantage on attack rolls. The horn can be attacked specifically with targeted attacks but not area affects; it has AC 20, 30 hit points, and is immune to all damage types except slashing, bludgeoning, and force damage from spells or magic weapons. The horn can be torn off with a successful {@dc 25} Strength (Athletics) check made by a creature that is grappling the tentacled horror. Damage done to the horn does not reduce the tentacled horrors hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Swarming Cough {@recharge 5}
entries: The spawn can belch forth a swarm of insects. The swarm is completely under the spawn's control. It remains for 1 minute or until destroyed.
optionalfeature.effect: The spawn can belch forth a swarm of insects. The swarm is completely under the spawn's control. It remains for 1 minute or until destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Ingest
entries: The specified number of normal Gems of your opponent's color become Void Gems. Void Gems may be consumed by a Process ability, or matched on the board. Matching Void Gems only gives mana to cards with Devoid.
optionalfeature.effect: The specified number of normal Gems of your opponent's color become Void Gems. Void Gems may be consumed by a Process ability, or matched on the board. Matching Void Gems only gives mana to cards with Devoid.

optionalfeature.name: Telepathic Seclusion
entries: The spell weaver is all but immune to telepathy. Attempts to communicate with it or to to read its mind using telepathy (such as with a detect thoughts spell or similar magic) automatically fail. Any creature making such an attempt must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage from the mental feedback and be {@condition stunned} for 1 round. Spell weavers can communicate with each other using their telepathy ability, but telepathy spells they cast still fail automatically and the casting spell weaver must save against the feedback.
optionalfeature.effect: The spell weaver is all but immune to telepathy. Attempts to communicate with it or to to read its mind using telepathy (such as with a detect thoughts spell or similar magic) automatically fail. Any creature making such an attempt must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage from the mental feedback and be {@condition stunned} for 1 round. Spell weavers can communicate with each other using their telepathy ability, but telepathy spells they cast still fail automatically and the casting spell weaver must save against the feedback.

optionalfeature.name: Steeple Step
entries: The spire walker can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically from its position to the point of a steeple, mast, or other spire-like feature that is in view within 30 feet. The spire walker has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws while it is standing on a steeple or any similar narrow, steep structure or feature.
optionalfeature.effect: The spire walker can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically from its position to the point of a steeple, mast, or other spire-like feature that is in view within 30 feet. The spire walker has advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws while it is standing on a steeple or any similar narrow, steep structure or feature.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Form
entries: The spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the spirit or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. In addition, the spirit can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. Any creature which ends its turn in the same space as the spirit takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage at the end of its turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the spirit or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. In addition, the spirit can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. Any creature which ends its turn in the same space as the spirit takes 2 ({@dice 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage at the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Jumpy
entries: The spirit lamp can't be surprised and can use a bonus action to take the Disengage action.
optionalfeature.effect: The spirit lamp can't be surprised and can use a bonus action to take the Disengage action.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Lantern
entries: The spirit lamp's lantern is immune to damage and can't be the target of spells or effects as long as the spirit lamp lives. When the spirit lamp dies, the lantern floats gently to the ground and opens, if it was closed. The lantern has AC 17, 50 hp, and is immune to piercing, poison, and psychic damage. A creature that touches the lantern must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature is {@condition frightened} of darkness, can't see anything outside of the lantern's light, and is unable to drop the lantern. The cursed creature will risk its own life to protect the lantern. A creature can repeat the saving throw each day at dawn, lifting the curse and ending the effects on itself on a success. If this occurs, the lantern disintegrates. After three failed saving throws, remove curse or similar magic is required to end the curse.
optionalfeature.effect: The spirit lamp's lantern is immune to damage and can't be the target of spells or effects as long as the spirit lamp lives. When the spirit lamp dies, the lantern floats gently to the ground and opens, if it was closed. The lantern has AC 17, 50 hp, and is immune to piercing, poison, and psychic damage. A creature that touches the lantern must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature is {@condition frightened} of darkness, can't see anything outside of the lantern's light, and is unable to drop the lantern. The cursed creature will risk its own life to protect the lantern. A creature can repeat the saving throw each day at dawn, lifting the curse and ending the effects on itself on a success. If this occurs, the lantern disintegrates. After three failed saving throws, remove curse or similar magic is required to end the curse.

optionalfeature.name: Frothing Rage
entries: The spree demon has advantage on attacks if it saw another spree demon make a successful attack within the last minute.
optionalfeature.effect: The spree demon has advantage on attacks if it saw another spree demon make a successful attack within the last minute.

optionalfeature.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: The spriggan is considered to be both a fey and a plant creature to determine the way a spell or effect would affect her.
optionalfeature.effect: The spriggan is considered to be both a fey and a plant creature to determine the way a spell or effect would affect her.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Aim
entries: The stalker deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage when it hits with a ranged weapon attack (included in the attack). Additionally its ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
optionalfeature.effect: The stalker deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage when it hits with a ranged weapon attack (included in the attack). Additionally its ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

optionalfeature.name: Fearsome Gaze
entries: The stare of an einherjar is especially piercing and intimidating. They make Intimidation checks with advantage.
optionalfeature.effect: The stare of an einherjar is especially piercing and intimidating. They make Intimidation checks with advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Unmatched Smell
entries: The steel predator automatically passes Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Its sense of smell is so accurate that it functions as blindsight with a range of 30 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The steel predator automatically passes Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Its sense of smell is so accurate that it functions as blindsight with a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Deaf
entries: The steel predator is permanently {@condition deafened}.
optionalfeature.effect: The steel predator is permanently {@condition deafened}.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Sense
entries: The steel predator senses the number and direction of every metallic magical object within 120 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The steel predator senses the number and direction of every metallic magical object within 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ferrovore
entries: The steel predator's bite deals double damage against objects and creatures consisting primarily of metal. It has advantage on attack rolls with its bite against creatures wearing armor or with natural armor consisting primarily of metal.
optionalfeature.effect: The steel predator's bite deals double damage against objects and creatures consisting primarily of metal. It has advantage on attack rolls with its bite against creatures wearing armor or with natural armor consisting primarily of metal.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Stone
entries: The stone child can pick up any mundane stone or piece of rock, no larger than its fist, and imbue it with magic energy, when throwing it, making a Magic Stone attack with the stone. The attack is magical.
optionalfeature.effect: The stone child can pick up any mundane stone or piece of rock, no larger than its fist, and imbue it with magic energy, when throwing it, making a Magic Stone attack with the stone. The attack is magical.

optionalfeature.name: Tempest
entries: The storm lord is surrounded in a 120-foot-radius by a ferocious storm. The storm imposes disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks based on sight or hearing within the area. The storm lord's own senses and attacks are not impaired by this trait.
optionalfeature.effect: The storm lord is surrounded in a 120-foot-radius by a ferocious storm. The storm imposes disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks based on sight or hearing within the area. The storm lord's own senses and attacks are not impaired by this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Leap
entries: The stuhac can jump three times the normal distance: 66 feet horizontally or 27 feet vertically with a running start, or half those distances from a stationary start.
optionalfeature.effect: The stuhac can jump three times the normal distance: 66 feet horizontally or 27 feet vertically with a running start, or half those distances from a stationary start.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Sense
entries: The su monster immediately recognizes any creature with psionic abilities within 30 feet as such.
optionalfeature.effect: The su monster immediately recognizes any creature with psionic abilities within 30 feet as such.

optionalfeature.name: Flesh Burrowing
entries: The swarm can burrow through a dead creature's flesh as though it had a burrow speed of 5 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The swarm can burrow through a dead creature's flesh as though it had a burrow speed of 5 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Swarm Fortitude
entries: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.
optionalfeature.effect: The swarm fights at full strength until it is completely destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Forced movement
entries: The target is moved an additional 15 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The target is moved an additional 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Entangling
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage and is {@condition restrained} by sticky, alchemical goo. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, bursting through the goo on a success. The goo can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; immunity to piercing, slashing, poison, and psychic damage).
optionalfeature.effect: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage and is {@condition restrained} by sticky, alchemical goo. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 16} Strength check, bursting through the goo on a success. The goo can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; immunity to piercing, slashing, poison, and psychic damage).

optionalfeature.name: Explosive
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and catches on fire, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 16} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.
optionalfeature.effect: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) fire damage and catches on fire, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 16} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

optionalfeature.name: Concussive
entries: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: The target takes an extra 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Cold Damage
entries: The target's speed is reduced by 15 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The target's speed is reduced by 15 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Living Storm
entries: The tempest is always at the center of a storm l{@dice d6 + 4} miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.
optionalfeature.effect: The tempest is always at the center of a storm l{@dice d6 + 4} miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

optionalfeature.name: Scour (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The Templar moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
optionalfeature.effect: The Templar moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Green Strider
entries: The tendril puppet ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.
optionalfeature.effect: The tendril puppet ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.

optionalfeature.name: Martial Superiority (1/Turn)
entries: The thane can deal an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The thane can deal an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Limited Regeneration
entries: The thrall regains 2 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp and isn't in sunlight. If the thrall takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the thrall's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The thrall regains 2 hp at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hp and isn't in sunlight. If the thrall takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the thrall's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Snow Vision
entries: The thuellai see perfectly well in snowy conditions. It does not suffer Wisdom (Perception) penalties from snow, whiteout, or snow blindness.
optionalfeature.effect: The thuellai see perfectly well in snowy conditions. It does not suffer Wisdom (Perception) penalties from snow, whiteout, or snow blindness.

optionalfeature.name: Sparkling Scales
entries: The titanoboa's scales refract light in iridescent cascades that are hypnotic to gaze upon. If the titanoboa is in bright light, a creature within 30 feet that looks at it must make a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avoid the saving throw by choosing to avert its eyes at the start of its turn. A creature that averts its eyes can't see the titanoboa until the start of its next turn, when it can choose to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the titanoboa in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The titanoboa's scales refract light in iridescent cascades that are hypnotic to gaze upon. If the titanoboa is in bright light, a creature within 30 feet that looks at it must make a successful {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avoid the saving throw by choosing to avert its eyes at the start of its turn. A creature that averts its eyes can't see the titanoboa until the start of its next turn, when it can choose to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the titanoboa in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Gliding
entries: The tobi-kadachi has a gliding speed of 60 feet. When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.
optionalfeature.effect: The tobi-kadachi has a gliding speed of 60 feet. When the tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

optionalfeature.name: Ink Jet {@recharge}
entries: The tojanida emits a stream of ink (no action required). If emitted under water, this ink form's a cloud in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the tojanida. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. Emitted outside of water, the ink is shot at a creature of the tojanida's choice within 30 feet of the tojanida. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded}. A creature can use an action to clear the ink off its eyes, ending the condition on itself.
optionalfeature.effect: The tojanida emits a stream of ink (no action required). If emitted under water, this ink form's a cloud in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on the tojanida. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. Emitted outside of water, the ink is shot at a creature of the tojanida's choice within 30 feet of the tojanida. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded}. A creature can use an action to clear the ink off its eyes, ending the condition on itself.

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Weapons
entries: The tormentor's weapon attacks are magical. When the tormentor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The tormentor's weapon attacks are magical. When the tormentor hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 2d8} psychic damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Gliding Wings
entries: The tosculi drone can use its wings to slowly descend when falling (as if under the effect of the feather fall spell). It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every foot it falls. The tosculi drone can't gain height with these wings alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.
optionalfeature.effect: The tosculi drone can use its wings to slowly descend when falling (as if under the effect of the feather fall spell). It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every foot it falls. The tosculi drone can't gain height with these wings alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

optionalfeature.name: Skirmisher
entries: The tosculi elite bow raider can Dash as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The tosculi elite bow raider can Dash as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Precision
entries: The tosculi elite bow raider's ranged attacks do an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage (included below).
optionalfeature.effect: The tosculi elite bow raider's ranged attacks do an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage (included below).

optionalfeature.name: Crossbow Expert
entries: The trapper ignores the loading quality on crossbows. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on its ranged attack rolls.
optionalfeature.effect: The trapper ignores the loading quality on crossbows. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on its ranged attack rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Charming Presence
entries: The treacle has an uncanny ability to sense and to play off of another creature's emotions. It uses Charisma (Deception) to oppose Wisdom (Insight or Perception) skill checks made to see through its ruse, and it has advantage on its check.
optionalfeature.effect: The treacle has an uncanny ability to sense and to play off of another creature's emotions. It uses Charisma (Deception) to oppose Wisdom (Insight or Perception) skill checks made to see through its ruse, and it has advantage on its check.

optionalfeature.name: Tree Camouflage
entries: The tree woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in terrain with ample obscuration by leaf trees, such as a temperate forest.
optionalfeature.effect: The tree woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in terrain with ample obscuration by leaf trees, such as a temperate forest.

optionalfeature.name: Powerful Grip
entries: The tulgar ignores the two-handed quality of melee and thrown weapons. When wielding a weapon with the versatile quality, it always uses the higher damage die, even while wielding it in one hand.
optionalfeature.effect: The tulgar ignores the two-handed quality of melee and thrown weapons. When wielding a weapon with the versatile quality, it always uses the higher damage die, even while wielding it in one hand.

optionalfeature.name: It Follows
entries: The tulpa always remains within 500 feet if its creator.
optionalfeature.effect: The tulpa always remains within 500 feet if its creator.

optionalfeature.name: Siege Beast
entries: The tuskaloth deals double damage to objects and structures.
optionalfeature.effect: The tuskaloth deals double damage to objects and structures.

optionalfeature.name: Unerring Tracker
entries: The tveirherjar can locate any einherjar within 1,000 feet. This trait works like the locate creature spell, except running water doesn't block it.
optionalfeature.effect: The tveirherjar can locate any einherjar within 1,000 feet. This trait works like the locate creature spell, except running water doesn't block it.

optionalfeature.name: Niflheim Longsword
entries: The tveirherjar's longsword absorbs light within 30 feet of it, changing bright light to dim light and dim light to darkness. When the tveirherjar dies, its longsword crumbles away, its magic returning to the creator for the next tveirherjar.
optionalfeature.effect: The tveirherjar's longsword absorbs light within 30 feet of it, changing bright light to dim light and dim light to darkness. When the tveirherjar dies, its longsword crumbles away, its magic returning to the creator for the next tveirherjar.

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Telepathy
entries: The undine can communicate telepathically with any creature cursed by it with no range restriction. The undine doesn't need to be on the same plane of existence as its cursed target to communicate this way.
optionalfeature.effect: The undine can communicate telepathically with any creature cursed by it with no range restriction. The undine doesn't need to be on the same plane of existence as its cursed target to communicate this way.

optionalfeature.name: Undying Nature
entries: The undying can hold its breath indefinitely, and it doesn't require food, water, or sleep. Additionally, undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against the undying, and the undying has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects created by undead.
optionalfeature.effect: The undying can hold its breath indefinitely, and it doesn't require food, water, or sleep. Additionally, undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against the undying, and the undying has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects created by undead.

optionalfeature.name: Effluvium Spores
entries: The vaal hazak's body is covered with four white spore pods. Whenever a creature touches or hits the vaal hazak with an attack or spell, or when the vaal hazak uses its effluvium breath, it releases two spore clouds that fall to the ground in adjacent spaces next to the vaal hazak.
optionalfeature.effect: The vaal hazak's body is covered with four white spore pods. Whenever a creature touches or hits the vaal hazak with an attack or spell, or when the vaal hazak uses its effluvium breath, it releases two spore clouds that fall to the ground in adjacent spaces next to the vaal hazak.

optionalfeature.name: Deathless
entries: The vaettir is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points, but it returns to unlife where it fell on the next nightfall with full hit points. It can be killed only by removing its head, burning the corpse, and dumping the ashes in the sea, or by returning it to its burial mound, placing an open pair of scissors on its chest, and driving pins through its feet.
optionalfeature.effect: The vaettir is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points, but it returns to unlife where it fell on the next nightfall with full hit points. It can be killed only by removing its head, burning the corpse, and dumping the ashes in the sea, or by returning it to its burial mound, placing an open pair of scissors on its chest, and driving pins through its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Asgardian Weapons
entries: The valkyrie's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, it does an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage (included in attacks listed below).
optionalfeature.effect: The valkyrie's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, it does an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant damage (included in attacks listed below).

optionalfeature.name: Enigmatic Nature
entries: The vampire is immune to effects that turn undead, as well as any divination spell that it refuses.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampire is immune to effects that turn undead, as well as any divination spell that it refuses.

optionalfeature.name: Noble Resilience (Recharges After A Long Rest)
entries: The vampire patrician can ignore the effects of sunlight for up to 1 minute.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampire patrician can ignore the effects of sunlight for up to 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampiric knight can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampiric knight can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

optionalfeature.name: Harmed By Running Water
entries: The vampiric knight takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampiric knight takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Blood
entries: The vampiric mist can only sense living warm-blooded creatures with its blindsight.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampiric mist can only sense living warm-blooded creatures with its blindsight.

optionalfeature.name: Fog Camouflage
entries: The vampiric mist has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in fog. If the fog is dense enough to generally grant advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in it, the vampiric mist is {@condition invisible} inside it.
optionalfeature.effect: The vampiric mist has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in fog. If the fog is dense enough to generally grant advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in it, the vampiric mist is {@condition invisible} inside it.

optionalfeature.name: Smoky Constitution
entries: The vapor lynx spends its time in both gaseous and solid form. Its unique constitution makes it immune to all fog- or gas-related spells and attacks, including its own. A vapor lynx sees clearly through light or heavy obscurement caused by fog, mist, or spells such as fog cloud.
optionalfeature.effect: The vapor lynx spends its time in both gaseous and solid form. Its unique constitution makes it immune to all fog- or gas-related spells and attacks, including its own. A vapor lynx sees clearly through light or heavy obscurement caused by fog, mist, or spells such as fog cloud.

optionalfeature.name: Monstrous Leap
entries: The varghulf's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 25 feet, with or without a running start.
optionalfeature.effect: The varghulf's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 25 feet, with or without a running start.

optionalfeature.name: Hoarfrost Armor (2/day)
entries: The velkhana can use a bonus action to coat its body in ice, granting it a +2 bonus to its AC and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage for 1 minute, or until it takes 60 points of damage from a single creature on a turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The velkhana can use a bonus action to coat its body in ice, granting it a +2 bonus to its AC and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing damage for 1 minute, or until it takes 60 points of damage from a single creature on a turn.

optionalfeature.name: Selket's Venom
entries: The venomous mummy's body and wrappings are magically imbued with substances that are highly toxic. Any creature that comes in physical contact with the venomous mummy (e.g., touching the mummy bare-handed, grappling, using a bite attack) must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} with Selket's venom. The {@condition poisoned} target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage every 10 minutes. Selket's venom is a curse, so it lasts until ended by the remove curse spell or comparable magic.
optionalfeature.effect: The venomous mummy's body and wrappings are magically imbued with substances that are highly toxic. Any creature that comes in physical contact with the venomous mummy (e.g., touching the mummy bare-handed, grappling, using a bite attack) must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} with Selket's venom. The {@condition poisoned} target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage every 10 minutes. Selket's venom is a curse, so it lasts until ended by the remove curse spell or comparable magic.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Smoke
entries: The venomous mummy's poison-imbued wrappings and flesh create toxic fumes when burned. If a venomous mummy takes fire damage, it is surrounded by a cloud of toxic smoke in a 10-foot radius. This cloud persists for one full round. A creature that starts its turn inside the cloud or enters it for the first time on its turn takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: The venomous mummy's poison-imbued wrappings and flesh create toxic fumes when burned. If a venomous mummy takes fire damage, it is surrounded by a cloud of toxic smoke in a 10-foot radius. This cloud persists for one full round. A creature that starts its turn inside the cloud or enters it for the first time on its turn takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cunning Stealth
entries: The verbeeg can use the Hide action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The verbeeg can use the Hide action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Displacer Cloak
entries: The verbeeg's cloak projects a magical illusion that makes the verbeeg appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the verbeeg is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.
optionalfeature.effect: The verbeeg's cloak projects a magical illusion that makes the verbeeg appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the verbeeg is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

optionalfeature.name: Rootlet Swarms
entries: The vesiculosa is surrounded at all times by four Medium swarms of Tiny rootlets that move as the vesiculosa directs. Each swarm has a speed of 30 feet, can be targeted independently, has 25 hit points, and (unlike the parent plant) quite vulnerable to fire damage. Other than that, they have the same statistics as the vesiculosa's main body. For each swarm that drops to 0 hit points, the vesiculosa loses one of its Entrap attacks. A destroyed swarm regrows in 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: The vesiculosa is surrounded at all times by four Medium swarms of Tiny rootlets that move as the vesiculosa directs. Each swarm has a speed of 30 feet, can be targeted independently, has 25 hit points, and (unlike the parent plant) quite vulnerable to fire damage. Other than that, they have the same statistics as the vesiculosa's main body. For each swarm that drops to 0 hit points, the vesiculosa loses one of its Entrap attacks. A destroyed swarm regrows in 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Sweet Water
entries: The vesiculosa's pool emits a sweet fragrance that lures creatures to drink. Creatures that are neither undead nor constructs within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to approach the vesiculosa and drink. The water is cool and refreshing but carries a sleeping poison: any creature (other than undead and constructs) that drink it regain {@dice 1d4} hit points and recover from 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}, but must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against poison or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour. An {@condition unconscious} creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it awake.
optionalfeature.effect: The vesiculosa's pool emits a sweet fragrance that lures creatures to drink. Creatures that are neither undead nor constructs within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to approach the vesiculosa and drink. The water is cool and refreshing but carries a sleeping poison: any creature (other than undead and constructs) that drink it regain {@dice 1d4} hit points and recover from 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}, but must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against poison or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour. An {@condition unconscious} creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

optionalfeature.name: Verdant
entries: The vesiculosa's sap seeps into the soil, promoting lush vegetation. At any given time, {@dice 3d6} beneficial fruits (fruit, nuts, figs, dates) can be found within 30 feet of the vesiculosa. These have the same effect as berries from a goodberry spell, but they retain their potency for one week after being picked or after the vesiculosa is killed.
optionalfeature.effect: The vesiculosa's sap seeps into the soil, promoting lush vegetation. At any given time, {@dice 3d6} beneficial fruits (fruit, nuts, figs, dates) can be found within 30 feet of the vesiculosa. These have the same effect as berries from a goodberry spell, but they retain their potency for one week after being picked or after the vesiculosa is killed.

optionalfeature.name: Invasive
entries: The vile barber can enter, move through, or even remain in a hostile creature's space regardless of the creature's size, without penalty.
optionalfeature.effect: The vile barber can enter, move through, or even remain in a hostile creature's space regardless of the creature's size, without penalty.

optionalfeature.name: Inhumanly Quick
entries: The vile barber can take two bonus actions on its turn, instead of one. Each bonus action must be different; it can't use the same bonus action twice in a single turn.
optionalfeature.effect: The vile barber can take two bonus actions on its turn, instead of one. Each bonus action must be different; it can't use the same bonus action twice in a single turn.

optionalfeature.name: Close-in Slasher
entries: The vile barber has advantage on attack rolls against any creature in the same space with it.
optionalfeature.effect: The vile barber has advantage on attack rolls against any creature in the same space with it.

optionalfeature.name: Spore Sacs (1/Week)
entries: The vine lord can release seeds from specialized sacs on its tendrils. These seeds sprout into {@dice 1d4} green spore pods that reach maturity in 3 days. The pods contain noxious spores that are released when the pod is stepped on, picked, or otherwise tampered with. A humanoid or beast that inhales these spores must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or tendrils start growing inside the creature's body. If the disease is not cured within 3 months, the tendrils take over the creature's nervous system and the victim becomes a tendril puppet.
optionalfeature.effect: The vine lord can release seeds from specialized sacs on its tendrils. These seeds sprout into {@dice 1d4} green spore pods that reach maturity in 3 days. The pods contain noxious spores that are released when the pod is stepped on, picked, or otherwise tampered with. A humanoid or beast that inhales these spores must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw against disease or tendrils start growing inside the creature's body. If the disease is not cured within 3 months, the tendrils take over the creature's nervous system and the victim becomes a tendril puppet.

optionalfeature.name: Green Strider
entries: The vine lord ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.
optionalfeature.effect: The vine lord ignores movement restrictions and damage caused by natural undergrowth.

optionalfeature.name: Gliding
entries: The viper tobi-kadachi can glide up to 60 feet instead of moving, when the viper tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the viper tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.
optionalfeature.effect: The viper tobi-kadachi can glide up to 60 feet instead of moving, when the viper tobi-kadachi glides, it loses 5 feet of altitude for every 10 feet of movement. At the end of its glide the viper tobi-kadachi falls to the ground if it is still in the air.

optionalfeature.name: Augmented Critical
entries: The vivisector's blade arm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
optionalfeature.effect: The vivisector's blade arm attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

optionalfeature.name: Seeress
entries: The völva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the völva is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. While the völva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.
optionalfeature.effect: The völva can't be surprised and attack rolls against her have disadvantage unless the völva is {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained}. While the völva is wearing no armor, her AC includes her Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Wand-Wed
entries: The völva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the völva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a völva can use the staff.
optionalfeature.effect: The völva carries a staff carved out of the wood of a mystical white tree, that is a focus for her inner power. She can use the staff as if it were a staff of healing (Wisdom spellcasting ability). If the staff is lost or destroyed, the völva must craft another, which takes a year and a day. Only a völva can use the staff.

optionalfeature.name: Lore Keeper
entries: The völva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The völva has advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Shroud
entries: The vozhark is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.
optionalfeature.effect: The vozhark is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as all divination spells.

optionalfeature.name: Flaying Pseudopod
entries: The vozhark makes a pseudopod attack (no action required) against any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vozhark if the vozhark isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: The vozhark makes a pseudopod attack (no action required) against any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the vozhark if the vozhark isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Focused Animosity
entries: The wampus cat has advantage on melee attacks against any male she has seen employ divine magic or wield a holy symbol.
optionalfeature.effect: The wampus cat has advantage on melee attacks against any male she has seen employ divine magic or wield a holy symbol.

optionalfeature.name: Wand of Orcus
entries: The wand has 3 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 18. While holding it, the Aspect of Orcus can use an action to cast animate dead, blight, or speak with dead.
optionalfeature.effect: The wand has 3 charges, and any of its properties that require a saving throw have a save DC of 18. While holding it, the Aspect of Orcus can use an action to cast animate dead, blight, or speak with dead.

optionalfeature.name: Raven Queen's Servant
entries: The warlock has a familiar in the form of a raven. While the raven is perched on its shoulder, it cannot be targeted by attacks, spells, or other harmful effects, it can't take damage, and it is {@condition incapacitated} until the warlock releases it from its shoulder as a bonus action. The warlock can perceive through the raven's senses and the raven can use its action to teleport to a space within 5 feet of the warlock as long as they are on the same plane of existence. The raven doesn't sleep and can wake the warlock as a bonus action if it is within 100 feet of it. The raven vanishes if it or the warlock is killed.
optionalfeature.effect: The warlock has a familiar in the form of a raven. While the raven is perched on its shoulder, it cannot be targeted by attacks, spells, or other harmful effects, it can't take damage, and it is {@condition incapacitated} until the warlock releases it from its shoulder as a bonus action. The warlock can perceive through the raven's senses and the raven can use its action to teleport to a space within 5 feet of the warlock as long as they are on the same plane of existence. The raven doesn't sleep and can wake the warlock as a bonus action if it is within 100 feet of it. The raven vanishes if it or the warlock is killed.

optionalfeature.name: Warp Form
entries: The warp spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Whenever the spawn starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spawn is {@condition incapacitated} for one round as its thrashes between nightmarish forms.
optionalfeature.effect: The warp spawn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form. Whenever the spawn starts its turn with 50 hit points or fewer, roll a {@dice d6}. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spawn is {@condition incapacitated} for one round as its thrashes between nightmarish forms.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Weapons
entries: The warrior's weapon attacks are magical. When the warrior hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage (included in the attack).
optionalfeature.effect: The warrior's weapon attacks are magical. When the warrior hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} cold damage (included in the attack).

optionalfeature.name: Invisible in Water
entries: The water weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.
optionalfeature.effect: The water weird is {@condition invisible} while fully immersed in water.

optionalfeature.name: Marine Empathy
entries: The waverider can speak with and understand aquatic plants and animals.
optionalfeature.effect: The waverider can speak with and understand aquatic plants and animals.

optionalfeature.name: Pocket Jump
entries: The wealth mimic can teleport up to 15 feet as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: The wealth mimic can teleport up to 15 feet as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Beyond Sight
entries: The Wendigo is {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 25 feet away from it.
optionalfeature.effect: The Wendigo is {@condition invisible} to creatures more than 25 feet away from it.

optionalfeature.name: Pack leader
entries: The werewolf's allies have advantage on melee attack rolls against any hostile creature within 5 feet of the werewolf.
optionalfeature.effect: The werewolf's allies have advantage on melee attack rolls against any hostile creature within 5 feet of the werewolf.

optionalfeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The whaler can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The whaler also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The whaler can tell if an object or a creature it touches is magical, and if that magic originated from a fey creature. The whaler also has advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Disquieting Technology
entries: The whisperer is a highly advanced being that often carries pieces of powerful mi-go technology. Mi-go technology can be represented using the same rules as magic items, but the functions are very difficult to determine. The identify spell can't determine the function of a mi-go item, but an hour of study and a successful {@dc 19} Intelligence (Arcana) check can reveal its purpose and proper function. Typical items are wands of fireballs shaped like staves with peculiar triggers, eyes of the eagle shaped as a pair of cylinders, or a helm of telepathy in the form of a glowing metal disc adhered to the side of the creature's head.
optionalfeature.effect: The whisperer is a highly advanced being that often carries pieces of powerful mi-go technology. Mi-go technology can be represented using the same rules as magic items, but the functions are very difficult to determine. The identify spell can't determine the function of a mi-go item, but an hour of study and a successful {@dc 19} Intelligence (Arcana) check can reveal its purpose and proper function. Typical items are wands of fireballs shaped like staves with peculiar triggers, eyes of the eagle shaped as a pair of cylinders, or a helm of telepathy in the form of a glowing metal disc adhered to the side of the creature's head.

optionalfeature.name: Hatred for Spellcasters
entries: The white ape does one extra die of damage ({@dice 1d8} or {@dice 1d10}, respectively) per attack against an enemy it has seen cast a spell.
optionalfeature.effect: The white ape does one extra die of damage ({@dice 1d8} or {@dice 1d10}, respectively) per attack against an enemy it has seen cast a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Single-minded Purpose
entries: The wight has advantage on attack rolls against followers of the fiend it is tasked to destroy and those in its target's employ (whether or not they are aware of their employer), as well as the fiend itself.
optionalfeature.effect: The wight has advantage on attack rolls against followers of the fiend it is tasked to destroy and those in its target's employ (whether or not they are aware of their employer), as well as the fiend itself.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Hunter
entries: The wilden gains a +1 bonus on Wisdom (Perception) and Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
optionalfeature.effect: The wilden gains a +1 bonus on Wisdom (Perception) and Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Aspect of the Ancient
entries: The wilden gains advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.
optionalfeature.effect: The wilden gains advantage on Intelligence (Nature) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}.

optionalfeature.name: Strong Winds
entries: The wind's harp devil has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is an air elemental, wind demon, or similar creature of air, is within 20 feet of the target, and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: The wind's harp devil has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is an air elemental, wind demon, or similar creature of air, is within 20 feet of the target, and isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The witherling releases an unnatural shriek. Creatures within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
optionalfeature.effect: The witherling releases an unnatural shriek. Creatures within 30 feet that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

optionalfeature.name: Combat Caster
entries: The wizard has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell. While the wizard maintains concentration on a spell, it has a +3 bonus to AC and all saving throws.
optionalfeature.effect: The wizard has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on a spell. While the wizard maintains concentration on a spell, it has a +3 bonus to AC and all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Dwarven Resistance
entries: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.
optionalfeature.effect: The wolf reaver dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

optionalfeature.name: Fey Touched
entries: The woodwose has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the woodwose to sleep.
optionalfeature.effect: The woodwose has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the woodwose to sleep.

optionalfeature.name: Anathematic Secrecy
entries: The Worm that Walks can't be magically scryed upon. Any spell attempting to detect or scry on the Worm automatically fails.
optionalfeature.effect: The Worm that Walks can't be magically scryed upon. Any spell attempting to detect or scry on the Worm automatically fails.

optionalfeature.name: Forbiddance
entries: The wraith can't enter a residence if its owner has marked the main door with lamb's blood.
optionalfeature.effect: The wraith can't enter a residence if its owner has marked the main door with lamb's blood.

optionalfeature.name: Supernatural Plague
entries: The wraith contains all diseases that ever existed, aggravated by its nature. All are magical diseases and affect creatures immune to nonmagical disease. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic casted on a creature affected with a disease of the wraith can remove it only if the caster succeeds on a DC 15 ability check using its spellcasting ability.
optionalfeature.effect: The wraith contains all diseases that ever existed, aggravated by its nature. All are magical diseases and affect creatures immune to nonmagical disease. A lesser restoration spell or similar magic casted on a creature affected with a disease of the wraith can remove it only if the caster succeeds on a DC 15 ability check using its spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Etherealness
entries: The wraith enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa with a bonus action. The wraith is invisible while on the Border Ethereal and it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.
optionalfeature.effect: The wraith enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa with a bonus action. The wraith is invisible while on the Border Ethereal and it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

optionalfeature.name: Disguise
entries: The xenabsorber has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as the type of creature it is impersonating as long as it has at least 1 trait from that creature.
optionalfeature.effect: The xenabsorber has advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks to pass itself off as the type of creature it is impersonating as long as it has at least 1 trait from that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.
optionalfeature.effect: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Anger
entries: The xvart has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. Its melee attacks deal an additional +2 damage (already included in its attacks).
optionalfeature.effect: The xvart has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}. Its melee attacks deal an additional +2 damage (already included in its attacks).

optionalfeature.name: Muscular Arm
entries: The yagnoloth can wield a two-handed weapon in its left hand without needing to use two hands or use a one-handed Huge weapon in his left hand without suffering disadvantage to attack rolls for using an oversized weapon.
optionalfeature.effect: The yagnoloth can wield a two-handed weapon in its left hand without needing to use two hands or use a one-handed Huge weapon in his left hand without suffering disadvantage to attack rolls for using an oversized weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Undersized Arm
entries: The yagnoloth's right arm is underdeveloped for its size. Attacks made with that arm are treated as having Strength 16 and the yagnoloth wields weapons in that arm, as though it were Medium sized.
optionalfeature.effect: The yagnoloth's right arm is underdeveloped for its size. Attacks made with that arm are treated as having Strength 16 and the yagnoloth wields weapons in that arm, as though it were Medium sized.

optionalfeature.name: Resilient Soul
entries: The yakirian has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or confused, as well as against any effect that causes corruption or madness.
optionalfeature.effect: The yakirian has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or confused, as well as against any effect that causes corruption or madness.

optionalfeature.name: Peaceful Creature
entries: The ychen bannog abhors combat and flees from it if possible. If unable to flee, the ychen bannog can attack a foe or obstacle to clear a path to safety. As an action, a driver or handler mounted on the ychen bannog or adjacent to it can make a {@dc 16} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. On a success, the ychen bannog moves and attacks as directed by the driver. On a failure, the beast flees. The driver or handler must have proficiency in Animal Handling to attempt this check.
optionalfeature.effect: The ychen bannog abhors combat and flees from it if possible. If unable to flee, the ychen bannog can attack a foe or obstacle to clear a path to safety. As an action, a driver or handler mounted on the ychen bannog or adjacent to it can make a {@dc 16} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. On a success, the ychen bannog moves and attacks as directed by the driver. On a failure, the beast flees. The driver or handler must have proficiency in Animal Handling to attempt this check.

optionalfeature.name: Ever-Sharp Horns
entries: The ychen bannog deals triple damage dice when it scores a critical hit with a gore attack.
optionalfeature.effect: The ychen bannog deals triple damage dice when it scores a critical hit with a gore attack.

optionalfeature.name: Expand (2/Day)
entries: The zamtrios can use a bonus action to greatly expand its belly for 1 minute. This increases its size to Gargantuan and gains resistance to bludgeoning damage. This action also remove Ice Armor if it is active. As a bonus action, the zamtrios can end this effect and revert back to its original size.
optionalfeature.effect: The zamtrios can use a bonus action to greatly expand its belly for 1 minute. This increases its size to Gargantuan and gains resistance to bludgeoning damage. This action also remove Ice Armor if it is active. As a bonus action, the zamtrios can end this effect and revert back to its original size.

optionalfeature.name: Endless Breath
entries: The zaratan breathes air, but it can hold its breath for years.
optionalfeature.effect: The zaratan breathes air, but it can hold its breath for years.

optionalfeature.name: Fortified Shell
entries: The zaratan ignores any attack against its shell that doesn't do 30 points of damage or more. Attacking the zaratan's head or flippers bypasses this trait.
optionalfeature.effect: The zaratan ignores any attack against its shell that doesn't do 30 points of damage or more. Attacking the zaratan's head or flippers bypasses this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Fire And Light
entries: The zoryas' weapon attacks are magical. When the zoryas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} radiant or fire damage (included in the attack). The zoryas chooses whether its attack does radiant or fire damage before making the attack roll.
optionalfeature.effect: The zoryas' weapon attacks are magical. When the zoryas hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d8} radiant or fire damage (included in the attack). The zoryas chooses whether its attack does radiant or fire damage before making the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Teleport (1/Day)
entries: The zovvut magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
optionalfeature.effect: The zovvut magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

optionalfeature.name: Perishable
entries: These oozes don't fare well in sunlight and don't easily endure the rigors of travel. The creature dies if it is directly exposed to sunlight for more than 1 minute. Each day it is more than 1 mile from its "birth" place, the ooze must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or die.
optionalfeature.effect: These oozes don't fare well in sunlight and don't easily endure the rigors of travel. The creature dies if it is directly exposed to sunlight for more than 1 minute. Each day it is more than 1 mile from its "birth" place, the ooze must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or die.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Tears
entries: Thick tears of dark sap stream continuously down the treant's face and trunk. These tears are highly acidic—anyone who attacks the treant from a range of 5 feet or less must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage from splashed tears. This acidic matter continues doing 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage at the start of each of the creature's turns until it or an adjacent ally uses an action to wipe off the tears or three rounds elapse.
optionalfeature.effect: Thick tears of dark sap stream continuously down the treant's face and trunk. These tears are highly acidic—anyone who attacks the treant from a range of 5 feet or less must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage from splashed tears. This acidic matter continues doing 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage at the start of each of the creature's turns until it or an adjacent ally uses an action to wipe off the tears or three rounds elapse.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Emotions
entries: This ability functions like blindsight, but the serpentir can't sense constructs and undead with this ability. Two-Headed. The serpentir has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
optionalfeature.effect: This ability functions like blindsight, but the serpentir can't sense constructs and undead with this ability. Two-Headed. The serpentir has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: This disease affects the nervous systems of many creatures, altering their behavior over time to become more aggressive and unpredictable. Rock gnolls carry a particularly virulent strain. Infected creatures begin showing symptoms after {@dice 1d4} days, including headaches and increased thirst. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, and requires twice the usual amount of water each day. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one and the disease intensifies. After one failed save, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw whenever it is placed in a stressful situation or spend its turn making a melee attack against the nearest creature, moving up to its speed if necessary. The DC for this saving throw increases by 2 for each level of {@condition exhaustion} above 1. If the infected creature has 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion} (hit points halved), its mind is consumed by the disease and it reverts to an animalistic and wild state, attacking any who come near it. Until the disease can be cured, the creature's Intelligence is reduced by 10 (minimum 3).
optionalfeature.effect: This disease affects the nervous systems of many creatures, altering their behavior over time to become more aggressive and unpredictable. Rock gnolls carry a particularly virulent strain. Infected creatures begin showing symptoms after {@dice 1d4} days, including headaches and increased thirst. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks, and requires twice the usual amount of water each day. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one and the disease intensifies. After one failed save, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw whenever it is placed in a stressful situation or spend its turn making a melee attack against the nearest creature, moving up to its speed if necessary. The DC for this saving throw increases by 2 for each level of {@condition exhaustion} above 1. If the infected creature has 4 levels of {@condition exhaustion} (hit points halved), its mind is consumed by the disease and it reverts to an animalistic and wild state, attacking any who come near it. Until the disease can be cured, the creature's Intelligence is reduced by 10 (minimum 3).

optionalfeature.name: Gnoll's Kiss
entries: This disease may have originated as an okiti weapon, but has since grown and mutated in the gutter gnolls' filthy habitat into a particularly nasty affliction. Tales of ghouls in the sewers often spring up around the horribly scarred, or even entirely skinless, corpses it leaves behind. Infected creatures begin showing symptoms after {@dice 1d4} days, including itchiness and sores. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and becomes vulnerable to poison and acid damage while infected. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one as its sores begin to worsen and weep, dealing {@dice 1d10} poison damage for each level of {@condition exhaustion}. If this damage reduces the creature's hit points to 0, its skin is entirely covered in open wounds and large areas begin to slough off, killing it through a combination of shock and dehydration.
optionalfeature.effect: This disease may have originated as an okiti weapon, but has since grown and mutated in the gutter gnolls' filthy habitat into a particularly nasty affliction. Tales of ghouls in the sewers often spring up around the horribly scarred, or even entirely skinless, corpses it leaves behind. Infected creatures begin showing symptoms after {@dice 1d4} days, including itchiness and sores. The infected creature suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and becomes vulnerable to poison and acid damage while infected. At the end of each long rest, the infected creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against the disease. A successful save decreases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one. If this reduces the level of {@condition exhaustion} to zero, the creature is cured. A failed save increases its level of {@condition exhaustion} by one as its sores begin to worsen and weep, dealing {@dice 1d10} poison damage for each level of {@condition exhaustion}. If this damage reduces the creature's hit points to 0, its skin is entirely covered in open wounds and large areas begin to slough off, killing it through a combination of shock and dehydration.

optionalfeature.name: Corpse Cough
entries: Those who fail a saving throw against the horned serpent's Gem Gaze or bite attack become infected with the corpse cough disease. The infected creature can't benefit from short or long rests due to a constant, wet cough. The infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw each day or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until the target is cured of the disease with a greater restoration spell or similar magic. If the infected creature comes into physical contact with a blood relative before the disease is cured, the relative must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or also become infected with the disease. The blood relative is afflicted with a constant, wet cough within hours of infection, but the disease's full effects don't manifest until {@dice 1d4} days later. Corpse cough is so named due to the smell of the cough as the infected creature's lungs become necrotic.
optionalfeature.effect: Those who fail a saving throw against the horned serpent's Gem Gaze or bite attack become infected with the corpse cough disease. The infected creature can't benefit from short or long rests due to a constant, wet cough. The infected creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw each day or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. The target's hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until the target is cured of the disease with a greater restoration spell or similar magic. If the infected creature comes into physical contact with a blood relative before the disease is cured, the relative must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or also become infected with the disease. The blood relative is afflicted with a constant, wet cough within hours of infection, but the disease's full effects don't manifest until {@dice 1d4} days later. Corpse cough is so named due to the smell of the cough as the infected creature's lungs become necrotic.

optionalfeature.name: Distortion Gaze
entries: Those who meet the gaze of the fear smith experience the world seeming to twist at unnatural angles beneath their feet. When a creature that can see the fear smith's eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the fear smith, the creature must make a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become disoriented. While disoriented, the creature falls {@condition prone} each time it tries to move or take the Dash or Disengage action. To recover from disorientation, a creature must start its turn outside the fear smith's gaze and make a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: Those who meet the gaze of the fear smith experience the world seeming to twist at unnatural angles beneath their feet. When a creature that can see the fear smith's eye starts its turn within 30 feet of the fear smith, the creature must make a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become disoriented. While disoriented, the creature falls {@condition prone} each time it tries to move or take the Dash or Disengage action. To recover from disorientation, a creature must start its turn outside the fear smith's gaze and make a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cooperation
entries: Three formian workers working together for a round without moving, can repair an object as if casting mending. Eight workers working together for a round without moving, can heal a creature's wounds as if casting cure wounds at 4th level. Eight or more workers working together can carry a formian queen without being slowed.
optionalfeature.effect: Three formian workers working together for a round without moving, can repair an object as if casting mending. Eight workers working together for a round without moving, can heal a creature's wounds as if casting cure wounds at 4th level. Eight or more workers working together can carry a formian queen without being slowed.

optionalfeature.name: Ancestral Spirits
entries: Three ghostly spirits haunt the giant. The spirits are incorporeal, remain within 10 feet of the giant at all times, and can't take actions. Each uses the giant's AC and saving throws, has 15 hp and can only be harmed by radiant damage. If an ancestral spirit is reduced to 0 hp, it disappears temporarily. Reduce the giant's AC by 1 and remove one trait granted by the spirits for each spirit that is driven off. Ancestral spirits can't be turned.
optionalfeature.effect: Three ghostly spirits haunt the giant. The spirits are incorporeal, remain within 10 feet of the giant at all times, and can't take actions. Each uses the giant's AC and saving throws, has 15 hp and can only be harmed by radiant damage. If an ancestral spirit is reduced to 0 hp, it disappears temporarily. Reduce the giant's AC by 1 and remove one trait granted by the spirits for each spirit that is driven off. Ancestral spirits can't be turned.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Form (3/Day)
entries: Three times per day, a burning dervish can use its action to change its form to that of a column of fire. In this form it can attack with its fists. The transformation lasts indefinitely; changing back requires another action.
optionalfeature.effect: Three times per day, a burning dervish can use its action to change its form to that of a column of fire. In this form it can attack with its fists. The transformation lasts indefinitely; changing back requires another action.

optionalfeature.name: Thunder Bolt
entries: Thunder Bolt. If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the arcane ballista's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: Thunder Bolt. If the target is a creature, it takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the start of the arcane ballista's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Choose one of the Following
entries: To get across the flavour of a hunter of big game, you can give scouts one of the following abilities:
optionalfeature.effect: To get across the flavour of a hunter of big game, you can give scouts one of the following abilities:

optionalfeature.name: Meld with Text
entries: Totivillus can enter any book, scroll, or other written material and remain hidden there as long as he wishes. If the text is damaged or destroyed, he is ejected from it without suffering damage.
optionalfeature.effect: Totivillus can enter any book, scroll, or other written material and remain hidden there as long as he wishes. If the text is damaged or destroyed, he is ejected from it without suffering damage.

optionalfeature.name: Trust Aura
entries: Totivillus projects a 25-foot-radius trust aura. As long as Totivillus is talking, creatures in that area find his utterances so fascinating and compelling that they must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of their turns; if the saving throw fails, they can't attack Totivillus directly until the start of their next turn. This effect ends immediately and can't be renewed for 1 minute if Totivillus attacks physically. Devils are not immune to this aura.
optionalfeature.effect: Totivillus projects a 25-foot-radius trust aura. As long as Totivillus is talking, creatures in that area find his utterances so fascinating and compelling that they must make a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of their turns; if the saving throw fails, they can't attack Totivillus directly until the start of their next turn. This effect ends immediately and can't be renewed for 1 minute if Totivillus attacks physically. Devils are not immune to this aura.

optionalfeature.name: Dead Still
entries: Treat a putrid haunt as {@condition invisible} while it's buried in swamp muck.
optionalfeature.effect: Treat a putrid haunt as {@condition invisible} while it's buried in swamp muck.

optionalfeature.name: Adrenal Surge (2/Day)
entries: Twice per day as a bonus action, an encephalon gorger can accelerate itself so that it gains speed 60 ft. and AC 15, it gets tactical advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can take one additional action on its turns. This effect lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds.
optionalfeature.effect: Twice per day as a bonus action, an encephalon gorger can accelerate itself so that it gains speed 60 ft. and AC 15, it gets tactical advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can take one additional action on its turns. This effect lasts {@dice 1d4} rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Last Laugh
entries: Unless it is destroyed in a manner amusing to the god of death that created it, the grim jester is brought back after {@dice 1d20} days in a place of the god's choosing.
optionalfeature.effect: Unless it is destroyed in a manner amusing to the god of death that created it, the grim jester is brought back after {@dice 1d20} days in a place of the god's choosing.

optionalfeature.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.
optionalfeature.effect: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

optionalfeature.name: Marshal Allies
entries: Unless the hobgoblin is {@condition incapacitated}, it and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.
