optionalfeature.effect: Unless the hobgoblin is {@condition incapacitated}, it and creatures of its choice within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden In The Wind (Whirlwind Form Only)
entries: Until it attacks or uses Whirling Leaves, the wind weasel is indistinguishable from a natural dust devil unless a creature succeeds on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check.
optionalfeature.effect: Until it attacks or uses Whirling Leaves, the wind weasel is indistinguishable from a natural dust devil unless a creature succeeds on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check.

optionalfeature.name: War Yip (1/Day)
entries: Until the end of the kobold's next turn, each creature of the kobold's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Yip deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll. The kobold can then make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: Until the end of the kobold's next turn, each creature of the kobold's choice that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by War Yip deals an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll. The kobold can then make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Crowding
entries: Up to five tunnel prawns can occupy a single 5-foot-square space.
optionalfeature.effect: Up to five tunnel prawns can occupy a single 5-foot-square space.

optionalfeature.name: Crowd
entries: Up to three boneneedles can occupy the same 5-foot space.
optionalfeature.effect: Up to three boneneedles can occupy the same 5-foot space.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Aegis
entries: Up to three friendly creatures of the sorcerer's choice within 30 feet of it also benefit from the sorcerer's resistances to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
optionalfeature.effect: Up to three friendly creatures of the sorcerer's choice within 30 feet of it also benefit from the sorcerer's resistances to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Temporal Anomaly
entries: Up to three times in its life, the dragon can travel to any point in time, taking with it a number of willing creatures equal to its Charisma modifier.
optionalfeature.effect: Up to three times in its life, the dragon can travel to any point in time, taking with it a number of willing creatures equal to its Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Skittering
entries: Up to two tosculi can share the same space at one time. The tosculi has advantage on attack rolls while sharing its space with another tosculi that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: Up to two tosculi can share the same space at one time. The tosculi has advantage on attack rolls while sharing its space with another tosculi that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Born of the Void
entries: Upon its death, the Aurochon's form seeks to return to its cosmic home. The Aurochon's corpse crystallizes and breaks apart into shards of dark ice which quickly melt away.
optionalfeature.effect: Upon its death, the Aurochon's form seeks to return to its cosmic home. The Aurochon's corpse crystallizes and breaks apart into shards of dark ice which quickly melt away.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Surge
entries: Using a bonus action, the lodestone marauder can use the magnetic field surrounding it to repulse or attract metallic objects. Any creature within 30 feet of the lodestone Marauder, wielding weapons or shields or wearing armor made substantially of metal must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop any metallic weapons and, if they are wearing metallic armor, be knocked {@condition prone}. Unattended metallic objects and {@condition prone} creatures are then moved in a straight line directly toward or away from the lodestone marauder, depending on whether it chose to repulse or attract them. If the marauder chose to repulse, creatures and objects come to a stop 30 feet away from the marauder. If the marauder chose to attract creatures and objects are pulled onto the marauder's back where they stick magnetically. A creature pulled onto a lodestone marauder's back is {@condition restrained} and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature may use its action to pull itself, another creature or an object free of the lodestone marauders back by making a successful {@dc 15} Strength check. Andy objects and creatures are automatically released the next time the marauder uses its ability to repulse.
optionalfeature.effect: Using a bonus action, the lodestone marauder can use the magnetic field surrounding it to repulse or attract metallic objects. Any creature within 30 feet of the lodestone Marauder, wielding weapons or shields or wearing armor made substantially of metal must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop any metallic weapons and, if they are wearing metallic armor, be knocked {@condition prone}. Unattended metallic objects and {@condition prone} creatures are then moved in a straight line directly toward or away from the lodestone marauder, depending on whether it chose to repulse or attract them. If the marauder chose to repulse, creatures and objects come to a stop 30 feet away from the marauder. If the marauder chose to attract creatures and objects are pulled onto the marauder's back where they stick magnetically. A creature pulled onto a lodestone marauder's back is {@condition restrained} and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. A creature may use its action to pull itself, another creature or an object free of the lodestone marauders back by making a successful {@dc 15} Strength check. Andy objects and creatures are automatically released the next time the marauder uses its ability to repulse.

optionalfeature.name: Temporal Fugue
entries: Using a bonus action, the phane can remove a single spell, condition or other effect affecting it.
optionalfeature.effect: Using a bonus action, the phane can remove a single spell, condition or other effect affecting it.

optionalfeature.name: Corpse Infestation
entries: Using all of its movement and its action, the swarm can infest a Medium fresh, preserved, or mummified humanoid corpse in its space, becoming a swarm husk with twice as many current hit points as the swarm's current hit point total.
optionalfeature.effect: Using all of its movement and its action, the swarm can infest a Medium fresh, preserved, or mummified humanoid corpse in its space, becoming a swarm husk with twice as many current hit points as the swarm's current hit point total.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile Shield
entries: Using an action, the walking wall can hunker down, presenting only a solid wall of stone to opponents. While in this state, the walking wall has an AC of 23 and Medium or smaller allies within 5 feet of it can use it as cover, gaining total cover from creatures on the opposite side if they do not make an attack against a target on the other side, or three-quarters cover, if they do.
optionalfeature.effect: Using an action, the walking wall can hunker down, presenting only a solid wall of stone to opponents. While in this state, the walking wall has an AC of 23 and Medium or smaller allies within 5 feet of it can use it as cover, gaining total cover from creatures on the opposite side if they do not make an attack against a target on the other side, or three-quarters cover, if they do.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Tongues
entries: Valkyries become fluent in any language they hear spoken for at least 1 minute, and they retain this knowledge forever.
optionalfeature.effect: Valkyries become fluent in any language they hear spoken for at least 1 minute, and they retain this knowledge forever.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of the Luckless (1/Day)
entries: Vila who dance for one hour create a fairy ring of small gray mushrooms. The ring lasts seven days and has a 50-foot diameter per dancing vila. Non-vila who fall asleep (including magical sleep) inside the ring have disadvantage on skill checks for 24 hours from the time they awaken.
optionalfeature.effect: Vila who dance for one hour create a fairy ring of small gray mushrooms. The ring lasts seven days and has a 50-foot diameter per dancing vila. Non-vila who fall asleep (including magical sleep) inside the ring have disadvantage on skill checks for 24 hours from the time they awaken.

optionalfeature.name: Void Dweller
entries: Void dragons dwell in the empty expanse between the stars, and do not require air, food, drink, or sleep. When flying between stars the void dragon magically glides on solar winds, making the immense journey through the void in an impossibly short time.
optionalfeature.effect: Void dragons dwell in the empty expanse between the stars, and do not require air, food, drink, or sleep. When flying between stars the void dragon magically glides on solar winds, making the immense journey through the void in an impossibly short time.

optionalfeature.name: Huntmaster's Mark
entries: Weapon attacks made by the huntmaster's allies against a creature affected by the huntmaster's hunter's mark spell benefit from the spell's additional damage as if the allies had cast the spell. This ability does not stack with the extra damage from hunter's mark spells cast by other creatures.
optionalfeature.effect: Weapon attacks made by the huntmaster's allies against a creature affected by the huntmaster's hunter's mark spell benefit from the spell's additional damage as if the allies had cast the spell. This ability does not stack with the extra damage from hunter's mark spells cast by other creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Casting
entries: When a battle mage casts a spell that causes damage or that forces a creature to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to automatically succeed on the required saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: When a battle mage casts a spell that causes damage or that forces a creature to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to automatically succeed on the required saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Disgorgement
entries: When a blood pudding starts its turn infused in a host creature (see Infusion), it uses its action to force out the creatures blood and bodily fluids through the creatures eyes, ears, nose, mouth, open wounds, and pores. The host creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the creature dies, the blood pudding stays put, feeding on the corpse from the inside. When sated, the pudding oozes out; to onlookers, it appears as if the slain creature is bleeding profusely.
optionalfeature.effect: When a blood pudding starts its turn infused in a host creature (see Infusion), it uses its action to force out the creatures blood and bodily fluids through the creatures eyes, ears, nose, mouth, open wounds, and pores. The host creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the creature dies, the blood pudding stays put, feeding on the corpse from the inside. When sated, the pudding oozes out; to onlookers, it appears as if the slain creature is bleeding profusely.

optionalfeature.name: Viselike Jaws
entries: When a cave eel withdraws back into its burrow with a {@condition grappled} character in its jaws, that character's body effectively becomes a shield protecting the eel, giving it total cover inside its burrow (it has only three-quarters cover against the character it grapples). While the eel has a character {@condition grappled} this way, it doesn't need to extend from its burrow to attack the {@condition grappled} character, who it bites automatically.
optionalfeature.effect: When a cave eel withdraws back into its burrow with a {@condition grappled} character in its jaws, that character's body effectively becomes a shield protecting the eel, giving it total cover inside its burrow (it has only three-quarters cover against the character it grapples). While the eel has a character {@condition grappled} this way, it doesn't need to extend from its burrow to attack the {@condition grappled} character, who it bites automatically.

optionalfeature.name: Temporal Body
entries: When a chronalmental is subjected to a slow spell, haste spell, or similar effect, it automatically succeeds on the saving throw and regains 13 ({@dice 3d8}) hit points.
optionalfeature.effect: When a chronalmental is subjected to a slow spell, haste spell, or similar effect, it automatically succeeds on the saving throw and regains 13 ({@dice 3d8}) hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Priestly Purr
entries: When a cleric or paladin who worships Bastet spends an hour preparing spells while a Bastet temple cat is within 5 feet, that spellcaster can choose two 1st-level spells and one 2nd-level spell that they are able to cast and imbue them into the temple cat. The temple cat can cast these spells 1/day each without a verbal component. These spells are cast as if they were included in the temple cat's Innate Spellcasting trait.
optionalfeature.effect: When a cleric or paladin who worships Bastet spends an hour preparing spells while a Bastet temple cat is within 5 feet, that spellcaster can choose two 1st-level spells and one 2nd-level spell that they are able to cast and imbue them into the temple cat. The temple cat can cast these spells 1/day each without a verbal component. These spells are cast as if they were included in the temple cat's Innate Spellcasting trait.

optionalfeature.name: Infernal Power Source
entries: When a clockwork abomination falls to 0 hp, its infernal battery explodes. Creatures within 10 feet of the clockwork abomination take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: When a clockwork abomination falls to 0 hp, its infernal battery explodes. Creatures within 10 feet of the clockwork abomination take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Create Gallows Tree Zombie
entries: When a creature dies within 15 feet of a gallows tree, the tree uses a sharpened tendril to slice open the creature's abdomen, spilling the corpse's innards on the ground. The organs and fluids are absorbed by the tree's roots. Corpses of a size other than Medium or Large are simply left to rot. Medium or Large corpses are filled with a greenish pollen from one of the tree's branches. The abdominal wound heals in {@dice 1d4} days, and the slain creature then rises as a gallows tree zombie connected by a tether-vine to the gallows tree that created it. Gallows tree zombies possess none of their former abilities.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature dies within 15 feet of a gallows tree, the tree uses a sharpened tendril to slice open the creature's abdomen, spilling the corpse's innards on the ground. The organs and fluids are absorbed by the tree's roots. Corpses of a size other than Medium or Large are simply left to rot. Medium or Large corpses are filled with a greenish pollen from one of the tree's branches. The abdominal wound heals in {@dice 1d4} days, and the slain creature then rises as a gallows tree zombie connected by a tether-vine to the gallows tree that created it. Gallows tree zombies possess none of their former abilities.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Conduit
entries: When a creature dies within 30 feet of the ghost boar, its spirit can possess the boar, incapacitating the boar for up to 1 minute. During this time, the spirit is affected by the speak with dead spell, speaking through the ghost boar's mouth.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature dies within 30 feet of the ghost boar, its spirit can possess the boar, incapacitating the boar for up to 1 minute. During this time, the spirit is affected by the speak with dead spell, speaking through the ghost boar's mouth.

optionalfeature.name: Forgetful Spellcasting
entries: When a creature fails an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a spell cast by an alehouse drake, the creature immediately forgets the source of the spellcasting.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature fails an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw against a spell cast by an alehouse drake, the creature immediately forgets the source of the spellcasting.

optionalfeature.name: Hang
entries: When a creature fails the saving throw from a constriction attack, the hangman tree hoists it off the ground by the vine around the target's neck. The creature is still {@condition grappled}, and it runs out of breath and begins suffocating.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature fails the saving throw from a constriction attack, the hangman tree hoists it off the ground by the vine around the target's neck. The creature is still {@condition grappled}, and it runs out of breath and begins suffocating.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: When a creature has 3 Frenzy Charges, they must makes a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the target is afflicted with the {@disease Frenzy Virus} until dispelled by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. On a success, the frenzy charges reset to 0.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature has 3 Frenzy Charges, they must makes a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the target is afflicted with the {@disease Frenzy Virus} until dispelled by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. On a success, the frenzy charges reset to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Frenzy
entries: When a creature has 3 Frenzy Charges, they must makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the target is afflicted with the {@disease Frenzy Virus} until dispelled by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. On a success, the frenzy charges reset to 0.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature has 3 Frenzy Charges, they must makes a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw. On a fail, the target is afflicted with the {@disease Frenzy Virus} until dispelled by a {@spell Greater Restoration} spell. On a success, the frenzy charges reset to 0.

optionalfeature.name: Viscid Shell
entries: When a creature hits the bearmit crab with a slashing or piercing melee weapon, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, or its weapon becomes stuck to the bearmit crab's shell. While the weapon is stuck, it can't be used. A creature can pull the weapon free by taking an action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check and succeeding.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature hits the bearmit crab with a slashing or piercing melee weapon, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, or its weapon becomes stuck to the bearmit crab's shell. While the weapon is stuck, it can't be used. A creature can pull the weapon free by taking an action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check and succeeding.

optionalfeature.name: Open Wound
entries: When a creature is hit by the seregios attacks, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an open wound. Each time the seregios hits the wounded target with an attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature is hit by the seregios attacks, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to an open wound. Each time the seregios hits the wounded target with an attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Silk
entries: When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against the ahtal-ka's webbing and misses, the weapon becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 19} Strength check to pull free.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature makes a melee weapon attack against the ahtal-ka's webbing and misses, the weapon becomes stuck to it, requiring an action and a successful {@dc 19} Strength check to pull free.

optionalfeature.name: Drain Warmth
entries: When a creature of the elemental's choice starts its turn within 60 feet of the elemental, the elemental can force the creature to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the elemental isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage for 1 minute, until it has immunity to cold damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elemental's Drain Warmth for the next 24 hours. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature of the elemental's choice starts its turn within 60 feet of the elemental, the elemental can force the creature to make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw if the elemental isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature has vulnerability to cold damage for 1 minute, until it has immunity to cold damage. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the elemental's Drain Warmth for the next 24 hours. A lesser restoration spell ends this effect.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Insanity
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the allip and is able to hear the allip, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, unless the allip is {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the allip and is able to hear the allip, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, unless the allip is {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Confusing Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Agonizing Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the angatra's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the angatra, it must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw if the angatra isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed saving throw, the creature has its pain threshold lowered, so that it becomes vulnerable to all damage types until the end of its next turn. Unless it's surprised, a creature can avoid the saving throw by averting its eyes at the start of its turn. A creature that averts its eyes can't see the angatra for one full round, when it chooses anew whether to avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the angatra in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature that can see the angatra's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the angatra, it must make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw if the angatra isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the creature looks at the angatra in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

optionalfeature.name: Horrid Visage
entries: When a creature that can see the bargda starts its turn within 30 feet of the bargda, the bargda can force it to make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw if the bargda isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bargda until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bargda in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the bargda's Horrid Visage for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Death Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the bodak isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points, unless it is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failed save. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, it must immediately make the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the cockatrice's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the cockatrice, the cockatrice can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the cockatrice isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. The creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature that can see the cockatrice's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the cockatrice, the cockatrice can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the cockatrice isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. The creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Dissolving Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the drakon's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the drakon, the drakon can force it to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw if the drakon isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the acid damage it takes (which ends after a long rest), and it's {@condition paralyzed} until the start of its next turn. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it can't see the drakon until the start of its next turn, when it chooses again whether to avert its eyes. If the creature looks at the drakon before then, it must immediately make the saving throw.

If the creature looks at the drakon before then, it must immediately make the saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Baleful Glare
entries: When a creature that can see the eyes of the dullahan's severed head starts its turn within 30 feet of the dullahan, the dullahan can force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw if the dullahan isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way the creature must move away from the dullahan, and can only use its action to Dash. If the creature is affected by the dullahan's Deathly Doom trait, it is {@condition restrained} while {@condition frightened} instead.

optionalfeature.name: Shimmering Crest
entries: When a creature that can see the front of the sliver's head starts its turn within 15 feet of the sliver and in an area of bright light, the sliver can force it to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw if the sliver isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the *greater restoration* spell or other magic.

optionalfeature.name: Terrifying Appearance
entries: When a creature that can see the jiangshi starts its turn within 30 feet of the jiangshi, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, unless the jiangshi is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the jiangshi's Terrifying Appearance for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Hypnotic Plumage
entries: When a creature that can see the sunset raptor's tail starts its turn within 100 feet of the raptor, the raptor can force it to make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw if the raptor isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failure, a creature becomes {@condition charmed} until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Draining Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the zovvut's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the zovvut, the zovvut can force it to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw if the zovvut isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the zovvut regains hit points equal to half the damage taken.

optionalfeature.name: Curse Of Ill Fortune
entries: When a creature that the ningyo can see attacks the ningyo and misses, the attack is automatically redirected against another creature within 5 feet of the ningyo or the attacker. This attack uses the same attack roll.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature that the ningyo can see attacks the ningyo and misses, the attack is automatically redirected against another creature within 5 feet of the ningyo or the attacker. This attack uses the same attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Ruff Spikes
entries: When a creature tries to enter a space adjacent to a cave dragon, the dragon can use a reaction to prevent the move by flaring its many feelers and spikes. The creature cannot enter a space adjacent to the dragon unless it makes a successful {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage from the spikes and can keep moving, but only into spaces that aren't within 5 feet of the dragon.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature tries to enter a space adjacent to a cave dragon, the dragon can use a reaction to prevent the move by flaring its many feelers and spikes. The creature cannot enter a space adjacent to the dragon unless it makes a successful {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. If the saving throw fails, the creature takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage from the spikes and can keep moving, but only into spaces that aren't within 5 feet of the dragon.

optionalfeature.name: Extort
entries: When a creature with extort uses spells or spell like abilities all enemy creatures within 60ft must make a Charisma Save, failure means they take 2 nectrotic damage per spell slot being used. (If the creature is able to drain 10 hp per spell slot, that power is used to fuel the spell, and they retain some of their spell slot. ((example: a creature casts Magic Missile at the 3rd level, extorts 20hp - the spell only costs the creature a 1st level spell slot))

optionalfeature.name: None May Stop Death
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of a dark father regains hp through any means other than resting, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and have disadvantage on its next death saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: When a creature within 30 feet of a dark father regains hp through any means other than resting, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and have disadvantage on its next death saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Engulf
entries: When a crimson mist strikes a target with one of its tentacles, it can immediately make an engulf attack by entering the opponent's space. The engulfed creature can attempt a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw to evade the attack. Success indicates the character avoids the attack entirely by retreating or stepping aside as the crimson mist moves forward. Failure indicates the crimson mist's body encloses the target, trapping the target inside. An engulfed character is {@condition restrained}, takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) necrotic and psychic damage at the start of each of its turns, and immediately begins suffocating. An engulfed character can escape by winning a Dexterity contest against the crimson mist. A crimson mist can engulf only one Medium or smaller creature at a time, and doing so prevents it from attacking with one of its tentacles.

optionalfeature.name: Distress Spores
entries: When a deathcap myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it sense its pain.
optionalfeature.effect: When a deathcap myconid takes damage, all other myconids within 240 feet of it sense its pain.

optionalfeature.name: Impale
entries: When a fanged sea serpent delivers a critical hit, it drives its fangs completely through the creatures body or limbs. An impaled creature is {@condition grappled} and takes 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage at the start of each of the fanged sea serpents turns. It also takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage when it escapes from the grapple. A fanged sea serpent can have up to one Medium or two Small creatures impaled at one time.
optionalfeature.effect: When a fanged sea serpent delivers a critical hit, it drives its fangs completely through the creatures body or limbs. An impaled creature is {@condition grappled} and takes 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) piercing damage at the start of each of the fanged sea serpents turns. It also takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) piercing damage when it escapes from the grapple. A fanged sea serpent can have up to one Medium or two Small creatures impaled at one time.

optionalfeature.name: Smothering
entries: When a giant slug of P'nahk hits a creature with its crushing attack, it drops its body onto the creature, pinning it to the ground. Treat this as being {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}, but the creature must also make an immediate {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. A successful saving throw indicates the creature inhaled a lungful of air before being trapped; a failed saving throw indicates the air was forced from the creature's lungs and it is suffocating. A suffocating creature can act normally for a number of rounds equal to its Con modifier (minimum of 1 round). Once those rounds expire, the creature drops to 0 hit points at the start of its next turn and it must make death saving throws.

Once those rounds expire, the creature drops to 0 hit points at the start of its next turn and it must make death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive
entries: When a gorbel takes piercing or slashing damage, it must make a successful Constitution saving throw or it explodes. The DC for the saving throw equals 5 plus the damage taken from the attack. When it explodes, all creatures within 5 feet of it take 4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) force damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw. The gorbel dies instantly, of course.
optionalfeature.effect: When a gorbel takes piercing or slashing damage, it must make a successful Constitution saving throw or it explodes. optionalfeature.name: Melting Touch
entries: When a herald of blood scores a critical hit or starts its turn with a foe {@condition grappled}, it can dissolve one metal or wood item of its choosing in that foe's possession. A mundane item is destroyed automatically; a magical item survives if its owner makes a successful {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: When a herald of blood scores a critical hit or starts its turn with a foe {@condition grappled}, it can dissolve one metal or wood item of its choosing in that foe's possession. A mundane item is destroyed automatically; a magical item survives if its owner makes a successful {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Unleashed Emotion
entries: When a hulking whelp feels threatened—it's touched, intimidated, cornered, attacked, or even just if a stranger moves adjacent to the whelp—it immediately grows from size Small to Huge as a reaction. If the whelp was attacked, this reaction occurs after the attack is made but before damage is done. Nearby creatures and objects are pushed to the nearest available space and must make a successful {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. Weapons, armor, and other objects worn or carried by the hulking whelp grow (and shrink again) proportionally when it changes size. Overcome by raw emotion, it sets about destroying anything and everything it can see (which isn't much) and reach (which is quite a lot). The transformation lasts until the hulking whelp is unaware of any nearby creatures for 1 round, it drops to 0 hit points, it has 5 levels of {@condition exhaustion}, or it's affected by a calm emotions spell or comparable magic. The transformation isn't entirely uncontrollable; people or creatures the whelp knows and trusts can be near it without triggering the reaction. Under the wrong conditions, such as in a populated area, a hulking whelp's Unleashed Emotion can last for days.

optionalfeature.name: Calm State
entries: When a hulking whelp is calm and unafraid, it uses the following statistics instead of those listed above: Size Small; HP 9 ({@dice 6d6 - 12}); Speed 20 ft.; STR 8 (-1); CON 6 (-2); Languages Common, Sylvan

optionalfeature.name: Seductive Gaze
entries: When a humanoid that can see the serpentine lamia's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the serpentine lamia, the serpentine lamia can force it to make a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw if the serpentine lamia isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the creature fails, it is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute.

If the creature fails, it is {@condition charmed} for 1 minute.

entries: When a hundun's confusion spell affects a target, it can elect to use the following table rather than the standard one:

optionalfeature.name: Supernova
entries: When a living star dies, it erupts, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hp by this damage dies.
optionalfeature.effect: When a living star dies, it erupts, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hp by this damage dies.

optionalfeature.name: Constrict Face
entries: When a map mimic touches a Medium or smaller creature or vice versa, it adheres to the creature, enveloping the creature's face and covering its eyes and ears and airways (escape {@dc 13}). The target creature is immediately {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, and it begins suffocating at the beginning of the mimic's next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: When a map mimic touches a Medium or smaller creature or vice versa, it adheres to the creature, enveloping the creature's face and covering its eyes and ears and airways (escape {@dc 13}). The target creature is immediately {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, and it begins suffocating at the beginning of the mimic's next turn.

optionalfeature.name: War Magic (Honor Guard Only)
entries: When a member of the honor guard uses its action to cast a cantrip, it can also take a bonus action to make one weapon attack.
optionalfeature.effect: When a member of the honor guard uses its action to cast a cantrip, it can also take a bonus action to make one weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Deep
entries: When a mummy of the deep grapples a creature, it immediately uses a bonus action to press its mouth against the opponent's and spew sea water into the opponent's lungs. It then releases its grapple. The affected creature must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. An affected creature can act normally on a round when it makes a successful saving throw; if the saving throw fails, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. The effect ends when the affected creature makes a third successful save. It can also be ended by a spell or other magical effect that neutralizes a curse.
optionalfeature.effect: When a mummy of the deep grapples a creature, it immediately uses a bonus action to press its mouth against the opponent's and spew sea water into the opponent's lungs. It then releases its grapple. The affected creature must make a successful {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. The effect ends when the affected creature makes a third successful save. It can also be ended by a spell or other magical effect that neutralizes a curse.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Absorption
entries: When a mustard jelly is targeted by a magic missile spell or when it would take lightning damage, it takes no damage but instead gains temporary hit points equal to the damage the attack should have caused.
optionalfeature.effect: When a mustard jelly is targeted by a magic missile spell or when it would take lightning damage, it takes no damage but instead gains temporary hit points equal to the damage the attack should have caused.

optionalfeature.name: Ride Host
entries: When a necrotic tick's living host has lost three-quarters of its maximum hp from Blood Drain, the tick's toxins fill the host with an unnatural desire to approach other living beings.
optionalfeature.effect: When a necrotic tick's living host has lost three-quarters of its maximum hp from Blood Drain, the tick's toxins fill the host with an unnatural desire to approach other living beings.

optionalfeature.name: Rage
entries: When a ryven is reduced to 12 or fewer hit points in combat, it flies into a berserk rage lasting ten rounds (one minute). While berserk, the ryven has tactical advantage on bite attacks, it uses both its bite and claw attacks, all of its attacks do 2 extra points of damage, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It drops whatever it held in its hands and fights solely with tooth and claw. Ryven shamans are immune to rage.
optionalfeature.effect: When a ryven is reduced to 12 or fewer hit points in combat, it flies into a berserk rage lasting ten rounds (one minute). While berserk, the ryven has tactical advantage on bite attacks, it uses both its bite and claw attacks, all of its attacks do 2 extra points of damage, and it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. It drops whatever it held in its hands and fights solely with tooth and claw. Ryven shamans are immune to rage.

optionalfeature.name: Mighty Swing
entries: When a savager attacks without moving during its turn, it makes its claw attack with advantage.
optionalfeature.effect: When a savager attacks without moving during its turn, it makes its claw attack with advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Curse of the Sea
entries: When a sorcerer targets a creature with a spell that deals cold damage, deals lightning damage, or forces the target to move, the target suffers additional effects on a hit or a failed save, as listed below.
optionalfeature.effect: When a sorcerer targets a creature with a spell that deals cold damage, deals lightning damage, or forces the target to move, the target suffers additional effects on a hit or a failed save, as listed below.

optionalfeature.name: Caster Link
entries: When a soul eater is summoned, it creates a mental link between itself and its conjurer. If the soul eater's assigned target (see Find Target ability, below) dies before the soul eater can drain the target's soul, or if the soul eater is defeated by its target (but not slain), it returns to its conjurer at full speed and attacks. While the soul eater and the conjurer share the same plane, it can use its Find Target ability to locate its conjurer.

If the soul eater's assigned target (see Find Target ability, below) dies before the soul eater can drain the target's soul, or if the soul eater is defeated by its target (but not slain), it returns to its conjurer at full speed and attacks. While the soul eater and the conjurer share the same plane, it can use its Find Target ability to locate its conjurer.

optionalfeature.name: Find Target
entries: When a soul eater's conjurer orders it to find a creature, it can do so unerringly, despite the distance or intervening obstacles, provided the target is on the same plane of existence. The conjurer must have seen the desired target and must speak the target's name.
optionalfeature.effect: When a soul eater's conjurer orders it to find a creature, it can do so unerringly, despite the distance or intervening obstacles, provided the target is on the same plane of existence. The conjurer must have seen the desired target and must speak the target's name.

optionalfeature.name: Shocking Riposte
entries: When a spider of Leng casts shield, it can also make a shocking grasp attack for 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage against one enemy within 5 feet as part of the same reaction.
optionalfeature.effect: When a spider of Leng casts shield, it can also make a shocking grasp attack for 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage against one enemy within 5 feet as part of the same reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Sensitive Ears
entries: When a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of the beotodus while it is underground or partially submerged, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the beotodus must immediately use its reaction to move toward the surface and fully emerged if it has the movement speed to do so. The beotodus automatically fails this saving throw if a sonic bomb is used within range of it.
optionalfeature.effect: When a thunder spell is used within 60 feet of the beotodus while it is underground or partially submerged, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the beotodus must immediately use its reaction to move toward the surface and fully emerged if it has the movement speed to do so. The beotodus automatically fails this saving throw if a sonic bomb is used within range of it.

optionalfeature.name: Bottled Rejuvenation
entries: When activated, the creature launches from its bottle, landing within 20 feet of the bottle. It starts as Tiny, and at the start of each of its turns, it increases in size by one step to a maximum of Large.
optionalfeature.effect: When activated, the creature launches from its bottle, landing within 20 feet of the bottle. It starts as Tiny, and at the start of each of its turns, it increases in size by one step to a maximum of Large.

optionalfeature.name: Ravenous Presence
entries: When an allied troll within 30 feet of this troll hits a creature with a bite attack, it is a critical hit, provided that this troll isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
optionalfeature.effect: When an allied troll within 30 feet of this troll hits a creature with a bite attack, it is a critical hit, provided that this troll isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Discharge
entries: When an arcanaphage dies, it explodes in a surge of partially-digested magical energy. Each creature within 5 feet per Feed score must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage per Feed score on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For 1 minute afterward, the affected area is awash with volatile magic. A creature that starts its turn in the affected area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When an arcanaphage dies, it explodes in a surge of partially-digested magical energy. Each creature within 5 feet per Feed score must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage per Feed score on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For 1 minute afterward, the affected area is awash with volatile magic. A creature that starts its turn in the affected area takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Damping
entries: When an arcane spellcaster tries to cast an arcane spell within 20 feet of a patch of witch grass, the caster must make an Int or Cha saving throw; use the ability most appropriate to the spellcasters class. The DC equals 10 + the size of the patch in 10 ft. squares (see Organization, above). For example, if a wizard tries to cast a spell near a 30-square-foot patch of witch grass, she must make a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. If the save succeeds, the spell is cast normally. If the saving throw fails, the spell is not cast but the spell slot is not expended. Only arcane magic is affected.
optionalfeature.effect: When an arcane spellcaster tries to cast an arcane spell within 20 feet of a patch of witch grass, the caster must make an Int or Cha saving throw; use the ability most appropriate to the spellcasters class. The DC equals 10 + the size of the patch in 10 ft. squares (see Organization, above). For example, if a wizard tries to cast a spell near a 30-square-foot patch of witch grass, she must make a successful {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. If the save succeeds, the spell is cast normally. If the saving throw fails, the spell is not cast but the spell slot is not expended. Only arcane magic is affected.

optionalfeature.name: Sever Silver Cord
entries: When an astral shark scores a critical hit with its bite, in addition to the normal effects of a critical hit, the target creature must attempt a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. Failure indicates that the astral shark severed the silver cord connecting the target's astral form to its material body, and the target creature dies instantly.
optionalfeature.effect: When an astral shark scores a critical hit with its bite, in addition to the normal effects of a critical hit, the target creature must attempt a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw. Failure indicates that the astral shark severed the silver cord connecting the target's astral form to its material body, and the target creature dies instantly.

optionalfeature.name: Selective Immunity
entries: When an attack or effect deals fire damage to the toad, the toad can choose to take the fire damage as if it were not immune.
optionalfeature.effect: When an attack or effect deals fire damage to the toad, the toad can choose to take the fire damage as if it were not immune.

optionalfeature.name: Psychic Tower
entries: When an attack that causes psychic damage is directed against the spawn, the attack rebounds against the attacker. Resolve the attack as if the attacker were the original target and using the star spawn's ability modifiers and proficiency bonus rather than the original attacker's.
optionalfeature.effect: When an attack that causes psychic damage is directed against the spawn, the attack rebounds against the attacker. Resolve the attack as if the attacker were the original target and using the star spawn's ability modifiers and proficiency bonus rather than the original attacker's.

optionalfeature.name: Stand Guard
entries: When an elusa hound knocks a target {@condition prone}, it can choose to grapple the target automatically. The target can't stand up unless it first escapes the grapple. While the hound has a target {@condition grappled}, it can bite only that creature.
optionalfeature.effect: When an elusa hound knocks a target {@condition prone}, it can choose to grapple the target automatically. The target can't stand up unless it first escapes the grapple. While the hound has a target {@condition grappled}, it can bite only that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Unhallowed Aura
entries: When an undead creature within 30 feet of a gnarlwood attacks or makes a saving throw, it can roll {@dice 1d4} along with its {@dice d20} and add the results together.
optionalfeature.effect: When an undead creature within 30 feet of a gnarlwood attacks or makes a saving throw, it can roll {@dice 1d4} along with its {@dice d20} and add the results together.

optionalfeature.name: Discorporation
entries: When Asmodeus drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to his domain in Nessus, the bottommost layer of the Nine Hells, and is unable to take physical form for a time.
optionalfeature.effect: When Asmodeus drops to 0 hit points or dies, his body is destroyed but his essence travels back to his domain in Nessus, the bottommost layer of the Nine Hells, and is unable to take physical form for a time.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Defense
entries: When attacked with melee attacks using metal weapons or ranged attacks using metallic projectiles, a lodestone marauder can choose to cause the attacks to have advantage or disadvantage to hit.
optionalfeature.effect: When attacked with melee attacks using metal weapons or ranged attacks using metallic projectiles, a lodestone marauder can choose to cause the attacks to have advantage or disadvantage to hit.

optionalfeature.name: Dimensional Reach
entries: When attacking with its claws, the golothoma can reach through bents in space and attack creatures much further away than the length of its limbs may suggest. When taking an attack action or using its multiattack to attack with its claws, the golothoma's claws have a reach of 120 feet.
optionalfeature.effect: When attacking with its claws, the golothoma can reach through bents in space and attack creatures much further away than the length of its limbs may suggest. When taking an attack action or using its multiattack to attack with its claws, the golothoma's claws have a reach of 120 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Confounding Ugliness
entries: When confronting a mirror hag at any range, a creature must make a choice at the start of each of its turns: either avert its eyes so that it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag until the start of its next turn, or look at the hag and make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Failure on the saving throw leaves the character {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.
optionalfeature.effect: When confronting a mirror hag at any range, a creature must make a choice at the start of each of its turns: either avert its eyes so that it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the hag until the start of its next turn, or look at the hag and make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. Failure on the saving throw leaves the character {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Cryptobiosis
entries: When exposed to an environment or effect that is lethal to the waterbear over time, such as an environment that lacks breathable water, being frozen solid, or taking poison damage over time, the waterbear enters a state of suspended animation. While in this state, the waterbear is {@condition unconscious} but immune to any environmental effects, as well as poison and necrotic damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. Any such ongoing effect is suspended but not removed. The cryptobiotic state ends as soon as conditions become tolerable for the waterbear. The waterbear can remain in this state for up to 30 years. If it remains in this state longer, it dies.
optionalfeature.effect: When exposed to an environment or effect that is lethal to the waterbear over time, such as an environment that lacks breathable water, being frozen solid, or taking poison damage over time, the waterbear enters a state of suspended animation. While in this state, the waterbear is {@condition unconscious} but immune to any environmental effects, as well as poison and necrotic damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. Any such ongoing effect is suspended but not removed. The cryptobiotic state ends as soon as conditions become tolerable for the waterbear. The waterbear can remain in this state for up to 30 years. If it remains in this state longer, it dies.

optionalfeature.name: Strafing Run
entries: When flying, the kobold air cavalry can take the Dash action as a bonus action on its turn.
optionalfeature.effect: When flying, the kobold air cavalry can take the Dash action as a bonus action on its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Hag Coven
entries: When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.
optionalfeature.effect: When hags must work together, they form covens, in spite of their selfish natures. A coven is made up of hags of any type, all of whom are equals within the group. However, each of the hags continues to desire more personal power.

optionalfeature.name: Glamoured Illusion
entries: When he casts an illusion spell, the satyr can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. He can change the object on its turn as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 10 minutes. The object can't deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.
optionalfeature.effect: When he casts an illusion spell, the satyr can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real. He can change the object on its turn as a bonus action while the spell is ongoing. The object remains real for 10 minutes. The object can't deal damage or otherwise directly harm anyone.

optionalfeature.name: Bone Wrack
entries: When hit by the slow storm's slam or breath weapon attack, the storm absorbs moisture from the living creatures' joints, causing stiffness and pain. In addition to {@dice 1d4} Dexterity drain, any creature caught within the slow storm's breath weapon that fails another {@dc 18} Constitution save suffers crushing pain in bones and joints. Any round in which the pained creature moves, it takes {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage per 5 feet moved. Bone wracking pain lasts until the affected creature regains at least 1 point of lost Dexterity.
optionalfeature.effect: When hit by the slow storm's slam or breath weapon attack, the storm absorbs moisture from the living creatures' joints, causing stiffness and pain. In addition to {@dice 1d4} Dexterity drain, any creature caught within the slow storm's breath weapon that fails another {@dc 18} Constitution save suffers crushing pain in bones and joints. Any round in which the pained creature moves, it takes {@dice 1d4} necrotic damage per 5 feet moved. Bone wracking pain lasts until the affected creature regains at least 1 point of lost Dexterity.

optionalfeature.name: Flare
entries: When immersed in magical darkness, a skull lantern emits a brilliant flash of light powerful enough to dispel magical darkness in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself, illuminating the area with bright light for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
optionalfeature.effect: When immersed in magical darkness, a skull lantern emits a brilliant flash of light powerful enough to dispel magical darkness in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself, illuminating the area with bright light for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Beautiful Craftwork
entries: When immobile, the swarm is indistinguishable from a collection of cunningly-made statuettes or jewelry.
optionalfeature.effect: When immobile, the swarm is indistinguishable from a collection of cunningly-made statuettes or jewelry.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Shadows
entries: When in an area of dim light or darkness, the deathlock can use an action to become {@condition invisible} until it moves or takes an action or reaction.
optionalfeature.effect: When in an area of dim light or darkness, the deathlock can use an action to become {@condition invisible} until it moves or takes an action or reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Born Of Shadows
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the shadow fey poisoner is {@condition invisible}.
optionalfeature.effect: When in dim light or darkness, the shadow fey poisoner is {@condition invisible}.

optionalfeature.name: Shroud Stealth
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the shroud can take the Hide action as a bonus action.
optionalfeature.effect: When in dim light or darkness, the shroud can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Blend
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the umbral vampire can Hide as a bonus action, even while being observed.
optionalfeature.effect: When in dim light or darkness, the umbral vampire can Hide as a bonus action, even while being observed.

optionalfeature.name: Shadowborn
entries: When in lighting other than bright light, the Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and she can hide even while being observed.
optionalfeature.effect: When in lighting other than bright light, the Queen of Night and Magic has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide, and she can hide even while being observed.

optionalfeature.name: Swarm Form
entries: When in swarm form it can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small slime. When in swarm form it automatically fails saving throws on area of effects that target its entire space, and gains resistance to blugeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When in swarm form it can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a small slime. When in swarm form it automatically fails saving throws on area of effects that target its entire space, and gains resistance to blugeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Pool Form
entries: When in the form of a single Large slime, it has vulnerabilty to piercing weapons, its speed is 15 feet, its Strength and Dexterity are swapped (also reducing it's AC).
optionalfeature.effect: When in the form of a single Large slime, it has vulnerabilty to piercing weapons, its speed is 15 feet, its Strength and Dexterity are swapped (also reducing it's AC).

optionalfeature.name: Cursed Existence
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points in desert terrain, the accursed defiler's body disintegrates into sand and a sudden parched breeze. However, unless it was killed in a hallowed location, with radiant damage, or by a blessed creature, the accursed defiler reforms at the next sundown {@dice 1d100} miles away in a random direction.
optionalfeature.effect: When it drops to 0 hit points in desert terrain, the accursed defiler's body disintegrates into sand and a sudden parched breeze. However, unless it was killed in a hallowed location, with radiant damage, or by a blessed creature, the accursed defiler reforms at the next sundown {@dice 1d100} miles away in a random direction.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Smite (2/Day)
entries: When it hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the ramadeen can channel divine light to deal 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When it hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the ramadeen can channel divine light to deal 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Smite (2/Day)
entries: When it hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the ramadeen can channel divine light to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When it hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the ramadeen can channel divine light to deal 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage.

optionalfeature.name: Discorporation
entries: When Lolth drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Abyss, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.
optionalfeature.effect: When Lolth drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Abyss, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

optionalfeature.name: Snake Belly
entries: When lying with its sensitive stomach on the ice, a lindwurm can sense approaching creatures by the vibrations they cause, granting them tremorsense.
optionalfeature.effect: When lying with its sensitive stomach on the ice, a lindwurm can sense approaching creatures by the vibrations they cause, granting them tremorsense.

optionalfeature.name: War Mage
entries: When making an opportunity attack, the dragonborn can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action instead of making a weapon attack. If this spell requires a ranged attack roll, the dragonborn doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources. This spell must only target the creature that provoked the opportunity attack.
optionalfeature.effect: When making an opportunity attack, the dragonborn can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action instead of making a weapon attack. If this spell requires a ranged attack roll, the dragonborn doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, though it may still have disadvantage from other sources. This spell must only target the creature that provoked the opportunity attack.

optionalfeature.name: Mounted Warrior
entries: When mounted, the ghost knight has advantage on attacks against unmounted creatures smaller than its mount. If the ghost knight's mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to take half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw, the mount instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and half damage if it fails.
optionalfeature.effect: When mounted, the ghost knight has advantage on attacks against unmounted creatures smaller than its mount. If the ghost knight's mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to take half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw, the mount instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Mounted Attacks
entries: When mounted, the kobold beast master has advantage on attacks made against Medium or smaller creatures who are on foot.
optionalfeature.effect: When mounted, the kobold beast master has advantage on attacks made against Medium or smaller creatures who are on foot.

optionalfeature.name: Night Journey
entries: When outdoors at night, a buraq's vision is not limited by nonmagical darkness. Once per month, the buraq can declare it is on a night journey; for the next 24 hours, it can use its Teleport once per round. Its destination must always be in an area of nonmagical darkness within its line of sight. At any point during the night journey, as a bonus action, the buraq can return itself and its rider to the location where it began the night journey.
optionalfeature.effect: When outdoors at night, a buraq's vision is not limited by nonmagical darkness. Once per month, the buraq can declare it is on a night journey; for the next 24 hours, it can use its Teleport once per round. Its destination must always be in an area of nonmagical darkness within its line of sight. At any point during the night journey, as a bonus action, the buraq can return itself and its rider to the location where it began the night journey.

optionalfeature.name: Hail of Needles (1/Day)
entries: When reduced below 10 hp (even below 0 hp), the cactid releases a hail of needles as a reaction. All creatures within 15 feet take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.
optionalfeature.effect: When reduced below 10 hp (even below 0 hp), the cactid releases a hail of needles as a reaction. All creatures within 15 feet take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage, or half damage with a successful {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Reanimation
entries: When reduced to 0 hit points, a cadaver is not destroyed; rather it falls inert and begins regaining 1 hit point per round. Hit points lost to magical weapons or spells are not regained. When the creature reaches its full hit point total (minus damage dealt by magical attacks and weapons), it reassembles itself and stands up, ready to fight again. Scattering or even destroying the pieces of its body don't prevent it from magically reassembling and reanimating. If gentle repose is cast on the cadaver when it is at 0 hit points, it can't reanimate. A bless spell delays the reanimation, causing the creature to regain 1 hit point per minute instead of per round.
optionalfeature.effect: When reduced to 0 hit points, a cadaver is not destroyed; rather it falls inert and begins regaining 1 hit point per round. Hit points lost to magical weapons or spells are not regained. When the creature reaches its full hit point total (minus damage dealt by magical attacks and weapons), it reassembles itself and stands up, ready to fight again. Scattering or even destroying the pieces of its body don't prevent it from magically reassembling and reanimating. If gentle repose is cast on the cadaver when it is at 0 hit points, it can't reanimate. A bless spell delays the reanimation, causing the creature to regain 1 hit point per minute instead of per round.

optionalfeature.name: Reform
entries: When reduced to 0 hit points, a lava weird dissolves into its lava pool. One minute later, it reforms with full hit points minus any hit points it lost to cold damage in the preceding 24 hours.
optionalfeature.effect: When reduced to 0 hit points, a lava weird dissolves into its lava pool. One minute later, it reforms with full hit points minus any hit points it lost to cold damage in the preceding 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Psionic Conduit
entries: When Sardior casts a spell with his Innate Spellcasting (Psionics) feature, he can treat any Sardorian golem on the same plane of existence as the spell's point of origin. If he wishes, he can also speak through the mouth of any Sardorian golem on any plane of existence.
optionalfeature.effect: When Sardior casts a spell with his Innate Spellcasting (Psionics) feature, he can treat any Sardorian golem on the same plane of existence as the spell's point of origin. If he wishes, he can also speak through the mouth of any Sardorian golem on any plane of existence.

optionalfeature.name: Divine Resurrection
entries: When Sardior dies, his body vanishes in a shower of ruby scales and his essence merges with that of his oldest thane (Hrodel). This thane retreats to safety and begins the slow transformation into Sardior, retaining her old memories and gaining Sardior's. All remaining thanes instantly sense Sardior's death.
optionalfeature.effect: When Sardior dies, his body vanishes in a shower of ruby scales and his essence merges with that of his oldest thane (Hrodel). This thane retreats to safety and begins the slow transformation into Sardior, retaining her old memories and gaining Sardior's. All remaining thanes instantly sense Sardior's death.

optionalfeature.name: Safe Fall
entries: When she falls, the Queen of Cats lands on her feet and takes no damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When she falls, the Queen of Cats lands on her feet and takes no damage.

optionalfeature.name: Stability
entries: When standing on solid ground, the bonespur has advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks to resist being moved or knocked {@condition prone}.
optionalfeature.effect: When standing on solid ground, the bonespur has advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Athletics) checks to resist being moved or knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Link with Caster
entries: When summoned, an aerial servant creates a mental link between itself and the caster who summoned it. Should the aerial servant fail the mission it was assigned, it returns to the caster and attacks him. The aerial servant can find the caster as long as they are on the same plane of existence. If the caster leaves the plane, the link is temporarily broken. If the two are again on the same plane of existence, the link is immediately re-established and the aerial servant moves at full speed toward the caster's location. The link is broken permanently only when the aerial servant or the caster is destroyed.
optionalfeature.effect: When summoned, an aerial servant creates a mental link between itself and the caster who summoned it. Should the aerial servant fail the mission it was assigned, it returns to the caster and attacks him. The aerial servant can find the caster as long as they are on the same plane of existence. If the caster leaves the plane, the link is temporarily broken. If the two are again on the same plane of existence, the link is immediately re-established and the aerial servant moves at full speed toward the caster's location. The link is broken permanently only when the aerial servant or the caster is destroyed.

optionalfeature.name: Geyser
entries: When summoned, the Pillar of Water appears in a 10-by-10-foot space. All creatures in that area must make Dexterity saving throws. On a failure, a creature is suspended in the column of water. On a success, a creature is pushed to an empty space adjacent to the pillar.
optionalfeature.effect: When summoned, the Pillar of Water appears in a 10-by-10-foot space. All creatures in that area must make Dexterity saving throws. On a failure, a creature is suspended in the column of water. On a success, a creature is pushed to an empty space adjacent to the pillar.

optionalfeature.name: Quivering Palm (Recharges After a Long Rest)
entries: When the adept hits a creature with an unarmed strike, it can apply hidden (but lethal) vibrations to their body. These vibrations last for 14 ({@dice 4d6}) days or until the adept uses this action on another creature, after which the effects end harmlessly. Otherwise, the adept can use its action to force the target to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage. The adept can also choose to end the vibrations harmlessly as an action.
optionalfeature.effect: When the adept hits a creature with an unarmed strike, it can apply hidden (but lethal) vibrations to their body. These vibrations last for 14 ({@dice 4d6}) days or until the adept uses this action on another creature, after which the effects end harmlessly. Otherwise, the adept can use its action to force the target to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage. The adept can also choose to end the vibrations harmlessly as an action.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Death
entries: When the afflicted cave goblin is reduced to 0 hit points, fungal spores explode, creating a 20-foot-radius cloud centered on its body. All creatures that start their turn in the fungal cloud must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become infected with goblin's trumpet (see Goblin's Trumpet).
optionalfeature.effect: When the afflicted cave goblin is reduced to 0 hit points, fungal spores explode, creating a 20-foot-radius cloud centered on its body. All creatures that start their turn in the fungal cloud must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become infected with goblin's trumpet (see Goblin's Trumpet).

optionalfeature.name: Alchemic Blood
entries: When the alkahzir takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the alkazir takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When the alkahzir takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the alkazir takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Death
entries: When the ant is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes in a burst of acid. Each creature within 5 feet of the ant must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.
optionalfeature.effect: When the ant is reduced to 0 hp, it explodes in a burst of acid. Each creature within 5 feet of the ant must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: When the ape hits a creature with its claw attack, it can immediately use its bonus action to teleport upto 15 feet
optionalfeature.effect: When the ape hits a creature with its claw attack, it can immediately use its bonus action to teleport upto 15 feet

optionalfeature.name: Elude Chance (3/Day)
entries: When the arcadian avenger fails a saving throw or misses on an attack roll, it can choose to reroll the save or attack.
optionalfeature.effect: When the arcadian avenger fails a saving throw or misses on an attack roll, it can choose to reroll the save or attack.

optionalfeature.name: Curving Shot
entries: When the arcane archer makes a ranged attack roll and misses, it can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.
optionalfeature.effect: When the arcane archer makes a ranged attack roll and misses, it can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Core
entries: When the assassin is destroyed, its core explodes, projecting superheated steam and shrapnel. Each creature within 5 feet of the construct must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
optionalfeature.effect: When the assassin is destroyed, its core explodes, projecting superheated steam and shrapnel. Each creature within 5 feet of the construct must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Attack
entries: When the astral stalker has advantage on attack rolls, or attacks a surprised target, its attacks deal an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage each.
optionalfeature.effect: When the astral stalker has advantage on attack rolls, or attacks a surprised target, its attacks deal an additional 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage each.

optionalfeature.name: Locking Jaws
entries: When the aurumvorax bites a creature and locks its jaws, the aurumvorax enters that creature's space. The aurumvorax can't move on its own while its jaws are locked, but it moves with the other creature.
